It has a dual-channel memory controller and will handle 1333/1600 memory up to 32 GB.Like the i5, this has a built-in GPU. Here it's Intel's HD4000 graphics, which isn't too shabby! The base clock is 650 MHz that can dynamically bump to 1.1 GHz, so yes, it will play games in stock form, just don't expect high frame rates and high settings. For low to medium on demanding games, it will be playable. The i5 has the HD2500 graphics, which aren't as good. This also has Intel's VT-x virtualization.As far as performance, on a machine with 2 DVI monitors, 8 GB 1333 MHz RAM, and discrete graphics card, it's smoking fast. The fastest machine I've ever used. Faster than the i5 with 1600 MHz RAM and premium motherboard. There was almost zero lag when opening applications (like word, and first launch of Outlook). Enterprise software that is hard on CPU's like Microsoft Exchange, some dental practice or medical practice software won't bog this down either. Quickbooks Enterprise, which is a pig and is hard on even dual-core processors, is tamed by the i7. iTunes encoding is ridiculously fast, and any game you throw at this BF3 online, Crysis 3, Metro, Skyrym (with a good GPU) will give you the highest frame rates possible. The hyper threading is kind of useless unless you're doing things with programs that are multi-threaded, which I don't use much, but from what I hear, that makes the 3370 one of the fastest quad cores out there. It also ran very cool. The fan never revved so high it was obnoxiously loud. The included PWM controlled Intel cooler is really good.My only gripe is that it cost $330 in a tray. Even inside a PC, it bumped the cost of the otherwise affordable ASUS desktop to over $800. It begs the question...do you really need this much firepower? For most users, the answer is probably no.Take the smoking-fast i5-3570k and add hyper threading and 2 MB of cache for an extra $115? Really? The performance gains are negligible with just about everything, including games. However for non-gaming applications requiring a stout CPU (video/audio/CAD, etc.), you will probably need the extra performance. If you need anything more, spend an extra $300 on an i7-3930K Sandy Bridge-E 6-core with hyper threading and quad-channel memory support for 64 GB. That will handle any job out there.Pros:Super-fastIntel 3rd-gen Ivy Bridge architectureDecent Intel HD4000 on-chip graphicsLow 77 W TDP8 MB L3 cacheSupport for 1600 MHz 32 GB DDR3 RAMHyper threadingIntel VT-xTurbo-Boost v 2.0Runs coolCons:Cost. It's too expensive.So, it's a stupid-fast CPU. It will handle any job out there (short of ultra high-end applications requiring special hardware,  quad-channel RAM, etc.), give you the richest gaming experience possible, and do it efficiently...just like an i5-3470 or 3570K. In terms of value for dollar, I can't recommend it. Save $115, get the i5, and use the extra cash on a graphics card or other upgrade. Use it on some pickles. Either way, it's an awesome CPU. If you can swing it, get it!

I run this alongside the older, discontinued LJ 1012. The LJ 1020 is an update to the 1012, and has a lot (thankfully) of the same features as the older model. It's still very compact (small enough to fit on any desk) at less than 15"x10"x10" has HP's "instant on" fuser (which stays on even when idle for faster startup), and the really versatile software of the 1012. It's still compatible with Win. 98 SE and up. The difference between the 1012 and 1020 is in the hardware. The processor is now up to 234 MHz from 133 MHz, but it has less RAM (2 MB instead of 8 MB). There isn't a discernible difference in print speeds between the two either, still around 15 ppm for text and text/graphics. Not stellar, but similar to competitors. The best part of that is the first page is out in under 10 seconds. From the click of "print" to the first page (I measured it) was 7 seconds. The main tray holds 150 pages, the output tray holds around 120, and there's a 10-page fold-out tray for one-off jobs or envelopes, or other special needs. It's also easy to use. No complicated setup needed. There are just 3 buttons on the front for clearing errors, resuming or canceling print jobs.The resolution hasn't changed either: the default 600 dpi and a bump mode to 1200 dpi using the software. We mostly print packing slips, labels, and other documents with it, and it does a great job. The text came out very crisp and sharp. Graphics looked okay, but nowhere near an inkjet and a little lower than some comparable models from other makers but you'll pay more, around $20-40). The 1020 doesn't have a network card like the 1012 so it's USB only, but there's still no USB cable included which is weird. This cost almost $190 and still no $5 cable included? Get real HP. If you want to use it on a network, just share it (the host PC will need to stay on and out from underneath any kind of firewall or anti virus program that blocks network sharing). No need to complain about no NIC, as this wasn't designed to be an office-wide machine, but a personal laser jet for a single user or two. HP says 2,000 pages on a single toner (You can get toner for this for ridiculously cheap, like under $40) and a duty cycle (per month) of 5,000 jobs. Certainly not major-caliber output, but again, this isn't that type of machine. If you want/need that, go buy one designed for high-output, high usage. It's also quiet as there's no cooling fan, but the lack of a fan does hurt print speeds when printing a lot. If you print jobs of 30 pages in fast succession, the print speed will slow and it might need a cool-down period between jobs. Again, shouldn't be an issue since this machine isn't a high-volume design.Pros:Retains the 1012's useful featuresBump in processing speed to 234 MHzSmall, compact and lightGood print speedsExcellent quality textFirst page out in under 10 secondsToner can be had for cheapUseful software suiteSimple to useCons:Print quality for graphics needs workNo USB cable included (again!)Still no network capabilityPrint speed slows down under heavy use to prevent overheatingSo it's a really nice, low-cost, no-frills laser printer for your desk or small workgroup if needed. Don't expect fast printing, high duty cycles, or high-resolution graphics as you won't get it. What you do get is a reliable printer that's easy to use and economical that prints good and won't cost a ton to keep running. I highly recommend it. We really like it at work too!

HP practically wrote the book on small home office and large business printing and document management and it shows with the Laserjet 1012. I have had some less-than-stellar experiences with other HP printers (inkjet and laser), but have generally been satisfied with them. I have 5 of these sitting around my office and have used the LJ 1012 a lot and have grown quite fond of it.First, it's small, under 15 inches wide, 9 inches thick, and 8 inches tall so it fits on a desk perfectly. It also weighs about 13 lbs, so it's lightweight. This is a laser printer, so it takes toner. The toners last a long time and are pretty inexpensive, less than $30, which is about the same price as a single inkjet cartridge that won't last as long. It's made mostly of high-strength polystyrene and ABS plastic so it's tough and will last a long time. There are 1012's in use today after almost 10 years of constant use and tens of thousands of pages. The printer is connected with a USB only, so there's no network card for connecting to a network. That's not too much of a hassle though if you must print over a network since you can set up printer sharing and use it from another PC on the network. It's super-simple to use. There's no complicated settings to fiddle with, just two buttons to print a status/configuration page, cancel a job, and 3 LED indicator lights for print and printer status (attention, go, and ready). There's a simple on-off switch on the back that's out of the way and maybe a little inconvenient to use.On the hardware side, the LJ1012 has a 133 MHz processor and 8 MB of RAM for caching documents and quick spooling. Although it's not major-caliber hardware, it's good enough for a small office, or for a workstation needing a printer that can't access to a networked printer. HP says that a toner will be good for 2000 pages and 5000 jobs per month. I can concur that, but you may be able to stretch it even further with higher capacity toners. Changing the toner is very easy.The software aspect of the printer helps it out with some very useful features. Setup wasn't too hard, but isn't seamless. Also, You get a power cable, but HP doesn't include a USB cable. Seriously? The cable costs $5 and you can't include one in a $100+ printer?A word on drivers...there is no driver for this printer available from HP for Windows 7. Kind of annoying, but you have to tell Windows to install it from it's list of compatible drivers when you're ready to install it. The software set can be used with a PC or a Mac (some features aren't available on a Mac at the time of the 1012's introduction, but I don't use this with my Mac so I can't comment) includes utilities and customizable features such as pre-formatted watermark (confidential, draft, and others), duplexing (manual) that's helped by images on the print utility showing how load the paper (it prints on brochures and documents). There's a fold-out priority tray for printing single documents or on envelopes or labels. The main tray holds 150 sheets of letter paper. The priority tray handles 10 pages at a time.Performance is good. We use a few of these for printing documents, packing slips/invoices, and shipping labels. I saw 14'ish pages per minute with the first page out in under 10 seconds. Not bad! My Dell 3115 takes about 1 minute to warm up and calibrate before the first page is out from idle. The fuser is "always on" so there's no warmup period like on other laser printers. However, if you're doing volume printing, the speed will slow down quite a bit to prevent it from overheating since there's no fan to keep things cool. That's actually an advantage as the 1012 sips electricity and is really quiet. The printing noise isn't obtrusive, but it's not real quiet either. Print quality is on par with others in the class I've noticed. 600 dpi that can be bumped to 1200 using the configuration utility. I noticed a difference, but it wasn't huge. Tiny font is legible but not super-chrisp unlike regular fonts which look really nice. Graphics also come out really nice, although this isn't a high-res printer and doesn't print high-res graphics.Pros:Compact and lightweightAffordableFast first page outDecent print quality for graphics. Excellent for text.QuietLow power consumptionEasy to useIncluded software makes the printer very versatile with useful featuresCons:Low duty cycle of 5000 jobs/monthNo Windows 7 driverToner could last longerPaper tray only holds 150 pagesSome Windows software utilities aren't available on Mac'sNo USB cable in the boxNo cooling fan so print output drops during large jobsOverall a very nice office or even home machine. Compact with good performance, the 1012 might be discontinued, but is still an excellent laser for the money. We love it.

For me Ms Joyce never lets me down.  While this one was a little different take on the usual grizzly shifter fare, it quite possibly one of the best I have read.  I loved the idea that Ian and his two brothers were so much like a regular bear in many ways.  For instance, their bodies required them to hibernate for 6 months out of the year.  No, if want to stuff, their bodies at sixteen went into their first hibernation and every year thereafter, it just demanded they stop and go to sleep.  Needless to say that little detail could put a damper on finding and keep your true mate.In Ian's case it is one very human Elyse Abram who has put an ad in the local paper for a none romantic partner/marriage in exchange for partnership in her homestead and being her husband.  All she needs is a strong back and good hygiene and some one who is self sufficient during the long cold winters.  What she gets is Ian who has shown up on her doorsteps to give her a letter from her crazy ex-boyfriend/wolf shifter whom Ian was ordered to put down due to his insanity and killing of human.It a very interesting and hot, sexy, and in some ways tragic ride to a wonderful and satisfying ending.  I loved it and I think you will too.

This is one of the continuation stories from the Shifters Between my Sheets book.  It the story David Landon's brother Jack Landon and his human mate Tiana Lopez.  I have to tell it's a great romance/shifter/murder mystery.  I am usually pretty good a figuring out these mystery type stories but I have to say this one was almost at the end before I figured out who the murderer was.I was glued to the pages all the way through.  It is fast moving and infuriating and funny and scary and all the things a good story should be.  I think you are going to enjoy the ride in this one.  My advise is don't let this one pass you by.  I know I wouldn't and if you knew what I do neither would you.Read and Enjoy

I REALLY GIVE THIS ONE A 4.50 STARS.When office drudge Candice Gray takes her usually vacation she finds herself the witness to a shifter murder in the wildness.  I mean one minute she is happily painting the local fauna and bang shots ring out.  She comes down the slope where she is perched to find a huge grizzly bear bleeding out and see two shadowy men who tell to get away.  She tries to get up the slope and cannot climb up the steep incline.  When she comes sliding down it is to come face to face with a human corpse and a Game Warden who at first thinks she might have had something to do with the murder.From there she becomes not only a witness to the murder but a victim.  Through it all Wyatt's grizzly is screaming she's his mate and the two murderers are out to kill her.It's a great and nicely told story and I know you will love it

While the first two were pretty good beginning this one is the clincher of the entire group.  There are many, many surprises coming your way in this one.  I will not spoil it for you but hand onto your seats ladies this one is full of surprised and action.I will tell that no surprise Elam's step-mother tries to do in Emma in an attempt to keep Galen from splitting from the pack.  She thinks if Emma dies it will kille Elam and make Galen the alpha.  That is only one of the many surprises in the fast moving conclusion to this series.  I know you will be surprised and enjoy the story as much as I did.

This one picks up were part one in the Shifter Between My Sheets story left off.  With Elam and Emma being thrush into the ruling position of the pack.  There are many problems and a good deal of conflict between Elam and his brother and Galen.  Galen has asked to leave the pack and take some of the members and his mother and true mate with him.It is an exciting addition but also ends in a cliffhanger ending.  Since I really like this one I bought that one as well.

For 99 cents this is a great value.  There was only one of the stories I didn't read, because it's not something I am interested in gay romance.  There were also a couple of cliff hanger stories in this grouping, but they were so interesting that I actually did buy the next story.  One was Alpha divided and the other was Honey bear something and I bought the next on Honey bear Wine.I think for the money and the amount of very original stories in the grouping you cannot go wrong.  My advise is buy and enjoy them.

A very different take on the wolf shifters.  It has some really unique things that I have not read before.  The one I found particularly interesting was that no matter how the human partner was when they found their true mate they reverted to about age 25 to 30 once the mating ritual was completed.  Also the wolf was able to gift their mate longeverity, all their magic powers including mind speak.In this one billionaire Cade has been waiting for 200 hundred years for his mate.  His mother is part gypsy and a part witch.  She has portioned the Goddess on behalf of her son and a meeting is set in the works for him to meat Anna a human divorcee with two grown children and also past the age of reproduction.  It is an interesting and intricate story of the two soul mates.  ALso there are complications between Anna's ex husband and her two grown sons.Over all it is a nice done story and one that I know I found to be exciting and fun and I loved the uniqueness of the story as well.  I think you will too.

Karel, head of security for Alyx, calls Gerry with an urgent need for a mate.  For who, she asks?  Me. He answers.  He then proceeds to tell her he needs this mate within days as his mother is dying and he wants to present her with a daughter before it happens.  The problem is Gerry can't go back to Aurora in time.  So, Karel travels to earth to find his mate.Problem is Gerry doesn't have his mate found yet  Then she meets the perfect candidate in a bakery.  Alivia has been using dating services for years looking for the perfect man.  All she seems to get is creeps and losers who treat her like dirt.  Gerry offers her the opportunity to meet the perfect match for her but Ali is not impressed and totally off men.  That is until she bumps into Gerry and Karel coming out of her building and the whistles and bells go off the race to the gate is on.You will love this one too.  I sure did

Once again Gerry is playing intermediary between earthlings who are living on Aurora.  Charlotte has married the wolves of Ice Mountains and Gerry is left with the task of telling her sister Rebecca that she will not be coming back to earth.  Rebecca is really upset and during a video call with her sister Charlotte arrangements are made for Rebecca to visitThe visit is set up quickly as Gerry's next client is in desperate need and life of death situation.  Vikter king of the dragons is literally dying as his dragon withdraws from him because he has failed to form the mate bond with his true mate.  When that happens the dragon dies and the human follows him into death.  Gerry's service are urgently needed as it is now only a matter of weeks if not days before Vikter is gone.Rebecca is the answer but can Gerry get this pig headed stubborn dragon man to connect in time with Rebecca.  It looks like it might be Gerry's first failure?  Read and See what you think of this one.

Gerry's next assignment is for a pair of wolf shifters, Brec and Eros who must be mated before they are fifty.  Brec the Alpha and Eros the Omega must find one mate to share who will complete their Triad union and help to rule their section of Aurora, the Cold Mountainous terrain of the planet.When Gerry returns to earth to inform Charlotte, Bella's best friend that she will not be returning to earth, Gerry arranges for Charlotte to go to Aurora to visit with Bella.  Of course, that is not the only reason for her generosity.  Gerry knows that the two wolves answer to their prayer is one Charlotte.  But, can they get her to fall for them as a pair and stay to be their mate.Read, and Enjoy this wonderful, whimsical and very fun story.

I have to say you have to love a paranormal dating agency that has such hot clientele and such phenomenal results.  Gerry Wilde is probably the best dating master matchmaker of all time.This one is the story of Alyx the King of Aurora, a planet light years from earth and the source of all shifter life on earth.  Gerry is one of these shifters and travels between planets with the easy of a time warp.  Alyx is in need of a bride or he will have to step down.  Gerry has offered to help him many times but he is determined to find his own mate.  Needless to say this has not gone well and his time is almost out.Gerry hires Isabella as her new assistant and when she gets the urgent call from Aurora that her services are desperately sort she takes Bella with her.  This is were it becomes a really interesting and very fun ride.  When Bella meets Trey the show is on and the race has tires spinning.I absolutely adored this story and the two main characters were such fun and price less together.  I know you will love it.

I like the story and the characters in it.  I thought the idea of a bride in full regalia without a winter coat in the wilds of Alaska was a very unique idea.  The fact that she has amnesia as well is also a great twist.  The reclusive Bear shifter, ALex, who goes to great lengths to avoid human contact finds that some times S**T Happens and you have to roll with the fall out.His bear is in uproar as this is his mate and he determined to claim her against all odds.  Their journey is just about to begin and the lust is thick in the air and both are captured in it's clutchesWhen armed gun men shoot his dog and try to take back his runaway bride life takes another twist.  Alex decides to investigate where she was being held and by whom.  Things just heat up to boiling as he and bride begin an arduous and perilous journey in to the tundra to find the answer to this mystery.

The dreams are supposed to appear in age order but the Goddess has a different agenda.  When Lia, the youngest of the Carmichael saber tooth tiger shifts arrived at Caleb's club, she is expecting to meet her brother in law, but what she gets is a whiff of her true mate.  She assaults one of the guests when she smells his scent all over her.  All hell breaks loose and the meeting has to be postponed while they try to corral Lia and stop a war.Turns out that Lia is >>>>>>>>..  you got it the true mate of Caleb, Vampire extrordinaire and Aubrey's brother.  It's a quite a ride especially when the sibling that should have been next in line is passed over by the Goddess.  I think you will like this one too.

It seems when Alaric find his mate in Aubrey, it starts a ripple effect for his siblings.  The three sibs go to the shifter hotel run by Aubrey's brother.  Aubrey has sent her best friend Gretchen, a she-wolf to take care of their room requirements and anything else they need.  The minute Gretchen and Slade lock eyes it's lights out of Slade.Slade is next in line for the dreams that will never come as his mate is dropped into to his lap and his reaction to the shock is quite a surprise to him and his sister and brother.  But fate will not be denied and the mating ritual begins with he and Gretchen.  It is quite a cute and fun story and I think you will like it.

The story of  a rare saber tooth tiger Alaric, and his three siblings.  Alaric is searching for his true mate.  She has been appearing nightly in his dreams for over the past year.  His job is the foil that he is using to find the fated mate. Turns out she is about to be dropped in his lap and is  a Human and the  sister to a Vampire leader, Aubrey.  Aubrey is no stranger to shifter's  Her brother was turned by a one night stand and then when his parents tried to avenge his change both were killed by the vamps.Caleb fought and kept the  vamps from changing his sister giving her a chance at a normal life.  Things change quickly when she is invited to prize fight by the shifters and is immediately scent by Alaric as being his true mate that he has been having dreams about for a year.  Much to the happiness of his sister and his two brothers as they will now each in turn have the mating dreams that will lead them to their true mates.While I loved this story it need more conflict and more meat to make into a 5 star story.  Since I have read the next two I can say the also suffer to a degree with a lack of conflict.  I never like an over abundance of conflict but it needs to more than these stories had.  I will therefore have to rate them as 4 stars as well.  I am hoping the youngest brothers story is more meaty.
Great value and a great product.  Dog just loves them and we are very glad with the purchase.

The absolute best of the series has been saved for last.  This is Zach and Bailey's nurse Mindy story.  It's a mega good one.  I was breathless and teary eyed by both the sensitivity and finesse that the author used with these two characters.  Zach has been the thorn in all the true life mates sides throughout this story and he is about to met his match who will turn his world on it's ear.  In the process he will find the child he thought to never be able to find and also find that true life mates to exist and they are often human females.I absolutely loved this story and I know you will too.

Trevor and Bailey's story is up next.  Trevor is a volunteer fire fighter in town during the slow wild fire season.  He is called to the burning of a local hotel.  He can hear the screams for help but cannot find the person in the blaze who is screaming for his assistances.  When he final finds her is almost unconscious but manages to tell him that someone is trapped in the bathroom.  Trevor checks and finds a male who has smothered to death.  So he leaves him and takes the woman to safety.He leaves her in the care of the emergency rescue team and heads back to the hanger.  So, how you ask does he and Bailey his true mate manage to find each other again.  Well, you'll need to buy and read this one.  It's another good story.

Libby the local librarian and Luke the shy and disenchanted member of the crew find a spark of fire in the Riley's Sweet Crust pie shop.  She is immediately attracted and than turned off when she thinks the handsome guy is a bit of a jerk and maybe even a unschooled guy that she will have nothing in common with.Will they ever get together?  Luke is positive that she is his life mate but he like all the other males in the crew are a bit clueless when it comes to how to handle, get and keep a woman interested and happy  How will this all play out.  Buy and read .  These are andother set of wonderful characters who just are magic together.

The second is as good as the first.  +This one is Hunter and Riley's story.  When a a wildfire catches her deep within the forest and makes her quickly disoriented and races for her life, Hunter's bear is alerted to a shift in the air and the fact that his lifemate is about to become toast.  At the same time the wind shift causes the higher ups to order them out of the fire zone immediately.  Hunter defies a direct order and jumps from the rescue helicopter and rushes to find his mate.If you want the dets of this wonderful story you need to buy and read it.. It is one that will hold you and make you want to have all the crew find their mates.

A great beginning to the first of this series.  It is the story of Ian the alpha of the clan and Charlie the newest and most unwelcome member of the Wildfire jumpers crew.  The problem is Charlie isn't a he rather HE's a she, Charlotte and she just happens to be not only be human but Ian's life mate.Much to Zach his second in commands distrust and displeasure things between the two heat up quickly and suddenly Zach is sure the entire future of the crew is about to be exposed.  After a hot night on the picnic table that takes a pounding and collapses the crew is sure Charlotte is there to stay and Ian and Zach are at loggers head.  How will they resolve this impass.  Well I guess you'll just have to buy and read it like I did.  But I will tell you that I don't think you will sorry.

My god I didn't think it was possible to get any better, but Ms. Joyce has just out done herself with this story  It absolutely blew me away and took my socks with it.  Hot, dynamic and blow your mind sexy, way to go Damon.  He has turned out to be the best character of this entire group.  The Gray Back as a group have just made me fall in love with each of them, but I think Dragon Man, Damon is head and shoulders the best character ever.He might be a scary devil but his mate Clara is his equal and more.  I loved how the author has taken a once cold, draped in mystery dragon shifter and turned him into a warm, wonderful, personable dragon man.  With it she just turned the genre upside-down and backwards.  I can't imagine that any sci fi shifter lover would be eating this story up.

Just finished this one and I loved it  I thought the author did a wonderful job of portraying the sheriff and his clan in a very credible light.  I love the idea of Tara being a wanted fugitive by the FBI.I also thought that the dynamic between Axl and his brother, the alpha, Alec was extremely well done.  I like that while Alec seemed stuck in the old ways he was still able to see that Axl and Tara were meant to be together and that he instigated the means by which her father was reunited with her against the bad guy.It was a sexy, sweet and very nicely done story and I know you will love this one as much as I did.  I really want to see ALec story next.  While I Loved Cody, Remy and Gannon I think that Alec is the one that really needs to be loved and healed the most of the group and I want him to have his happily ever after next.BUY, READ, ENJOY.

First time reading this author, but I have to say I like the story and the characters.  The story is different and the characters are fun and amazing.  I loved the Guardian shifter Damon and of course Ava was an inspiration  Not only was she a powerful character she was a rare shifter species besides everything else.I have to say I will read this author again and I believe that since this one was a free be there is no way you can loose with this one.  I am sure that once you start to read it you will be glad you did.

Justin Masters and Trevor Shield have been raised as brothers and they have shared everything all their lives including their women.  They know that when their true mates come they will no longer share everything but that doesn't stop them in the meantime.When Justin is at the local bar and scents his true mate, he is enraged because he knows Trevor and he are about to experience life differently.  Or, are they??  When Justin arrives home to be waylaid by Trevor who is incensed because he smells his true mate all over Justin all hell breaks loose. But, they quickly realize that the Goddess of love has other things in mind for them.  It seems life will remain status quo.  That is, if, they can convince Kara that she is both of their mates.It's a really good story and they author has handled it with a great deal of finesse.  It becomes much more than a menage story, and it something of a nicely done love story with one very satisfied mate.

Great value and four really good storiesI really like the four brothers and their stories of challenging the family curse to find love.  When traditions says that no Stanhope had a chance of ever achieving a happy marriage and stabile life, the brothers have all decided they will never marry and they will break the curse.  Unfortunately, their vows are short lived when faced with 4 equally tenacious ladies of the ton who are their matches and better.Each is a full length story and each is a fun, wonderful and very intriguing read.  It is time that will make you glad you read the stories and very satisfied with all the tales all the characters and all the twists and turns it takes to bring love to the Stanhope men.

A new twist to the species plot.  I think the author did an excellent job of introducing a new elements into the stories and that she gave us two stories in one was an added bonus.The first story is one that picks up the story line of a Species male, Mourn, who lost his mate and was grieving and the human woman, Dana, who had lost her human mate.  Together they help each other to heal and in to process find that love can strike more than once.  That the second time around can be even better than the first and future is for the living.The second story is very different in that the female in this case was raised as a Species but in reality she is the daughter of the Doctor who worked at  the facility.  He killed his mate and his 4 year old daughter was a witness to the murder.  So what does any insane doctor do?  He grabs her up and brings her to Mercile's facility and puts her in a cage with a species wolf pup.  Where she is raised with #927.When the her mate 927 is killed she is sent to a sanitorium for the insane and held even after all the Mercile facilities have been raided.  927, Hero, is in that group of species who was freed, but he is told he killed Candi in a rage and she was told that 927 was killed because of her.  When they are accidently reunited all manner of complications are borne of the reunion.It's a truly special story and I know you will just love it.

This is a good addition to the Luna Lodge series, but I thought it raised more questions about the Remus character and his powers than it answered.  I enjoyed reading about his human Angel and secretary to the Lodge, Jenna. She was a really strong and very decisive character.  The kind of mate you would want at your back when the chips were downI am still not sure that I even like Remus a person but I loved him for the character he is in this story.  He is hybrid and something much more it seems .  I thought it left so much still unanswered but there was no doubt that he and Jenna will be together through thick and thin in this series and that together they are unstoppable.I think you will really like this story.  It is unique in many ways and still carries the thread of all the stories that have come before and opens the way for a new series spin off from this original one.Read and ENjoy

Great addition to the series and a story that needed telling.  I like the Wyatt character and I am glad that Ms. Bolryder gave him is own story and a chance at love.I thought the introduction to the Wyatt's mate was really intriguing.  His first impressions of the person who came to interview for a job were hilarious and thought Valerie's reactions to him and her backbone did her real credit.  I also loved that while he wasn't really sure if it was a man or a woman that something strong compelled his protectiveness to follow and see where it lead.Wyatt is a big soft  and the perfect gentleman and foil to soothe an abused and scared vulnerable young woman.  One who quickly became necessary to him and one who quickly bypassed his guard and stole his heart even as she lost her own.  I know you will love this one.  I certainly did.

I didn't love this one, but I didn't hate it either.  I thought it was more of 3.5 stars rather than a 3 or 4 star story.  It might have been that there was such a long time between the previous story and this one, that I was a bit fuzzy on some of the details that lead up to this story.I did like the Val character and her true mate Apollo.  I thought their relationship was a little on the touchy side and the quick wedding in the jungle with the natives was a little far fetched, but none the less hot.  It was a good addition to the entire series package, but it needs to be read quickly after the others with no lag in between as it does effect the way this story comes off.I think you'll like it.  You might not love it but it adds to the overall series and supplies some needed information for the next book.

What happens to a normal human woman when she falls for an ancient dragon shifter who literally rocks her world? ANSWER:  Many things both supernatural and natural.  Can you imagine being strong enough to battle a dragoness and WIN?  Can you imagine being threatened by said same Dragoness, with taking your new mate and having you and your newly forming offspring/ human/dragon baby killed?? Can a magical sword used by St. George the dragon slayer give you the strength and the advantage over a monsterest dragon or will you and your child perish into the nether world never to be seen again???Chloe faces all this an more in this fast moving, hot, sexy romance/shifter venue.  Ms. Savage has out done herself with this story.  It is the best of the three comes smack in the middle of the series.  I know because I read these out of order and I have to say this one is the one that glues the other two together and makes sense of the entire series.  It's a must read for this one.I know you are going to be breathless the whole way through this one.  Read and Enjoy

When is a Wyoming Wedding, not a Wyoming Wedding?  When it takes place in Texas!!!! NOT!!!.  In this one the final and probably the most charming of the Morgan Brothers bites the dust.  When his friend and Father figure is dying and wants to have his daughter come to see him one last time, he sends Shay to fetch her home.The problem is she doesn't want to see him.  In fact she has gone to great lengths to never have to see Sam Edwards again  Not only that but the Entire town stands behind her and anyone who tries to take her is sent on their way tarred and feathered.  Jenny Edwards is a respected doctor who spends a great deal of time and money helping the down trodden women of her little town to receive medical care and whatever other kind of help they need.What happens when the woman you want doesn't want you and your world famous charm fails you for the first time in your life.  What happens when she loves you and you love her, but you blow it with half truths.  This is a must read and a nice conclusion to this series.  You really must buy and read it.

I'd give this one a 4.50 stars.  I love the Lana character and the fact that she can not only sing the stars from the sky she is self sufficient and determined to succeed where strong brave men have failed.  When the elusive Black Stallion captures her imagination, and the money for the reward will buy her an opportunity to move to San Francisco and become a Opera singer like her mother, nothing will stand in her way.Not even on Tag Morgan who is known to be the best horseman in the entire state of Wyoming will stand between Lana and her goal.  The fact that Tag is working against her means nothing.  Tag is frustrated to no ends and finally decides they need to pool their resources and do this together.  The fact, that he is head of heels in love with Lana means nothing.  With her luscious voice and his know how they will capture the horse.  He gets the horse and she gets the money and her freedom???? MAYBE.You will want to read this one to see how this all comes about.  It is a great story

Brianna needs money to buy her young brother back.  When she spots a wanted poster for one Trey Morgan for the exact amount that will buy his freedom, this Boston Librarian decides to bring him in.  She reads everything she can find on tracking, and capturing felons.  It doesn't hurt that she is also a good horse woman and can shoot with the best of them.  After all not only does she have capture him she has to trek with him on a  journey of over 900 miles to turn him in.It doesn't hurt that Brianna captures Trey imagination and he can't believe this little wisp of a woman thinks she can not only capture him but manage to keep him while being trailed by his brothers.  It turns out she is a match for all of them, until a mountain lions takes her down just a couple of days outside of her target city.  What happens will leave you breathless.  These Morgan men are nothing if not persistent when they find their match and they don't take no for an answer.You will really like this one.  Find out if Trey is a marrying family kind of man one that will accept a ready made family.

Matthew and Samantha's story is sweet and nicely done.  It's not overly exciting, but it is a solid story that will have you turning the pages.  Sam is a newspaper report on a quest to write a pulizter front page story before she marries.  What she finds is that luke warm feelings for a fiancé are not the things that stories are made of, but smoking hot ranchers  with the body of a god just might be the thing.Matt is a man who has been taught to think he is not the stable marrying kind.  That he is unworthy of a life and family due to a bad choice in his youth.  But, Samantha is just the person to show him that not only is he a good choice he is the only choice for her.I think you will like this story and find that you want to read his brothers stories as well.

Another amazing story in this wonderful new series.  This one is Arak's story.  He is a half Argonian/shifter and a part of the elite Jutak Warriors, similar to our Seals or Special forces.  During a Mission to save the wife of the AMbassadors of another planet the team finds two woman who have been held captive of the Alien Slave traders for months.  They are strong earth woman who have been to hell and back and have come out scarred and mentally abused but none the less determined to survive in this new alien life they find themselves a part of.Arak is immediately drawn to Sylvia and he begins to try to help her adjust and except him and the culture that she is being thrust into.  During the course of this time Sylvia finds she is not only healing but totally in love with Arak.  During this time she inadvertently stumbles upon one of the Elite Jutak Warriors with a traitor.  This kicks off another whole chain of events and lands her back in the clutches of the slave traders, with Arak hot on her trail.  No one takes his MATE.It's a love story with a fast paced exciting and deadly chase across the galaxies.  I think you will love it.

I'd really like to give this one a 4.75 stars.  I loved the story line and I loved the fact that earth has too many men and they women are either buying into singles program to travel off world to mate with aliens or putting up with men who knock them up and move on or staying single forever.Faith is a great character and I loved that she raised the $20,000 to be a part of the relocation and mate search to another world.  I thought that she was a bit nave to take the money for chosing Torkel as her chosen one.  I did think it was odd that the same alien who studied her so closely before she was on the transport was the same one that offered her the money to choose his friend in the challenge.It's a wonderful story.  It has all the elements of such.  Great, strong characters, lots of loving, lots of misunderstanding and lots of forgiving and moving on.  I think you find this one is not only a great love story, but a great beginning to a wonderful new series. I have to say I was surprised at the numbers who did not like this series, but I think it's a good one.

I am a fan of alien/human relationships and normally I am really into them.  This one, while good, was not the kind I usually really enjoy.  I go more for the highly developed alien plants were their technology makes our look like prehistoric earth by comparison.  This one was not that kind.I loved that Alien that abducted Novalyn was from such a planet.  His intention was to claim her for himself, but his plans were thwarted by his superior when it was found out what he had done.  Novalyn winds out being dropped along with 12 other women on a rather preshistoric earth type planet that needs women to repopulate the masses.  Unlike the others she was not given a choice and causes all kinds of problems, both for her and the Federation who put her on the planet as well.It's a very intricate story and plot and while I didn't love it I did enjoy it and the for the most part the story line.  I think it is one you should give a chance.  It does kind of grow on you.  I think you will find in the end you are rooting for Ordrik to have Novalyn except him as her mate and stay.

I bought all three of these at one time and since I could not see the book number in the table of contents I read this one before book two.  While it in not way took from the story it did dump me into the middle of the story that was partially started in book 2, I believe, as I am just now starting this one.I loved Marcy story and I thought Teo was a wonderful if a bit inept hero.  He is a bit on the stilted side and very much an old fashion kind of dragon.  It was hard to tell if he was enarmored with Marcy of if he was totally turned off by her.  About 50 per cent of the time I was sure he hated her and the rest of the time I thought he was just looking to get laid.When he finally gets to it, however, there is no doubt that he is 100% in love/lust with her and she with him.  They are one hot couple.  The descriptions of their surroundings and the places he takes her to are excellently done.  Ms. Savage paints some loved pictures of them and Marcy paints some love pictures of her own.  Of course she has one rather hot dragon guy to paint in the nude to make it really spicy.I to believe you will love this one.

Not a bad read for the price of free.  The author has done a nice job of writing a rather interesting and fairly believable story.  She grabbed me from the beginning with this story and for the most part kept me immersed and interested in the story line and the characters. I would have like more depth and better interaction between the Chloe and Saul.  I thought the author went to quickly to his Dragon shift and the fact that he left so quickly and Chloe went back to life even after they had mated, was not to my liking.  I especially did not like that she attempted to have sex with her old boyfriend even though mated to Saul. I though she should have made a better attempt at the transition of Chloe  and Saul.  While I understand his nature was dragon, I would  have like him to have explained the mate process to Chloe before that actually took place.I understand that there has to be some conflict and that is how it was achieved, I just thought it could have been a smoother transition.  I also wish that the author had clearly marked these by book number 1,2,3 etc as I wound up reading the 3rd book before the second and it left me a little flat.All that aside I do believe you will enjoy all three if you are into this shifter/dragon genre.

A rather good but somewhat bland Victorian/goth type of story.  I like it but I just didn't love it.  While it was totally in character with the genre it was not a surprise in any way for me.  I had this pegged from almost the beginning.  The author has created some rather good characters but while most gothic type stories are dark and keep the reader in complete suspense, it was evident for the beginning exactly what was going on in Netherby Halls.The author did try to keep it as some mysterious deep dark secret. But she was much too up front about the kind of person the head mistress was; and the fact that she was evidently not held in much regard by both her relatives and the person who placed her as the mistress, made it pretty obvious that she was not a very savory person to be running such an institution for young impressionable orphans. I think you it almost reeks of the smell of a brothel in training.All that said, I still believe you will enjoy the story even though I don't think you will really be in much suspense.  I did find it interesting that both main characters were of magic persuasion.  I think you will like this one but maybe not love it.
excellent value for the price. arrived as expected and with a minimum of fanfare or fuss.  Love them and would buy again.

Ms. Bolryder strikes again.  I am such a fan of these brothers and I especially loved the Maverick character.  He is such a Bear.  I don't mean that in the grouchy kind of way but in the true since of a kind of rough not quite civilized man/bear.  His life has been hard but somewhere down deep in his soul is this sweet, lost little bear/boy.I love how he has from the first been the catalyst that drives the stories, all of them.  He recognized immediately that the three women who showed up to answer his ad for a wife were the answer to all their problems.  That he knew immediately that He and his bear were destined to be the life mates of one Ms. Harmony and that he never stopped trying in his rather caveman way to convince her to be his one and only.  That he was willing to do whatever it took to keep her.  Even learn how to embrace his human side and to acknowledge his love for his mate.I know you just love this story and you can't help but love this big old, Wild, clumsy, caveman bear, Maverick  This one is something special.

The first I have read by this author but I thought it was a nicely done story.  The characters were well thought out and they were absolutely believable.  I thought the fact that Emily was rushing to find a new life because of her mother's remarriage to a man, who wanted to have time with new bride without her daughter hanging around, was bit more than I would have thought would fly.  Especially since her mother had waited many, many years to take such a step.  Then to have the new man insist that Emily move out before the wedding, was perhaps a little contrived.That is no way takes away from the story of a rather brave, young women traveling many miles to a strange place to take up a life as a mother to two young girls and become the wife of a total stranger.  It is a great story and think if you are a romance reader you will find this one to be sweet, pleasant and a nice change.I say give it a read and enjoy the ride.

Once again I am quite simply astounded at this Author and the wonderful stories she tells. Jacinda from the House of Healing, a widow of an Assemlyman of the House of Protection, who is held in low regard by many of the purists of this house, find herself in a very sticky situation.When you are suddenly singled out by the King of The House of Protection for special favors and thrust into the lime light, how do you survive to fight another day, with every person against you.  That is the question Ms. Eidem has thrust into the fore front with this story.  It is handled masterfully.  I know you will fall in love with not only Jacinda and her courage and her self worth, but with Jotham the King and both of their combined families.  This is a story of  second chances, of love blooming against all odds, and of families who must come to terms with the fact that because you had one life mate does not mean that your life ends when your spouses does  It is a powerful and gripping story set in intergalactic space but could easily be any family right here, right now facing all the challenges set forth in this wonderful read.It's quite simply one of the best stories ever.  I sincerely hope there will other stories added to this Imperial Series.  In particular I want to hear Stephanie's, Barek, and Jacinda's oldest sons story.  I know they will be wonderful and I can't wait to see them in print.

When I was young we had a commercial that was for a bubble bath called Calgon.  The commercial went like this (CALGON TAKE ME AWAY),  That feeling of total contentment and relaxation is exactly the kind of euphoria that Ms. Eidem helps me achieve every time I begin, immerse and end one of her exquisite intergalactic stories.  This one just blew me away.How do you survive the destruction of you home world, build and new life, and then suddenly remember there is something very important that you have forgotten about your family and that plant.That for nine long years has remained just barely out of your consciousness.  Something that could literately mean life and death for those who were on that planet.  That is exactly what Victoria must figure out.  While this is the story of her life mate, Lucas, and finding their way together and forging a life, It is also the story of a great love and devotion to family.  Can she convince Lucas and her step-uncle to trust her.  Can she reach what is left of earth in time to save her family left behind, on a world of total and utter destruction.  Will she even be able to reach the surface to see if they might still be alive when there was only food for 4 people for 4 years.It's a wonderful, suspenseful and gripping story of the human spirit at it's best.  When you just KNOW that you are right.  When you know beyond a shadow of a doubt that against all odds they are there waiting with time quickly running out.  I know you love this one.  It's some of the best writing and one of the best storylines I have read recently.  Ms. Eidem is a master story teller and you simply have to read this one.  BUT, read Cassandra's Challenge first as it lays the ground work of this one and is an exquisite story as well.

How would YOU deal with everything DISAPPEARED AROUND YOU?  Including every member of your family being wiped from the face of the Earth.  All except one, your niece who is nine years old and a trauma victim of an Alien race?  Those are the questions you will face when you step into the pages of this breathtakingly spectacular world that Ms. Eidem has so expertly created for your enjoyment.I find this author's work to be some of the most interesting and inventive proses and dialog I have ever read.  Her characters, while they are mostly of Alien origin, to be real and so fascinating that it is hard to put the stories down.  These are full length multi pages love stories.  I say love stories because,  while they might by some be considered Science Fiction, by me, they are as close to the human experience as any human story would be.  Cassandra is a direct descendent of this Alien Race who discovered and populated Earth.  He rescuer's are Corinian's from the original Planet 5000 light years away.Every detail and nuance of this story is so exquisitely done that at times you will forget this tale is not set on Earth, but rather, in deep, deep space where anything and everything is possible and different.  You will taken thousands of light years in the future and shown a world through the imagination and inventiveness of Ms. Eidem.  I is an experience that will take your breath away, leave your heart beating faster, and your mind open to any and all possibilities.  This is the first of this series.  I am already about 78% in the second book, Victoria's Challenge and I can tell that it is as good if not better than the first.You have to buy and read these stories, if you have any interest in other worlds or Aliens at all, and if you don't this will bring you to the conclusion that you might want to explore the possibility.  I loved every single word, every conflict and every action that brought Cassandra and William together and the story that forges their lives as a couple who stands together and family is all that matters.  Not titles, not prestige, not money, not any of the superficial things that sometimes matter on earth.  Love, Honor and first and foremost Family about all else.

I really, for the most part, like this grouping of stories.  They were good.  A few were on the slow side, and a couple of them I had read in their original single story offerings.I have to say, the one thing, I did not like was that most of them were not really stand alone stories, in that, you felt almost compelled to buy and read the next story.  In fact, several of them, were out right cliffhangers and they are not my favorite.  Therefore, only the 4 star rating.I will say that for the money it is not a bad buy.  You just need to be made aware that they are not complete stand alones and there are some cliffhangers in the mix.  My advise is for the money buy it and give them a try you might really want to go further and buy the next additions to those cliffhangers of the next in the series.

AWESOME STORY. Who knew that a lowland gorilla could become a Greyback Grizzly???? Ms. Joyce obviously.  What a wonderful and inventive story she wove in this one.  The entire concept of this story was absolutely unique and really quite brilliant.I loved that Kong finally got this story.  What a story it was.  I would never have dreamed this plot in a million years.  I guess that is why Ms. Joyce is the author and I am the reader.  The Fiona adversary who is never quite there until the end  I love that in the end she and her cohorts got everything that was coming to them.  Extinction!!!!  And that I might add was too good from them.Together this wonderful primate and his true mate Layla were wonderful.  Their story is one of the best so far and I am looking forward to Damon getting his story out in October of this year.  Waiting with bated breathe.

Loved this one!!! Jesse's story was a spectacular and sexy story.  I love Bonnie and her secret, which I won't tell you.  You have to read this one and find out like the rest of us did.  It was a total surprise for me.  I know it was hinted in book 1 that she had a secret but I had no clue until Ms. Bolryder revealed it.I thought all the characters in this book and previous one were excellent.  They are strong, sexy and they are willing to go to the wall for those they love.  But above that they are family who love and respect each other.  Isn't that what we all want in the end to be loved and to have the respect of those who love us?I think you will find this one a great addition to Ms. Bolryder's collection of special shifter series.  I love them all and this one is no exception to her genius and her ability to weave a short story with incredible depth and detail.  I know once you read one of her stories you will be drawn to go and read them all.  I certainly did.

Ms. Bolryder has saved the best for last.  This is a wonderful and fun story, that will lead you to conclude that personal tragedy is the often times the foundation of the human/shifter spirit.  Ryan has a stalker, Kylie, AKA his true mate, whom he is determined to deny.  When tragedy strikes this wonderful super class athlete on the snowboards, it is not his family who is able to snap he back to reality, but another damaged individual, who has also faced the challenges of personal tragedy, Kylie.Together they prop each up and form the bond that finally breaks through Ryan's reserves.  It is an amazingly funny, serious and loving venture that leads to the ultimate in the human experience.  A loving committed relationship between to fated mates.  I know you will love this one.  Because being last does not mean you are least, but often times you are the best.

I love this story.  I thought the author did a marvelous job of portraying the Godan Warriors as the saviors of earth against the onslaught of the Hahnsyhn, who have come to plunder and destroy the earth and those who dwell here.  I thought that Roark the First Commander and the one in charge of the forces here on earth, was believable, strong and very much a hard man to please.  His character was strongly handsome, and yet, when It came to Mira the human earthling, he was soft and loving.I think the author did an admiral job with different factions that were involved in the conflict and the action both furious  and believable.  The added element of the unregistered children being taken away an never seen again was brilliant.  It was one that allowed Mira to shine in her caring for not only these lost children but those that she and her sister Wynne had gathered up off the streets and protected, feed and adopted into their hearts.There is a huge surprise at the end involving First Commander Roark and I think you will find it very interesting.  I know this entire store caught my fancy and my imagination.  It was fast.  It was intense.  It was above all a wonderful magical story by a very talented author.

I love this edition of the Kindle.  Although the first one crapped out in 6 months time, because it apparently was defective and didn't do the updates and finally just jammed up.  I still bought the same one and took the 2 year insurance this time.  I think if you only want a device for reading on than this is the best choice out there.

This was just an okay read for me.  I thought it was a little to vague and a little to much bed hopping for me.  Janice find the fiancée is a cheating man whore and then she pretty much hopes into bed with first a human doctor and then a bear shifter.  There is little detail on how this werebear comes to be at the hospital and who the big ugly is that is after him to begin with.  It was just a hot mess for me.I wouldn't say it's not worth reading it's just not my cup of tea.  My only advice is to be aware it might not be something you would have a taste for.  Other wise, as always I suggest you try something different and see where it leads you.  Next time you will know whether or not if this is for you.

I LOVED this one too, but it was a little slower than the first two as far as reading it goes.  It is also a very different story from the first two. Ke'lar the brother of Ra'kar is faced with a very tough decision.  One he ultimately decides is well worth the risk.  Ar'Ar's mate Summer Mills has run away. Ar'ar, the first son of Malek and the old time enemy of his clan, Ke'lar find he must shield the little human and help her regardless of the consequences.  Being confronted with doing what he thinks is right and what is lawful according to Hir council laws proves to be his only option..Summer has be taken and she absolutely must get back to earth to get her little daughter back from her ex husband before he discovers she has been taken by aliens.  What follows is a wonderful, sweet, heartwarming story of unbridled and completely devoted love and caring.  I know you will just melt when you read.  You find that you are cheering for the love between human and alien and praying there is a peaceful solution  A must read.

With one successful lifemate found and claimed the Hir Warriors decide to send another warrior who has one moon cycle to convinces an earthling to become his mate.  The new rules state the captured bride will spend one moon cycle with the Hir Warrior in his clan enclosure. At the end of that time  she can choose to stay with her warrior,OR, they will wipe her mind of all that has transpired and return her to Earth.  Where she will never remember any of her time on Hir.R'har has landed in the same area as RA'ker in the North Carolina mountains.  He has found Hope Mac Gowen there.  She is newly jilted by her fiancée for her best friend.  She is spending a weekend to have some time away and clear her mind and her heart of the bitter betrayal.  To try to figure out all the things she has to do to return the gifts and cancel all the wedding plans.  While she is walking out in the snow to clear her head she is confronted by a huge alien.  While he doesn't roar he does shoot her, handcuff her, give her water and food and than lets her loose.  But he has every intention of claiming her.  He loads her on the ship and off the goe.  Hope has passed out and he fitted her with the translator, but when she wakes he claims they floating in space as his ship shorted out during the jump to hyper space.They are attacked the second day and the morning of their first life mating.  The wind up on a Hir abandoned plant and running for their lives.  It just goes down hill from there.  I will not spoil this one for you because I know once you get into it you won't be able to put it down.  Enjoy

WOW!! I have to say this is possibly the best new alien story I have seen in a while.  I really liked it and I thought it was hot and very, very nicely handled.  In fact, before I even finished this one I bought the next two .This one is Jenna MacNally's story and that of a Hir Warrior, Ra'kar who accidenrly crashes on Earth when he is attacked by his enemy the Zerar.  They are very nasty race who has devastated his plant and killed half the population in the scourge.  The female half for the most part are dead and there is little hope of repopulation of the planet.  That is until Ra'kar discovers the beautiful and obviously compatible species in the North Carolina hills of Earth.What follows is a very quick and very different courtship and capture of most befuddled human, Jenna.  The roaring alien shoots her, handcuffs her and then mates with her via his very arousing purr and cuddles.  He than repairs his space craft and wisks her away to Hir, where he proceeds to claim her by Hir law as his lifemate.  Jenna and he successfully mate and are pregnant.  A good thing you would think.  But there are some on Hir who do not adhere to the mixing of the races.It is a magnificent story with many twists and turns, when the path to true love as we all know is never smooth.  I think you have this series at the top of the scfi list.  I loved it.

When Torac fails to bring his bride to heal, Lytil, Hier Ruler and first in command, decides he must take himself off to earth and the next lottery winner is fixed for him.  He arrives and sees the chosen one for him and is totally unmoved by the selection.  He is quite satisfied that he will be quite able to establish order and traditions as status quo on Karal.Unfortunately for him mother nature has other things in store for the unknowing Lytil.  A hurricane that spews acid rain down in buckets catches him unawares.  Vanessa, an artist and the daughter of a late  professor of conservation, sees him and his predicament, she ushers him into her home and inadvertently into her life.  Her paintings and their beauty and detail,  and her caring and loving nature, capture Lytil's  imagination and his unknowing heart.  She tells him she has no wish to leave the dying earth and she has not even entered the lottery.  While she sleeps, Lytil makes the decision to alter the lottery and to take her to Karal as his bride.  Needless to say, things will never be the same on Karal again.The moral is never mess with a human woman, who quite literally doesn't want to be messed with, OR, life will be altered in ways you can never imagine

Celia of earth is the second lottery winner to be chosen to go to Karal.  She is from a poverty stricken lower class family.  He has entered only because she  hopes to win the lottery to ease the burden of her support from her family; and earn a few coins to help to make their life easier. She comes from a loving and caring family where children and family are everything.Torac is the second in command on the plant Karal and has been sent to collect his future bride so that the supposedly emotionless race can analysis how these earth females have so much power over their males.  Torac is sure he will be able to mate and send Celia off to the breeding area where he will never have to see her again.Needless to say all is not as he would hope.  He is unprepared for the effects of a sweet, biddable and loving mate who will turn his life one end.  I know that you will love this one too.

Wonderful new series by Harmony Raines. Earth is dying and the Karalian aliens have come to earth looking for compatible females to help them repopulate Karal.  They have with the cooperation of the Earth President devised a lottery system to match the aliens with the females.  It is a complex system of matching human DNA with the Karalian DNA and the fertility cycle of the earth females.While the earth population thinks it is really a lottery, it is in effect a rigged pairing of not only fertility cycles, and DNA but also whether or not they can live in harmony with the Human Female who is less than cooperative and in fact did not even enter they lottery and was the person responsible for the loss of 10 human lives and two of the Karalian aliens.  Elissa is opposed to this system and believes it is a conspiracy to punish her.  Marin is the first Male Karalian chosen to be her mate.It takes place both on Earth and across time and space.  I love it and I think you will too.

This is another solid Guitar Play Along book based on the songs of Jack Johnson. They feature a demo track and a play along track. These "play along" books are a GREAT tool for any guitarist, as most of the songs are familiar, you can play your favorite artists songs to really sound alike backing tracks, (minus the vocals of course) and you can work on your improvization skills. I own a "acoustic hits for beginners" which also contains the song "Upside Down," but what is cool about this book is, it has the little simple intro and outro included. This is a good play along book for those who: Like JJ, play acoustic guitar, would like to practice lots of different chords. Great backing tracks! Solid TAB.

A book dedicated to playing some Santana, NICE! The backing tracks here are EXCELLENT!! The mix of songs is really nice and creative, as it does have some of  his well known songs as well as a couple obscure ones. Santana's style is really really hard to grasp, as I think the key is "effortlessness," as in, what I'm getting, is his ability to just PLAY without really FORCING it. Which has really helped me develop my own personal style. For me, playing without "trying" is hard, as I feel I kinda force my way around a song. Saying something interesting muscially while making it sound awesome but also EASY is extremely hard. Practicing playing and listening Carlos' music really really teaches you to just let it ride. Playing with feeling and emotion, obviously, but doing so in a way where your movements and note selection aren't forced, and always sound natural and like they belong.  I would recommend this play along book to anyone who would like to become a better guitar player and crank out to some Santana, a really soulful guitarist.

Definitely agree with the guy that has the most liked review on here. This was a lucky find here on Amazon, as I buy a TON of play along books. Peter Green has been one of my favorites for awhile now, and his playing has always been something I wanted to emulate. Enter this book. Its nuts because in reality, the technicality of the songs in this book AREN'T THAT DIFFICULT!! It's really amazing what he made sound so complex turns out to be rather "simple." (fingering, even the use of SLIDE on "Albatross" ANYONE can pull off!!) Peter Green just knew how to make emotion travel thru his guitar into your mind.  If you are aware of who Peter Green is and you play guitar, this book is a MUST!! Superb backing tracks, right on par with any Hal Leonard Play Along book, as well as the TAB. Great write ups too, and unlike the Hal Leonard series of books, the breakdown tracks of JUST the solos is acutally something I did end up using and appreciating!! Definitely a must buy!!Don't be put off by the corny looking cover, this really really is a GEM of a find for a blues playing guitarist.

I've been playing guitar now for 1 year 9 months. I've progressed rather quickly, not because I'm a "natural," but because I put in TONS of hours and hard work. I've previously owned a Mustang 1v.2, which I got when I "outgrew" the plain amp that came with my "Epiphone Guitar Player Pack."The Fender amp worked very well for me for a few months. Nothing wrong with it, other than I wanted to try something different. Had lots of fun sounds, fairly easy to use. Bought the single footswitch for it. Didn't really end up using it all that much as it didn't really do anything I needed.Ended up getting a Vox VT20, which is a GREAT amp as well. Sounded a lot better, easier to use, all in all great. Well, a few months pass, I've started recording myself playing along to backing tracks. Started out using a little handheld Tascam DR-05. Liked what I was hearing and made a few cds for friends, etc. They sounded ok, but it was made with the little mic in my little practice room; "echo-y." Come Christmas, I get a Tascam DP-008 8-Track recorder, which has several different inputs.  So I started looking around for another amp, one I could connect DIRECTLY to my 8 Track.  Found this guy. My previous experience with Fender amps went well, and this one has a ton of good reviews so I went for it. Boy, WAY easy to use. I LOVE the built in screen where it shows everything, amp model, pedal used, mod used, delay, etc. Then you can also fine tune your sound via the actual knobs on top. The screen is pretty much what sold me, as I really don't like fussing about with my laptop while I'm trying to play or record. I'm sorta old school like that. I have played around with the Fender Fuse software after hooking it up to this, but I'm not really that interested in finding out about all you can do with it. I much perfer tangible, hence mussing about with the amp itself. YOU DON'T have to hook it up to your computer EVER to get great sounds, it's just another option for those who are into  that. So far, I've been able to dial in EVERY sound I want. I play mostly blues, but sometimes I play some Slayer or some Santana or some AC/DC. Lots of different sounds I am consistently able to get.So, back to recording. If you're like me and you like recording yourself playing along to backing tracks or with actual music, you can get cd quality recordings when you use this amp to hook directly up to your 8 track or what ever other recording device you have. I'm using the XLR output (it has 2 outputs) from the cab into my 8 Track. Then I have my iPod plugged into a splitter where one 1/8" end  (1/8" is the size of your standard headphone cable end)  plugs into the "AUX" input on top of this amp, and the other 1/8" plugs into a 1/4" male adapter plug ($4) and then into the line input on my 8 track. I've recorded tons of songs this way, and they all sound really pro, minus my somewhat ok guitar abilities. :-)The speaker is plenty loud, the controls are responsive, easy to read, it's VERY well built, open back to stash the cord, etc. You can rename any preset right from the amp, which is handy so you can just name it "Santana" or whatever so you can find it easier. It comes with a basic two button footswitch. I ended up buying the 4 button footswich as well, which you run simultaniously with the 2 button. I would definitely recommend the 4 button footswitch.As far as sounds, reverb, etc, none of them sound "digitized" to me. They all sound really really good. Everything on the amp is customizable, so you can tweak any field you need to to get exactly the right sound you're looking for.My ONLY complaint about it so far is; if say you want to move preset #81 "Metallica" (example) to preset #1, you sure can, BUT, it doesn't SWAP them, it simply overwrites preset #1. Which is really LAME because you can easily overwrite one of your own favorite presets or a good factory preset. There is a way to reverse it but that requires you to do the factory reset which sets it back to day one. Other than that, this amp is really really great for any guitarist, ESPECIALLY if you're doing your own home recording. Sounds fantastic piped directly into your multitrack recorder rather than mic'd in. Very fine amplifier.Basically, why you should buy/consider this amp:Scaleable: XLR outputs; Home recording, also if you ever plan to play live, you can connect this amp to a PA system using the XLR outputsCustomizable: Using the amp directly to customize or via the Fuse software, you can do a LOT for your own sound.Loud as F: You most likely won't need a bigger amp unless you're playing outside. Not sure what some of these morons are talking about when they say can't hear it over a drum set. I have a drum set. Its nonsense.Easy to Use: You can figure it out within minutes of plugging it in.If you're serious about guitar, this is a great place to start, as you can only go up from this point. This is about as good as you're going to get under $500, and this amp will grow with you.Ask me if you have a questions! Have fun!

I have about 40 of these play along books, and most all of them are superb. My playing has improved TREMENDUSLY since begininning using them. What I do mostly that works for me, and is most fun for me, is to learn the intro and a few key verses of a song, and then simply improvise the rest, which helps me practice my pentatonic scales and such. So I rarely ever learn an entire song note for note, but to jam along to a familar song and put my own spin on it is really rewarding. This book has many of AC/DC's well known songs, and the backing tracks are AWESOME! I learned "Dirty Deeds" and it's fairly 'easy' to learn the hook, then jam out the rest. The tone I can match perfectly with my Mustang III amplifier. Anyway, these guitar play along books are a lot of fun, and really help you become better.

This was my first "Signature Licks" book I've purchased. What I have been doing for the past year and a half teaching myself guitar is use the Hal Leonard Guitar Play Along books, which I contribute a LOT of my success at progressing so quickly. I mostly play blues, and one of my favorite guitarists is Buddy Guy. This book is a great learning tool for me as it breaks down snippets of songs and explains what's going thru Buddy Guys head (theoretically) as he blazes thru his solos. Music is really fascinating and also for me, easier to understand if I can look behind the curtain so and see the how and the whys as to why someone did something musically. The audio examples are great, and the descriptions of the song snippets, written in TAB and also standard are clear and easy to understand. Also, my favorite song off the Stone Crazy album, "I smell a rat", had quite a write up to it by Dave Rubin, who described it perfectly when he said the solo was "violent." That IS the perfect way to desribe it!!  Anyway, if you like insight into learning why your favorite artist did something and you want it broken down into manageable chunks, these "Signature Licks" books would be a great tool for you.

Certain items on Amazon are hard to tell quality, like posters. I took a chance and bought this poster for $20 hoping for the best. It really IS worth $20, as the paper is thick, matte type laminate so it doesn't have that glare to it, and the writing is legible and fine to read. The colors are just like the picture. It really is an awesome product. Whoever makes these posters really do a great job with them. Would not hesitate to buy another one from them.

This is an actual review of the product ! Wow!Another great blues title from Hal Leonard publishing. The songs themselves are not too technically difficult. They are really fun to play along with or what I like to do most, play my own stuff over the backing tracks. What's different about this blues selection, if you're familiar with Albert King, is that the songs are more in a swing feel and have some stank/funk to them, which is what I really jive with when I improvise. Most of the songs are in drop D tuning. The version of "born under a bad sign," while in another "Blues Play Along' book has the bass line and a few main solos, this one has all the solos only, not the bass line/hook. Which is cool they're giving you a new version. Albert King was a legend, here's your chance to learn some of his tunes. BTW : not overly funky per say, that's just the rhythm/feel of the beat.:-)

This is THE one book to get if you're a student of the blues. Whats cool about this book is, while all the songs are RJ songs, the versions presented here are some of his most recognizeable songs that were covered by popular artists! Really cool, as the original versions, while great, would be rather sparse for a good "play along." Crossroads by Cream, Come On in My Kitchen by Keb' Mo', one of my favorites by the Rolling Stones, "Love in Vain Blues," "Dust my Broom" by Canned Heat, a SUPER FUN slide slide "Walkin' Blues" by Joe Bonamassa, "Ramblin' on My Mind" by Eric Clapton, "Traveling Riverside Blues" by Led Zep, and "Sweet Home Chicago" by every blues artist ever. This is definitely one of my favorite play along books. First for the cultural significance of the great blues songs, second for the masterful mix of styles that have been derived from the legend himself, the guy who really put blues in everyone's ear, Robert Johnson. A great selection.
