Arrows ALWAYS show you where to hover your tools to "fix", so there is no aspect of having to learn or remember or figure out how to use the tools.=Minus one star for being repetitive (same injuries, same fixes, same things each robot says, etc.)  and= Minus one star for not providing any learning or problem-solving opportunities, such as having a setting for getting rid of the arrows that point to where to use the tool so that the child has to remember or figure out what to do.Now that we're down to the obligatory one star that AMAZON awards, here are thePROSGame has simple, clean look AND feel, and very easy interface for little kids. In my opinion, this is a game aimed at a three or four year old age group (preschool set), and I think they would find it simple to use and fun for a while (although screen time should be limited; please don't use electronics to babysit your children for long periods of time).= Plus one star for clean visual design.I experienced no crashing, locking, or freezing up errors on my device (kindle fire HD 8.9) and a clean exit via the back button was fully operational, including a confirmation dialog box for exiting.= Plus one star for no technical problems.Ads are appropriate and not overly intrusive. They appeared to be for other preschool-games by the same developer. A small banner was visible at the top throughout game. Further, an ad-free version with extra features (tools and options for working on and customising your robot) was advertised for $3.99, in this reviewer's opinion about $2 too much, but hey, they've got to eat too.= Plus one star for appropriate advertising (or for not having INAPPROPRIATE advertising, if you'd rather).NOTESI cannot speak to permissions or embedded malware, spyware, adware, or data-mining tools, as I don't know if this app contains anything bad like that, so please do your own assessment before deciding to keep the app.Personally, I will be uninstalling it because it is not appropriate for my child's age, and has no options for making it more interesting or difficult for an older kid who loves robots.Your mileage may vary.

I have to thank the author for writing this incredible story. I couldn't put it down. My house went untidied, my hair went unwashed, my dishes went undone - heck, my FOOD went pretty much uneaten - while I devoured this novel instead.  Enough people waste valuable words writing a complete summary (sometimes even spoiling the surprises!) of a book, so I will not even begin to tell you what the story is about except to say that it is, to my mind, TRUE science fiction, in that it actually contains the SCIENCE part of this oft-misused label.This, however, does not bog the story down but elevates the narrative to a level of believability that is not often found in much of the speculative fiction written today. The characters are intense and perfectly drawn, particularly the protagonist, on whom the story is focused.  The world is rich and well-realized; there are good (or good enough) explanations for everything.  Of course, I have no idea whether a biochemist or other expert scientist would agree, but for me, it was just great.  I highly recommend this book, and will be reading anything else the author has on Amazon forthwith. Thank you, Mr. Cantrell, and keep up the good work!And, as an aside, in case this didn't come across above, it's actually WELL WRITTEN, with good grammar and no typos and stuff, as I am very picky about that kind of thing.  :-)

CONSBack button disabled / no clean exit path (had to force close) = (minus 1 star)No difficulty level settings or gradual difficulty curve (problems jumped from "3+3" to "247 / 14" instantly (obviously not for kids) = (minus 1 star)App went dark and locked up my device (Kindle Fire HD 8.9) the first time I clicked the settings button on initial launch AND after first "game" (had to force close both times) = (minus 1 star)App riddled with nasty add-ons = (minus 1 star)PROSClean, simple design = (plus one star)NOTESI got the app for my 2nd grader who is working on 3rd grade math, but either the app did not have, or I could not easily find, settings that would allow you to select the operation (addition, multiplication, etc.) - when you select "SUMS" it gives you problems with ALL FOUR operations in no particular order and seemingly bizarre random difficulty level.  The first problem, I think, was 4/1, the next was 3+1, and so on, to things like 39-12, and finally to 247/14 or whatever.  Obviously this app is not meant for children to practise their math skills, or it would include the following:- Choice of operand- Choice of difficulty- Choice of answer total (up to 10, 20, 100, 1000, etc.)- Choice of using regrouping or not using regrouping in addition and subtraction- Choice of format (fractions, decimals, etc.)- Choice of number of questions asked- Choice of scoring method- Record and report time spent playing, scores on various operations, and anything else a parent might want to know if they are monitoring their child's educational app time.As I said, the app froze up my device twice and I was not inclined to pursue it further after this, so maybe it does include some of these things, but I could not access the settings menu, so I have no idea.  All in all, if you are looking for an app for your child (elementary school) - look elsewhere.  If you are using a Kindle Fire HD 8.9, don't bother - the app doesn't work.  Or didn't for me anyway.

I've played a lot of these types of games over the years and I've come to realize that though they may seem like time-wasters, there is actually some strategy involved, and it is a great way to improve pattern recognition, quicken reflexes, and, frankly, for me, relax.  Combine your basic "match 3" with excellent HD graphics, a simple storyline, and a lot of different modes and options to vary play (tournament mode, free play, adventure, etc) and you have a really good game here.  It's not your basic "bejeweled" - there are goals for each level and various configurations, money to earn for power ups, and just more than I even cares to write about.  I was happy to pay to unlock the full game after the trial levels, and I am pretty stingy that way.  I haven't been disappointed yet. One of the best parts is that the symbols and game board configurations vary enough so that you don't see this game when you close your eyes at night! :-)
I've only been playing for a few minutes but this hidden pictures mystery game is already captivating. I will be sure to check out the full version or other games by this dev. Great music!

I just love my M&M's peanut butter flavor. They melt in your mouth.
I love it. I put it on before I apply my eye shadow and it all looks as I just applied it after 8 hours. I will buy this again.

A book with complete understanding of this complex and tough-to-treat disorder. It is a comprehensive guide which thoroughly explains what BPD is and what a patient's treatment options are, including an overview of the revolutionary new treatment called dialectic behavior therapy. This is well written and easy to understand. I have read a few books on this subject and found this one to be the best. Full of information that is very valuable in ones treatment. I am so glad I was able to read this book and recommend you do too.*I was given this book in return for a honest review.*

This handy guide provides remedies and advice for dry skin, acne, dandruff and more. Very well written with easy to follow instructions. The goal of this book is to help you get back to the basic lifestyle measures that point you toward a healthy, vibrant future. A wonderful small book you can carry anywhere. Makes a nice gift for a loved one or friend. You won't regret buying this book.*I was given this book in return for a honest review.*

This handy guide provides remedies and advice for stress, anxiety, fatigue, depression, and more. Packed full of useful information and easy to follow instructions. Very well written and would make a great gift for a loved one or friend. Small easy to carry with you.*I was given this book in return for a honest review.*

This handy guide provides remedies and advice for headaches, migraines, arthritis, joint pain, earaches and more. It is well written with sections on how to make preparations and use, yield, tips, and how it works. Very clear instructions to follow. Makes a gift for loved ones or a friend. You will enjoy making your own remedies.*I was given this book for a honest review.*

I received the Idson Silicone Oven Mitts for Barbecue & Kitchen-heat Resistant Grilling Cooking Gloves with BBQ Grill Brush Set for review and these are a great value! The 5 fingered gloves stretch to fit my fairly large hands and are make it easy to handle some of the hottest items in the kitchen or on the grill. They were also the perfect choice for pulling out a strainer from a 3qt pot boiling oil used for french fries and fish and handling large cast iron dutch ovens I use directly over coals.The gloves resist heat very well but when you start feeling heat you should take them off and let them cool a couple seconds as they greatly slow heat transfer but when you start feeling them get warm you can expect they will probably get much warmer. On my large hands they are a snug, yet comfortable fit and were not very difficult to remove and cooled back down very quickly ready to put back on.When working with the hot oil, the gloves did get a little slippery, but generally they offered a good grip on most surfaces.Unlike fabric based gloves, these silicone gloves are very easy to wash in soap and water, you can even send them through the dishwasher. With clean silicone gloves I can directly handle meat that is still on the grill. This works great for a large BBQ roast, ribs, even quickly loading up a large grill cranked up for use at a concession stand with 36 frozen burgers.The grill brush works fine, but the handle is way too short, consider this a freebie included in the set.

These comfortable Dare Color 6-Pack one-size-fits-most Low Cut Socks which were provided for review are comfortably thin when you want minimal fabric between you and your shoe. While they appear small and fit about a size 7 men without stretching, they do stretch to fit even my size 12 foot without overstitching the seams or elastic. However they are more of a stocking nearly see through when stretched and in addition to use when you just want minimal lining for your feet they also make great liners for blister protection under normal socks when hiking. The material breathes easily and will keep your feet dry and are also perfect for shoes that you may not want to normally wear with socks yet want to reduce the impact of sweating such as crocks or sandals.There is no seam in the toe and this area as well as the heel cup provides some additional protection, the low cut allows for minimal show of the sock with most shoes for a clean look.The 6 pack with a variety of navy, grey, and black colors arrived in a box rather than a display hanger and the box is imprinted on the inside with "Thank you for your patience"  which seemed unusual.

The SmaAcc Waterproof Floating Camera Strap(3-pack) which was provided for review are comfortable and durable neoprene covered foam tube wrist straps for anything you want to keep from sinking. Great for keys, point and shoot, action cameras, even waterproof bluetooth speakers . The bright comfortable wrist strap will keep nearly 2.5lbs at the surface and the durable plastic quick release won't give out accidentally with it large but easy to release squeeze clip.There were no instructions and they arrived in clear plastic with no information. To attach to a device you disconnect the quick release, pass the thin yet very strong "string" loop through a retainer on the device and then the quick release back though the loop. Once connected back to the wrist strap the device appears it will stay connected even in the harshest situation like white water, waves, wipe outs, etc.The wrist strap is not water proof and will absorb some water, but retains its full floatation capabilities even when soaked.

The Simply Simily Stainless Steel Water Bottle which was provided for review, is a basic yet durable 9" tall x 3.125" wide at base. Rated at 34oz capacity, I found the bottle able to hold a full 36oz still allowing for a small air gap between liquid and cap.This is not a double wall insulated container and the a 8oz durable Stainless Steel container is thermally conductive and will be the same temperature on the outside as the contents.Similarly priced to plastic bottles, this non reactive bottle doesn't impart a taste and is easy to clean. The wall thickness is enough to withstand deformation with a reasonable high amount of pressure and the smooth edge in the screw top provides excellent durability assuring leak free use with no gasket necessary.The plastic lid appears to be a good quality resistant to cracking and the plastic loop retainer is easily removed for cleaning with all parts seeming to be dishwasher safe.The wide opening has a smooth edge which allows for easy cleaning and loading of ice and is comfortable to drink from directly.

The PREMIUM Liquid Chalk Markers provided by Home&Us for review are similar to liquid paint markers. The markers are labeled as Glass Markers and I found them easy to use on nearly any surface, semi permanent (water washable) on porous surfaces such as paper, easy to clean off even when dry on non-porous surfaces such as tile, class, standard chalkboards, chalkboard style labels, etc.The tip is reversible and has a chisel and medium point. When you get the markers the tip is dry, you shake the pen which seems to have a mixing ball inside, then press the tip to prime and start the flow. The liquid drys fairly quickly and isn't very susceptible to unintended smearing. The bright colors look great on dark or light surfaces, although the darker colors look better on white and the lighter better on dark. Overall much better than chalk on a chalkboard and dry erase pens on white boards. The priming action is a little more work to use than a stick of chalk or ready to use marker on whiteboard but the tradeoff is no chemical smell and easy 100% cleanup with no dust and no staining.Home&Us also sells chalkboard style labels which are great for labeling jars or storage containers that may change content from time to time. I would also recommend these for temporary signs such as daily specials, marking up car windows for game day, weddings, birthdays, etc. These are also safe, non toxic, and easy to clean off unintended use by kids including fabric.

These comfortable lightweight sunglasses provide clear protection for your eyes. The large reflective aviator style lens allows for a wide peripheral view and greatly reduces glare when driving or fishing. Your call on style, you may find these to be a bit retro as they are a more functional basic style of frame.

The Wigwam Men's 3-Pack Rebel Fusion Crew are quality socks, thick and comfortable, well made with no loose ends.The elastic quality is very good, tight enough to stay up, but not too tight to cut off circulation. These socks breathe well and function as a wicking liner and sock all in one, perfect for hiking yet stylish enough for daily professional wear. The only advantage I can think of using an actual liner would be greater blister protection by assuring friction occurring between layers, but I have not had any hot spots hiking in these socks.Plenty of padding in all the right places, the variable thickness allows for comfortable fit on top with extra support in the heel and arch.The seamless toe construction moves the seam to around the natural gap between your toes and foot which helps protect from getting blisters.

My LuxoLite Headlamp LED - Super Bright CREE Head Flashlight w/ RED Light was provided for review. I have a few of these style headlamps and this set is my current favorite.Unlike other pairs that have a battery holder you have to remove the simple access door on the back of this headlamp allows easy access to the 3 AAA batteries which fit snugly and are easy to replace but last a long time.Packaging is nice enough for giving as a gift with but with little wasteThe headband is strong and easily adjustable, wide enough for no slipping, and thick enough that it should last without loosing its elastic properties.The headlamp allows for 3 click angle positions and the mechanism feels like it should last, 2 buttons provide easy access to white or red light without cycling through bright white to get red. You do have to cycle through bright to get low or flash, but once on in any mode and have been using the next press turns it off without having to cycle.The white light has good even dispersion, with a bright center spot and a good wide field of low level to aid peripheral lighting. You want to be careful about hitting a neighbor in the eyes on bright though.The solid red light is bright enough for looking at close up items, useful when out stargazing or other situations when you need to read, or adjust/find something in the dark without losing night vision.I found the best use of flashing red as a alert while biking, I place the headlamp facing backwards to alert drivers behind of my presence without hitting them with a bright light.

I have been using the [Apple MFi Certified] Skiva PowerSkin IP5C Protective Battery Case (2000mAh) with *Unblocked Lightning & Audio Port* for Fast Charging of iPhone 5c [Model No.: AP107] - 1 Year Warranty & Lifetime Support which was provided at no cost for review and have been very happy with it. For normal daily use it adds a little bulk, almost doubling the weight, but with that adds drop protection. I have dropped many times and although it shows a little wear as any plastic hitting concrete would, it has held up well, protected the phone, and still functions perfectly.The best thing about this case is having an extra battery with you for unplanned emergencies at any time. But other battery packs also provide this, what is unique is the design allows direct access to the lightning port and headphone jack with no obstructions. I needed this as my car audio system requires connection to the lightning data port for full functionality and other battery cases charge only with the microusb cable with the lightning port being locked inside the case always connected to the battery. Plus when it comes time to charge you can charge both the battery and the phone at the same time so recharge time is greatly improved.The camera is unobstructed and volume buttons are easy to use. When charging the phone you have to pull out the cable and plug it into the phone,  this results in a little loop pigtail during charging but the cable has held up well and I have never received an unsupported device warning.Note: The instructions are a little unclear, took a bit to figure out the hold time for the button (about 3 seconds did work) to initiate the phone charging after the cable is plugged in)

Adams Plus Flea and Tick Control for Dogs is similar to the other monthly Flea and Tick applications but the included and reusable "Smart Shield Applicator" is an improvement over the disposable snap and squeeze dispensers as it is easier to control and doesn't plop the entire dose in one spot which leaves a bit of a mess and end up on your hands.  The reusable applicator also parts the fur to get the drops onto your pet's skin and not on your hands.The disposable part you place inside the reusable dispenser is similar to other products and could be used without the Smart Shield applicator, but the disposable dispenser is shaped specifically for the applicator so other products will likely not work well with this applicator.As for the treatment itself, it appears to be the pretty standard formulation:Kills fleas, ticks, flea eggs, and flea larvae.Breaks the flea lifecycle to prevent infestation.Kills and repels mosquitoes.

The Skiva PowerFlow Duo C-3 was provided in consideration for this review.We have way too many devices in the car, this seems to be the place everything is low on battery life, and everybody wants access to a USB port.Until the car manufacturers start throwing in USB power ports like they did cup holders in the 80s this is the solution you need. We have one in the front and one in the back. No matter what anyone plugs in iphones, android or IPad tablets, everything seems to charge as quickly in the car as it does with a wall outlet charger.The build feels sturdy, did not get hot, did not introduce any audio system noise or high pitch from the device itself (a problem I have had with others) and fit well in the vehicles I tested in. The car charger did not slide out over time, the blue light made it easy to confirm it had power, and it was easy to remove when needed.

The Skiva PowerSkin IP5 Protective Battery Case (2000mAh) was provided in consideration for this review.I had been using other external battery cases for my iPhone 5s to deal with the iPhone's inability to last a full day on one charge. Unfortunately most all battery cases use a microusb port to charge the battery and don't pass anything other than power to the phone. This meant in my car I was unable to use phone features without removing the case.However with the Skiva PowerSkin I am able to access the Unblocked Lightning & Audio Port which allows two improvements over other power cases. I now can use the data, power, and audio features available with a proper lightning cable and I can charge the case at the same time as the phone as the case still charges with its own microusb cable.When it comes time to charge the phone from the battery in the case, I simply slide the lightning cable connector off of the back of the case and plug it into the phone. The short cable is durable and really doesn't get in the way of use. I can leave the cable connected charging while the phone is in my pocket, backpack, and while using it normally with any smartphone features.The camera opening is clear of any obstruction and doesn't cause distortion from shadows or flash reflections. Headphone port is fully accessible, and volume controls are easy to use. The shape and material are comfortable to hold and have a nice tech design look and feel. Battery power is indicated by 4 LED lights giving an approximate percentage power.The case offers good protection for your phone, although the case itself may not survive a drop as well as a soft exterior case. To date the case has survived all my drops so far.

The Skiva AudioFlow BigSound Ultra Loud 15 Watts Portable Wireless Bluetooth 4.0 Speaker with 8+ Hours of Battery (3000mAh) was provided in consideration for this review.Compact at about than 7.3" x 2.4" x 2.75" and about 1.2lbs the rubberized finish and metal grill holds 2 drivers which delivers a good balance particularly for outdoor use. For its size the bass was reasonable, especially at louder volume levels. At low volumes the bass seems to drop off significantly. Sound was distortion free at full volume with no overdriven lows or highs, very "listenable" at full volume.The 15W output is not going to compare to a 100W stereo system, but offers enough volume to enjoy in a noisy outdoor environment. Using indoors at mid volume levels the speaker makes a good choice for background music in a bedroom, kitchen, etc.Three buttons, one for answering calls, + and - ;  tap for FF/Rew, hold for vol +/-And a three position physical switch Off, Bluetooth, Aux input is through a combo micro usb cable included.With a physical power and BT switch that triggers automatic pairing, I found it difficult to switch paired devices and the physical power switch left me with a dead speaker when accidently left on for a couple days.Overall a good value balance for price, performance, features, and volume.

The Lexar JumpDrive S35 32GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive is fast.On my old standby USB drive I was getting 5MB/s write and 15MB/s readOn the Lexar Jump Drive S35 I got 22MB/s write and 37Mb/s read on a USB 2.0 port and 37MB/s write and 120MB/s read using a USB 3.0 portHowever... If I did not insert the Lexar S35 all the way quickly, it seemed to handshake USB 2.0 and I would get the USB 2.0 speed on the USB 3.0 port even after inserting all the way. There seemed to be two stages of secure connection and if I hesitated any on the first stop it would not transfer at the high speeds.When closed, the S35 is smaller than 1" x 2" x 0.5" when rotated to open the USB connector slides out as it rotates and extends the length from 2" to 2.5"The colored plastic outer case can flex and if when you rotate it is possible to create a bind where the USB connector will not extend.My old USB dongle has a metal outer case that it rotates in and I much prefer the durability of the metal case although with the MUCH faster transfer rates, I will be using the new S35.There is a small hole and a 2" long string lanyard with a small metal loop on the other end for attaching the JumpDrive to a keyring. simple push the string through the hole then pass the ring through the loop to secure.The JumpDrive includes EncryptStick "lite" with an option to upgrade to the full version which shows regular $40 and discounted to $13 as of this writing. It is not clear to me what features are added with the upgrade other than stronger encryption. EncryptStick was easy to use, could run off the JumpDrive and which made it easy to use on multiple devices. with encryptstick you must enter a password to unlock the drive files that are stored in the encryptstick vault. A nice feature is that the vault is sized dynamically so you don't have to decide when you start how much of the JumpDrive to set aside for the encrypted data.

The Philips AVENT Natural BPA Free Polypropylene Bottle for Newborns, 2 Ounce are the perfect first bottle.The small 2oz size is ideal for newborn, easy to hold from any angle, even the end. Small size allows you to place close to your body to mimic position of breastfeeding if needed.AVENT bottle naturally vent air in without leaking meaning easy flow, and less chance of swallowing air.Cleaning is easy with large openings and materials that don't hold stains or any leftover that has dried up.The design is compatible other AVENT products including bottle sterilizer so you can grow your collection as your needs change.

The Kaplan SAT Premier 2015-2016 with 8 Practice Tests: Book + Online + DVD + Mobile (Kaplan Test Prep) is an excellent book. It is huge 2.25" thick and over 800 pages. That being said, each section is easy to read, has excellent example problems, quizzes followed by several practice tests, and very good explanations for each solution.The book is broken down into sections Writing, Critical Reading, Comprehension, Math - Basic and Advanced and includes 6 full practice tests.The DVD was ok, not really enough content and I would have liked to have seen a better link between the book and the DVD. it feels they just threw together some videos from another project in.Online resources are also very good, with what seems to be a full online course that you might expect to pay more than the price of the book. There are videos for each session, monthly quizzes and more practice tests. Online access is only good for one year beyond registration and the registration process validates your purchase of the book by having you get a word from a chapter, section, paragraph in the book.Mobile was a complete fail. They promise an app, the online registration has a link to install the app, but it is not in the Apple Store. When I contacted them they said it is not available and they explained the mobile was intended to mean the PDF version of the book.Well the PDF was a fail too. It is a DRM protected Adobe book and my iPad Air refuse to authenticate access to the book.

The Tomcat Mouse Killer II, 1-Pack (Kid Resistant Disposable Mouse Bait Station) is a disposable, small 3"x4"x1.5" bait station with a clear lid to monitor the preloaded 1oz bait/poison block. The opening for rodents is under a not covered and about 1" diameter. Since the opening is not covered this bait station is not suitable for outdoor use as rain could blow into the opening.The plastic is durable, and seems to hold up well. I gave a little effort trying to open the station but it seems to be safely sealed agains anything not entering the small door. However, it is lightweight and could easily be dragged away and unfortunately there is no easy to use connection point to strap it down.Tomcat says each 1 oz block of with Bromethalin can kill up to 12 mice. I can attest that I have seen several dead mice from one bait block.

The Tomcat Live Catch Mouse Trap is a easy to use mousetrap that can safely be used anywhere you have the space for it.When set the trap takes a space of about 8" long, 2" wide, and about 2.5" high.To use you remove a small bait door and place drops or other bait to lure the mouse down the tunnel. You then open the trap door which acts as legs holding the trap in position. When the mouse enters it causes the tube to lift the legs which closes the trap door. If the mouse tries to push the trap door open, it can not for several reasons. The legs snap locked and you must pull them apart to open, and unless a cat or other mouse knocks the trap over the legs are under the trap which much be lifted to open the door.As long as you don't wait too long (mice won't live long trapped) you can safely release the mouse outdoor without any danger of coming in contact with the mouse by snapping the trap door back open and dumping the mouse out.If you waited to long and the mouse has expired, the durable plastic is smooth and easy to clean with soap and water, although the odor of a dead mouse is a bit difficult to remove. (my experience). Another problem if you leave them in too long, they could chew their way out. So far I have not had this happen in this trap but eventually all my plastic no kill traps end up with holes in them. I even had a shock killer trap that apparently just knocked out a mouse who eventually came too and destroyed the trap. But that is another review...The trap must be used on a smooth surface ir the legs may catch and not allow the door to shut. so you will need to place on something smooth if used on rough concrete, carpet, etc.

The Tomcat Mouse Killer I (Kid and Dog Resistant Refillable Mouse Bait Station, Bag w/ 16 Bait Blocks) includes 16 1oz bait/poison blocks in a resealable plastic bag along with a small 4"x4"x1.5" bait station with a clear lid and secure bait block loading tray that requires two hands to open (child proof). The opening for rodents is under a covered entry and about 1" diameter. Weather resistant, you would not want to let the station sit in a pool of water, although the base is slightly elevated to keep a small amount of water out.The plastic is durable, easy to clean, and seems to hold up well. It is lightweight and could easily be dragged away and unfortunately there is no easy to use connection point to strap it down.Tomcat says each 1 oz block of with Bromethalin can kill up to 12 mice. I can attest that I have seen several dead mice and I am still on the first block, so the bag of 16 should last me a while.

This review is for NUMI Organic Tea Capsules, Jasmine Green, 16 CountNumi describes the Jasmine Green as "Fragrant Flowers are laid atop organic green tea leaves as their scent is naturally embraced. Scented three times, this smooth green tea has layers of subtle fragrance and hints of moonlight"The tea brews up a pale orange color, similar, but less intense to the color of the K-Cup lid. With slight hints of a floral note, the tea is primarily a natural green tea that is easy to drink, is not bitter, and can be easily consumed with no sweetener added.After brewing the tea leaves are a vibrant green and appear to be a good quality with mostly larger fannings.The cup is said to be recyclable but there is no tab for easy removal of the lid or fiber basket. Removing the cup is difficult and the mesh basket appears to be fused to the plastic. While the cup does protect the tea from oxidation during storage, if Numi really intends the cups to be recycled they should make the removal process much easier.

Sentry Fiproguard Plus for Dogs, Squeeze-On seems to have the same ingredients as Frontline Plus which we have been using. It has worked just as well, and applies the same way by squeezing the liquid under the fur onto the back between the shoulder blades to be absorbed through the skin.As far as I can tell this is a straightforward lower cost (less than 1/2 the price of Frontline Plus) substitution that works identically.

The Watermax Neutral pH Water Treatment, 1-Quart is a neutral pH water treatment that noticeably improved the water quality in my hydroponic system. I was getting scale and some slime build up and after just a few weeks I noticed a significant improvement. Roots were clean, and seemed to have more abundant fine hairs as they were now looking fresh and clean.Plant growth improved as the water quality improved.The active ingredient is "Hypochlorous Acid" 0.028%It has a fairly strong odor, similar to chlorine, with a hint of ocean (saltiness). Warnings indicate to rinse well any contact with skin or eyes, drink plenty of water if swallowed, and move to fresh air if inhaled.As a side note, my bottle had 2 layers of labels. although both were easy to remove they overlaid the new one instead of removing the old first. I guess that was just a pass of the bottles through the labeling machine. The old front label had a paragraph statement rather than the new bullet list and the old back label was a larger easier to read bolder font. It seems the opted for the new label to use more space for the logo and flag icons.

The Extreme Max 3005.3726 Heavy-Duty Spare Tire Carrier is heavy duty and easy to install on rails up to 3" wide and 5" highThe heavy duty U-bolts, plates and curved pipe are not pretty but will stand the test of time. I had no problem mounting my 15" 5 lug spare and it is rated for 4,5 and 6 lug wheels up to 16 1/2".Mounting was easy and only required a socket set, no drilling, measuring, adjusting, just clamp on and tighten. I mounted mine just in front of the fender well on the drivers side and it placed the spare within the extents of the existing trailer fender to I won't be hitting anything with the tire that I wouldn't have hit with the fender.

The Hoover A301 Air Purifier WH10401 is a nice quiet air filtration system to help reduce dust and pollen in the air.On low I measured (no guarantees of accuracy, just to give relative numbers between speeds) about 80CFM, Medium 110CFM and high 220CFM, on low you hear the hum of the motor, medium sounds like a car A/C on low, and high sounds like a car on Max A/C.Air predominantly flows in from the bottom, some from the side and exits out the top. I found that the filter has a tendency to build up dust on the bottom edge so I rotate the filter periodically but the center has remained fairly clean.The system has a carbon Odor-Absorbing Filter filter for odor which has a recommended replacement time of 3 months and a "HEPA-Type Filter"  with a recommended life of 6 months. The filter size is just under 12"x19" and 2" thick.The is no UV light or ozone ionizer, this is just air moving through 2 filters. The main filter is paper and not washable and I have yet to find a resource for replacement filters. The carbon filter could be replaced with any compatible size or larger as it is a sheet that could be easily cut if needed.The system can be used horizontally, but in this case all the words and numbers on the control panel will be upside down

The Skiva Powervault A15000 Ultra High Capacity Portable Battery Pack was provided for review.About the size of a tablet, the 15,000mAh Powervault is a slim 7.28"x4.31"x0.39" and is a lightweight 11.2ozThe instructions were not exactly clear to me with instructions "slide the on/off button to the on position" and I was not initially able to turn the until on to see if it was shipped charged. When I plugged it in to charge the battery pack, it showed nearly a full charge yet it would not turn on to charge my device. After reading other reviews let me repeat for those reading here the solution.***** Turn on by sliding your finger across the touch pad from the left Unlock icon towards the right Lock icon with a LIGHT touch *****It wasn't the direction that was causing me the trouble, it was using a light touch.I apparently was pressing too hard which initially seemed to not have any effect. Interestingly enough after getting the hang of it I can not do it wrong now even if I try and it is super easy to use. With a touch pad control you don't have to worry about accidental powering on, but even then the unit will power down if not actively charging.There are so many great features with this battery pack it is hard to say which is best. But I have to same the form factor makes it great for travel. It fits in the same backpack compartment as my tablet, it easily slides in the side of my camera bag, and in use lays flat under my device.The unit has two input micro usb connectors for faster charging, although one works just fine. There are also two USB power ports, one seems to operate at 1A and the other at 2A but they are not labeled and the manual indicates 5V 6A  (3A, 3A)  output. For my use as a backup battery both ports worked fine and provided the power needed to recharge any 2 devices simultaneously from the 15,000mAh battery. I have used the Powervault to recharge tablets, phones, and cameras. All seem to charge at about the same rate as any other charging source I have used.Like most other external battery packs, the unit will not pass through a charge. If it is plugged into a power source, any device plugged into it will not be charged until the power source is removed.The design and finish is really upscale. The textured finish has a leather look with no fingerprints and the gold trim conveys the premium quality and can be used in any setting.

The Alpha Grillers Best Garlic Press And Peeler - Solid Stainless Steel Mincer And Silicone Tube Roller - Crush Ginger was provided for review.This arrived just in time, I was really getting tired of my previous garlic press, and the Alpha Grillers surpasses my expectations.Not a big deal for me but the fabric lined box makes a nice presentation as a gift.The press is super easy to use, you can mince garlic in the peel or for a little better result use the included silicone tube peeler for quick, clean peeling with no garlic smell from peeling by hand, or knife cleanup using a smash and peel method. My only negative is the silicone tube had a bit of flashing on the outside from manufacturing, but it was easy enough to remove.The fit and finish on the press is superb, the hinge action is smooth with no wobble and the shiny chrome finish is easy to clean with a quick rinse or in the dishwasher. All the smashed garlic was expelled out the mincing holes, no leaking out the sides and the flip out mincer stays connected so there is nothing to lose while providing easy to access for thorough cleaning.Mincing ginger takes a little more pressure than garlic, but it works just as well. In either case the flush bottom of the press makes it easy to slide your knife along the bottom edge and remove all the minced pieces and juices. You no longer have any excuse to not use fresh garlic or ginger for your sauté, stir fry, soup, stew, marinade, etc.

The Winkine Vintage Canvas Laptop Backpack - Functional School College Outdoor Travel Rucksack / Shoulder Bag - Fit 15.6 Inch was provided for review.This is a heavy duty "vintage look" canvas backpack that has a lot to like. The main compartment is 12"x15"x5", and a laptop sleeve and a small zippered pocket near the top. The front pocket is 9"x12"x1" and has another 8.5"x9" sleeve. On each side is storage suitable for water bottles.The external material is a very thick and durable canvas with a high density padding on the back. The internal lining is a high quality and easy to clean rip stop nylon. Zippers have leather pull straps, and large nylon teeth that operate smoothly and lock strongly.There are no velcro straps or plastic clips on this backpack, double D rings cinch up the shoulder straps, snaps for most closures, the front flap stays in place with strong magnetic snap like connectors that are easy to connect.All stitching is clean and also appears to be very durable.

The Skybar FPSKBW8216 Electric Wine Opener is a well made and stylish wine bottle opener, for those that are looking for electric ease of use.I had previously used a rabbit lever type, but after several years of easy opening, but difficult storage, something snapped inside and the screw stopped turning properly.The Skybar opener stands about 12.5" tall in the charger, and is easy to remove from the charger as long as you have about 15" from countertop to any cabinet above.The handle of the unit is a solid feeling lightly brushed stainless steel with a smoky translucent base to you can see the action, and weighs just over 1lb. The base is a shiny black plastic with a similar steel base and plugs into a removable power cord that has a low voltage transformer 1'5"x2" that connects to the wall outlet on the end of a 5" cord.When operating the motor has a smooth sound that is not very loud and steadily removes the cork in less than 8 seconds. then another 8 seconds to eject the cork using the motor in reverse.While this may be overkill for some that find the task of opening a bottle of wine to not be very difficult, if you have trouble with manual openers then consider this upgrade as it is certainly effortless.I would like to see a better foil remover included. The one that fits in the base is a single piece of squared edge plastic side hinge with two solid blades. It is not very comfortable to hold, is a little small for my hands, and take a bit of effort to squeeze and hold properly as it scrapes around the bottle. I prefer a roller blade style that glides smoothly around the bottle with a larger rounder shape to hold.

Doctor's Best Estrog-100 Nutritional Supplement, 30 Count seems to help and no noticeable side effects. at 50 a day it is not too expensive to try.The capsules are a little large but they contain a powder that is easy to take when added to food, drink, smoothie. The powder has a bit of a bittersweet chocolate flavor with a hint of green (grassy) essence. Not at all unpleasant and is not bitter to detract from what ever you add it too as long as there is some complimentary flavor.

The is nothing wrong with the Victor Mini M754SN Rodent Repeller with Nightlight, 4-Pack - as far as I can tell...Night light is nice, you know it has power and you have some light in a dark room.Ultrasonic and nobody can hear it, even though I have some in my family that can hear high pitched sounds I can not. Had to buy a new TV once because someone said it made a terrible noise that I could not hear.I have several traps and poison bait stations around and over time I have seen less and less activity. Am I killing them or is the ultrasonic keeping them away, hard to say but these are fairly low cost, safe, and might just work...

An emotional, sweet, and absolutely fantastic romance, Sins of a Duke was an excellent read. I really loved this book. It had likable characters, a great story, and a lovely romance.Constance was great. She knew when to go after what she wanted but also refused to let herself be a doormat. She judged a person by merit rather than rumor and knew when it was time to forgive. She was lively, kind, and a really likable heroine.Lucan was interesting. At first, I was worried that he would come off as unlikable because he was using an innocent woman as a means for revenge. But, it quickly became clear that he had more of a conscience than he admitted to. His desire for revenge stemmed from the guilt he felt from being unable to protect his sister and, in the end, it wasn't in him to truly hurt someone. He showed that he could be very sweet and was willing to fight for the woman he loved, even if that meant just waiting for her forgiveness. I thought he was wonderful.The romance was perfect. Constance and Lucan were lovely together. They were such a sweet couple and an equal one. Constance knew when to let Lucan squirm for what he had done but knew that, when an apology was as heartfelt as the one Lucan gave, it was time to forgive. No melodramatics, thank goodness. And, they definitely had chemistry together that smoldered at their every meeting.The plot moved quickly and kept me hooked right from the start. The story was wonderful and the ending was perfect.Sins of a Duke was a delightful historical romance that I absolutely loved. It was wonderfully sweet, romantic and emotional. Everything about it was just perfect. Romance lovers, this is a book you won't want to miss.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

A lovely romance and a wonderful continuation of the Notorious Flynns series, The Scoundrel's Lover was an enjoyable read. With passionate characters and a great story, this book was great and I liked it.Annabelle was a heroine who definitely had a will of her own. When she decided she wanted something, she went after it with everything in her. Sometimes, that was annoying, like with her insistence that she wanted to marry a proper husband rather than a man she would be happy with. It was annoying that she kept complaining about how she had to want the man she couldn't have when the only reason she couldn't have him was because she was set on a proper marriage. But, when she finally realized the mistake she made, she went after love and made amends for unintentionally hurting Marcus. So, in the end, I was fine with her.Marcus was amazing. He was definitely a survivor who had made something of himself that he could be proud of. He was protective and caring of Annabelle and just absolutely adorable in general. I just loved him.The romance was great. It was obvious that Annabelle and Marcus cared about each other from the start and it didn't take long for that to become love. Annabelle's issues made it a bit frustrating at some points, but I still liked them together. And the chemistry between them was super hot with scenes steamy enough to make you fan your face.The plot was fast paced and I was able to stay interested all the way through. Other than my issue with Annabelle, I really liked the story and the ending was great. I'm excited to read Crispin's story in the next book.The Scoundrel's Lover was a really lovely romance and I liked it. Romance lovers, this is a book worth checking out.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

The Darkest London series continues with another fantastic book. Soulbound was dark, thrilling, and wonderfully romantic. I loved this book and I thought it was an excellent read.Eliza was a heroine who wanted nothing more than the freedom to make what she wanted of her life. She was strong, often stubborn, but also smart enough to know what to do in just about any situation. She had her flaws, sharp tongue included, but that made her seem like a more real character. I really liked her.Adam was wonderful. Like Eliza, he had his flaws, namely his impulsive actions in trying to claim Eliza in a way that was guaranteed to make her run. But, he was also very protective of his GIM, whom he considered his children, and determined to make Eliza love him. He came off as gruff, but he was really sweet. I thought he was great.The romance  definitely came off to a tumultuous start. But, once they were able to get to know each other beyond Adam's desperation and Eliza's suspicion, they were clearly perfect together. And they definitely had chemistry that sent more than a few sparks flying.The plot was fast paced and had me hooked from page 1. As with every book in this series, there were twists, thrills, and plenty of surprises along the way. The story was wonderfully dark and the ending was great. I'm excited to read the next book in the fantastic Darkest London series!Soulbound was a dark, thrilling, and fantastic romance that I really liked. Romance lovers, this is a book not to be missed.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

A lovely second chance romance that I thought was sweet, Lady Vice was a great historical romance and I really liked it.Lavinia was okay. On the good side, she was strong and resilient enough to survive whatever situation faced her. On the bad side, I found myself getting frequently frustrated with her apparent determination to think the worst of Max, even though he never gave her a reason to think that way. It was especially frustrating because she berated him for not trusting her but was clearly unable to trust the best in him. So, that got on my nerves and brought down the book a bit for me. But, overall, I was fine with Lavinia's character. She just wasn't really my favorite heroine.Max, on the other hand, was perfection. He was so sweet, so devoted to Lavinia and determined to prove himself worthy of her trust. He had made a name for himself, facing some real danger along the way, and he still remained humble and kind. I just adored him.The romance was sweet. I thought Lavinia and Max were great together. It was clear that, despite the years apart, they loved each other as much as ever.The plot was good, well paced enough to keep me engaged all the way through. There was kind of a mystery involved, but it wasn't much of one considering there was only one suspect at the start who turned out to be the culprit. But, it was a surprise to see how crazy this person was. Overall, I enjoyed the story and the ending was sweet.Lady Vice was a lovely historical romance and I enjoyed reading it. Romance lovers, you'll want to check this book out.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

With plenty of thrills, secrets, and lovely romance, Of Silk and Steam was a fantastic steampunk romance. It had engaging characters, plots and betrayals, and I really enjoyed all of it.Mina was a great heroine. She was very strong, clever, and loyal to those she cared about. It definitely wouldn't do to underestimate her. My only issue was that I got vaguely frustrated at how she was unable to let herself trust Leo. He had proven himself her match and earned her trust but she still held on to hesitance. I understood her reasoning, but I was also somewhat annoyed. But, other than that, I really liked her.Leo was wonderful. He knew and loved Mina exactly as she was and he strong and smart enough to be able to keep up with her. He was also sweet, compassionate, and just overall adorable. I really liked him as well.The romance was lovely. Mina and Leo were perfect together. They were definitely each other's match and one hell of a team when they worked together. And the chemistry between them was there from the start and definitely turned up the heat.The plot moved quickly and kept me hooked all the way through. There were plenty of thrills, secrets, and betrayals that kept me on the edge of my seat. I really liked the story and I thought the ending was perfect.Of Silk and Steam was a dark, thrilling, and very enjoyable steampunk romance. From start to finish, it was an excellent read. Romance lovers, this is a book you won't want to miss.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

A sweet historical romance, Miss Winters Proposes was a lovely read. Not particularly memorable, but an enjoyable romance that I liked.Both characters were likable. There wasn't anything special about either, but I found Juliet to be determined and Benjamin to be sweet when he wasn't trying to push people away. So, I was fine with them both.The romance was okay. I wish there had been more of a transition from Juliet and Benjamin being strangers to being in love. As it was, we missed the whole falling in love with each other part. Also, I wish that they had actually tried to fight for each other more, rather than just being to scared to change the original terms of their marriage and running away at the first conflict. Despite these issues, though, I did think they were good together.The plot moved quickly and I was kept interested all the way through. The story was nice and the ending was sweet.Miss Winters Proposes was a good historical romance and I liked it. Romance lovers, you might want to check this book out.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

An absolutely charming and enjoyable historical romance, In for a Penny was a lovely read. I really liked it. I thought it was a sweet romance.Penelope was a sensible, intelligent kind of heroine, which I found refreshing. She was understanding, though unwilling to be made a fool of. I thought she was great.Nev was an absolute charmer. He was sweet, charismatic, and just adorable in general. And, when it came to the well-being of those in his care, he was willing to do anything. I thought it was perfect.The romance was lovey. Penelope and Nev were perfect for each other. They started out with an amiable relationship and it was nice seeing that deepen as they dealt with their new life together. I thought they were great together.The story was fast paced and really enjoyable. There were a few twists along the way and the ending was great.In for a Penny was a delightful historical romance and I really liked it. Romance lovers, this is a book worth the read.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

An absolutely amazing YA read, filled with magic, thrills, secrets, and sweet romance, The Storyspinner was a brilliant read. I LOVED this book! It was a beautifully written, fantastic YA tale of epic proportions and I loved every bit of it.The way the story was told was interesting. It was different, but it really worked for the book. Two separate story lines are told concurrently, until they converge near the end of the book. On one side was Johanna and Rafael and their lives in the human world, while the magic-wielding Keepers were on the other side, trying to find the lost princess to restore balance to their worlds. Meanwhile, the point of view shifted between each of the five main characters, plus a couple of scenes from another's perspective. Normally, I would find this annoying, but it was very well done in this book. The transition between characters flowed and I never got confused about whose head I was in. All of this worked really well for the book and, along with the beautiful prose, I thought it was all very well written.The main human characters (Johanna and Rafael) were both great. Johanna was strong, clever, and very protective of her brothers. I thought she was just lovely and I really liked her. Rafael seems cold and distant on the surface, but it doesn't take long to realize that he was a very honorable person who was extremely dedicated to his people and super sweet when he wanted to be. He was wonderful and I totally adored him.The romance with these two was so sweet. It progressed naturally, which I appreciated. They were perfect together. Though after a certain revelation near the end of the book, I wonder if (and how) their relationship will change. We'll see...The Keepers (there were three of them) were also great. Jacare was very honorable and determined to do what was best for everyone, in both worlds. Pira was strong and very independent, though she could sometimes cross the line into a shrew, acting rude and judgmental . Leao was very sweet. But, be careful not to underestimate him. He might seem naive and innocent, but he was also a force to be reckoned with. I thought all three of them were wonderful characters.There was a light romance between Pira and Leao. It developed slowly, due to Pira's bull-headedness, but I'm interested to see where their relationship goes.The plot was fast paced and I was totally hooked the entire way through. There were plenty of thrills to keep me on the edge of my seat, along with secrets and political games. And, the atmosphere of the characters' world really drew me in. I loved the story and the ending has me itching to get my hands on book 2. Can't wait to read it!The Storyspinner was a brilliant YA read. I absolutely LOVED this book! From the engaging characters and sweet romances, to the endless thrills, surprising secrets, and fantastic story, this book was amazing. YA lovers, this book is a must read.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

Charming and romantic, The Captain's Bluestocking Mistress was a fantastic historical romance. It was a lovely addition to the Dukes of War series and I really liked it.Jane was great. She was tired of being forgotten and wanted a taste of passion, which she was totally unafraid of going after. She was kind, understanding, and a likable character.Xavier was wonderful. He was a man with a heavy conscience, burdened by what he did during the war. But, he was a good man at heart who was haunted by having to do bad things and a sweetie at that.The romance was delightful. Jane and Xavier were perfect together. They had a strange start, but they were a perfect match.The plot moved quickly and kept me hooked right from the start. I really liked the story and I loved how it ended.The Captain's Bluestocking Mistress was a fantastic historical romance. I really enjoyed reading this lovely book. Romance lovers, this is a book you'll want to read.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

An utterly charming and delightful historical romance, Wicked, My Love was a wonderful read. With sparkling wit, lively humor, and a lovely romance, this book was fantastic and I absolutely loved it.Isabella was a lovely heroine. Scary smart and defiantly independent, she was definitely no shrinking flower. Until she was put amongst people and her social awkwardness revealed itself. She was likable in her flaws and I thought she was a great character.Randall was such a charmer. He could wrap someone around his fingers with a few well-thought out words and charm the whole of society to adore him. Except for Isabella, who was too knowledgeable of his tricks. But, past that, he was smarter than he was given credit for and he truly wanted to help people with his political career, rather than be a pretty puppet. He was also sweet, kind, and just an overall adorable character who I really liked.The romance was well done. Isabella and Randall had known and hated each other since they were children. But, it didn't take much for all that energy to change to lust and for them to realize how much they cared about each other without the habit of animosity. They both understood and accepted each other, flaws and all. Not to mention that the chemistry between them was steamy and definitely turned the heat up. I thought they were great together.I had two small issues with the book. 1) The pace was slow in some places. Not enough to be boring, but enough that it was a noticeable change. And, 2) it was somewhat frustrating how tightly Isabella clung to her old hatred. I understood her reasoning, but I also wanted to shake some sense into her. However, these were both very minor issues and I still loved the book despite them.Other than the aforementioned few places along the plot that slowed down, most of the story moved quickly and kept me fully engaged. The humor in this book was delightful and had me full on smiling more than once. I really liked the story and the ending was simply lovely.Wicked, My Love was a dazzlingly lovely, sweetly romantic book that I really liked. It was a fun, enjoyable read. Romance lovers, this is definitely a book you won't want to miss.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

The best compliment I can give a book was that it was different and unique enough to surprise me. Waiting for April was able to do just that. Beautifully romantic, packed with secrets and twists, this book was brilliant. It took the used-before concept on reincarnation and made it into a new story that had me absorbed from page 1. I absolutely loved this book.April was a great heroine. She wasn't perfect. She had flaws and made mistakes but, at the end of the day, she was kind, determined, and admitted to her mistakes. I thought she was lovely.I absolutely adored Scott. He was so purely devoted to April. To him, her happiness was of the utmost importance, even if that meant stepping aside and letting her live her own life. He had been through a lot in the years he repeatedly lost and found April and that made him a deep and easily sympathetic character. Not to mention he was totally swoon-worthy and so sweet. I just loved him.The romance was a delight. Things started off rocky but there was never a doubt that April and Scott loved each other, even before April knew the truth of her past. They were the type of couple who would die for each other or wait for each other, whatever needed to be done so that they could be together. And, there was some seriously hot chemistry between these two. Let's just say they couldn't keep their hands off of each other. I thought they were perfect together.The plot moved quickly, keeping me hooked right from the start. There were a few twists along the way, along with some secrets that took me by surprise. I loved the story and the ending just about shattered my heart. There had better be a sequel because there is so much more of the story to tell and my heart can't accept the ending as it is. Here's hoping for a book 2!Waiting for April was a fantastic romance with a paranormal touch. I absolutely loved this wonderfully romantic and pleasantly surprising read. Romance lovers, this is a must read book.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

A fun and charming historical romance novella, When Good Earls Go Bad was a sweet read and I liked it.Both characters were great. Matthew was inclined to logic and seriousness but he had his own wry sense of humor as well. Annabelle was effervescent and inclined to see the joy in everything. I liked them both.The romance was great. Matthew and Annabelle were perfect together. They might have seemed really different on the surface but they were well matched and a lovely couple.The plot was quick and kept me interested. The story was sweet and the ending was perfect.When Good Earls Go Bad was a lovely historical romance novella. Romance lovers, if you want a quick and light read, then you'll want to look this book up.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

A sweet YA romance that was different enough to be truly memorable, I Remember You was a fantastic read. I really liked this book. It had sweet romance, as well as a few surprises in store, and I thought it was excellent.Juliet was a great heroine. She started out narrow in her way of thinking but she slowly became more accepting and, consequently, more mature and ultimately more likable. I really liked her character.Lucas was interesting. The whole question of why he had certain memories that hadn't happened yet was an engaging mystery. The reason why definitely took me by surprise. But, past that, he was also super sweet and totally adorable. I really liked him as well.The romance was great. The future memory thing added a deeper element to it, with Lucas already knowing how much he would love Juliet when they met. It made the nature if their relationship intense. The romance took a few unexpected turns along the way. Did it end well? You'll have to read to find out :)My only issue with the book was that Rosemary, Julie's friend, annoyed me. She was somewhat cold and cynical in her way of thinking and I didn't like the cruel way she led Dex (a sweet guy who liked her) along. It also made me annoyed with Juliet for not calling her friend out on her behavior. So, that brought down the book a bit.The plot moved quickly, keeping me hooked from page 1. The characters were engaging, the story was unique, and the ending tied up the story while leaving a little room for interpretation.I Remember You was a fantastic YA read that I absolutely loved. It was different, surprising, and an ultimately enjoyable book. YA lovers, this is a book worth the read.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

Wow. This book was one hell of a ride. With constant twists and turns that kept me on the edge of my seat, Red Queen was an amazing YA fantasy. This book managed to take me by surprise more than once and had me completely hooked. I absolutely LOVED it!Mare was an amazing heroine. She had a lot of growth, just within this one book. She started off with a strict view of the world, always sure that she was right. But, as the book went on and so many secrets were revealed, so many games were played, and she started to realize that nothing was as it seemed and the black and white view of the world she had didn't allow for all those shades of gray. And, throughout all that, she was consistently a strong character who did everything she could to not only survive, but protect her loved ones and make a difference. She was an excellent character and I can't wait to see how things go for her in book 2.The two princes, Cal and Maven, were both interesting character. They were both complex and hid quite a few secrets. And those secrets meant that their roles changed as more and more of them were revealed, all the way until a huge betrayal that set the stage and totally blew me away. They each had their own motives and things with them weren't so easily split into "good" and "bad." I can't say more without giving too much away, but I thought they were both delightfully enigmatic characters.The romance in this book was light. The focus was on the political games at play. It did, however, play a role in the story and add another element to the manipulations that were pulling everyone's strings. Though after that ending, things are looking dark in the romance department. I'm excited to see how it plays out, or if it even does, in the next book.The plot was fast paced and I was utterly riveted the entire way through. The political intrigue, secrets, manipulations, and betrayals kept things unpredictable. With all the twists and turns and unexpected surprises, I was totally one the edge of my seat. And the final betrayal that was revealed left me reeling and completely changed the game. I loved the story and the ending has me itching to get my hands on book 2. I can't wait to see what happens next!Red Queen was a brilliant YA fantasy that I absolutely loved. It was thrilling and unpredictable, complete with twists, secrets, and shocking betrayals. And I enjoyed every bit of it. YA lovers, this book is a must read.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

An enchanting sequel full of magic and romance, All That Burns was a lovely YA fantasy. It had a few twists, a great tie in with Camelot, and it was definitely as good as the first. I absolutely loved this book.My favorite part of the book was how the history and characters of Camelot were tied in. Maybe it's because I just finished watching "Merlin" but I've been fond of the story lately and it was nice seeing it worked into this book.Emrys was great in this book. After giving up her magic to be with Richard, she was facing the consequences of that. Those consequences weren't sugar-coated. She struggled with the changes and had moments where she missed her magic and wondered at the wisdom of her choice. That struggle made her an interesting character and ultimately made her resolve stronger. She proved that she was tough with or without magic. She was already a great character and, in this book, she was even better.Richard was still absolutely adorable. He wasn't in this book as much as the last one because he and Emrys were both dealing with their respective crises. But, he showed how loyal he was to Emrys and how much he would do for her and he was as sweet as ever.The romance was lovely. Emrys and Richard were both so devoted to each other and building a world where mortals and fae could live together. They were a perfect couple.The plot was fast paced and I was hooked the entire way through. There were plenty of twists and unexpected surprises that kept me on the edge of my seat. I loved the story and the ending was lovely.All That Burns was a fantastic YA fantasy read that I really loved. It was a lovely sequel and I really enjoyed it. YA lovers, this is definitely a book you'll want to check out.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

I really liked this one. Charming, sweet, and delightfully romantic, The Spinster Bride was a wonderful read that I really liked. It had moments of humor, suspense, and sweetness and I loved every bit of it.Marjorie was a lovely heroine. A kind, friendly-to-everyone type of person. But, she was also sick of following her mother's rules, particularly when it came to her future happiness. So, we also saw how determined she could be when she set her mind to something. I thought she was a great character and I really liked her.Charles was adorable. He was a sweet, genuinely kind, charming, and wicked when the time called for it. I loved how sweet he was not only with Marjorie, but with her brother, who I'll get to later. He was just perfect and I really liked him as well.The romance was wonderful. I was a bit worried that I would get frustrated with the character, as I sometimes do in situations where one is trying to match-make the other. But, in this case, it worked very well. Even while they were on a bride search, Marjorie and Charles grew closer and they didn't try to hide their feelings. And, when they decided that being together was worth the obstacles that they would have to overcome, nothing would keep them apart. I thought they were great together.Marjorie's brother and mother played an important role in the book as well. Her brother had something along the lines of Asperger's syndrome, if I'm reading it correctly and Marjorie was very protective over him, particularly because of how harshly her mother treated the odd young man. I really liked his sweet, not-a-mean-bone-in-his-body character and the fact that Marjorie and even Charles were so protective of him made me like them both that much more.Marjorie's mother, though, was a whole other story. She was mean at first and I flat-out didn't like her. When we started getting chapters that flashed back to her earlier life, I wasn't much a fan. But, as the book went on, those chapters allowed me to see why she was the way she was. And, in the end, when she had a moment of realization about what was really important, those looks into her life made me understand her more. So, in the end, I thought she was, if not a character I could really like, at least one I found interesting.The plot moved quickly and kept me hooked all the way through. There were a couple of surprises along the way, but it was really the character development that kept things going. I really liked the story and I thought the ending was perfect.The Spinster Bride was a fantastic, truly excellent historical romance that I loved from start to finish. It was charming, with both fun and serious moments, romantic, and genuinely enjoyable. Romance lovers, this is definitely a book you won't want to miss.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

Earls Just Want to Have Fun was a lovely historical romance. Sweet and with a delightful couple of characters, it was a fantastic read and I really liked it.Marlowe was a great heroine. She was definitely different than the mold, having been raised on the streets as a thief. She was clever, tough, and unimpressed by wealth and titles. She was definitely a fun heroine, with her entertaining reactions to the life of the aristocracy. I thought she was lovely.Dane was, to be honest, totally stuffy and pompous at first. But, over the course of the book, Marlowe's influence opened his eyes to the realities of the world. He loosened up and became a more accepting type of person. And, through it all, he was always a kind, honorable man who had his sweet moments. He was a wonderful hero.The romance was lovely. Marlowe and Dane were an odd couple, with their different backgrounds, but they were perfectly matched. And, they definitely had a ton of chemistry that turned the heat up. They were great together.The plot was fast paced and I was hooked the entire way through. The story was fantastic and the ending was perfect.Earls Just Want to Have Fun was a delightful romance that I really liked. It was a charming, fun, and very sweet read. Romance lovers, this is a book you won't want to miss.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

I really enjoyed Temptation Has Green Eyes. It was a nice read, though not perfect, with a strong heroine, intriguing secrets, and good romance. I thought it was a sweet read.Let me start with what I liked:Sophia was awesome. This lady was smart, strong, and certainly tougher than people assumed her to be. She was the best part of the book for sure and I thought she was just wonderful.Max, when he wasn't letting his cynicism overtake him, could be very sweet. He was clever enough to match up with Sophia and caring of his loved ones.Now, to what I didn't like, which was a few minor issues that became enough to bring the book down.First, sometimes, Max could be so frustrating. He let himself cling to suspicions and act like an idiot, while Sophia was trying to navigate her new life on her own. It wasn't until the very end that he managed to scrape together enough trust to change that. So, that was annoying.Second, the romance was honestly not what I hoped it would be. It didn't get much of an actual relationship with them. It was mostly them going between acting distantly to not being able to keep their hands off of each other. There was no in between until near the end. Now, I still thought they were well matched and, when someone (Max) wasn't specifically trying to distance them, they were sweet together. And, they definitely had chemistry. However, it just wan't as deep of a relationship as I hoped it would be.Last, the whole secret thing. On one hand, I really liked how Sophia handled it and the secret itself was intriguing. However, it was somewhat of a letdown that the entire book was spent building up to the moment of revelation and that moment was almost anticlimactic. What saved it for me, though, was how much of a badass Sophia was when she refused to fall in to another person's game.These issues brought the book down, but I was still able to enjoy it overall. It wasn't a perfect read, but it was a perfectly nice one.Temptation Has Green Eyes was a good historical romance. Despite any issues I had, I still enjoyed the story. Romance lovers, you might want to look this book up.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

An interesting YA read with a really cool premise, Soulprint was an enjoyable read. I really liked the whole idea of soul identification and it turned out to be a lovely story.Alina was a fantastic heroine. She was definitely easy to sympathize for, having had her freedom taken away and being constantly judged for a past life she had no control over. It seemed like to matter what she did, her past life affected how people treated her (well, most people). But, despite that, she was strong, smart, and determined to find freedom. I really liked her.Cameron was good as well. He had a bad past of his own that he was judged by (though in his present life, not his past), so he understood Alina more than most people could. I wish there had been a little more depth to his character, but I still thought he was sweet and likable.The romanced was light, but sweet and I thought Alina and Cameron were great together.The plot was okay, though definitely slow in some places. The first half was only mildly interesting and it wasn't until the second half, when secrets started coming into light, that I was really drawn in. Those secrets definitely took me by surprise and really brought the book up for me. I enjoyed the story and the ending was great. It wrapped a few thing up, but left room for a sequel, should there be one.Soulprint was a great YA read that I really enjoyed. It had an interesting idea, likable characters, and surprising secrets in store. YA lovers, this is a book worth checking out.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

An absolutely epic conclusion to a fantastic series, Shadow of the War Machine was simply amazing. With lovely romance, shocking secrets, unexpected twists, and enough thrills to keep me on the edge of my seat, this book was wonderful and I absolutely loved it!Meg once again proved how strong of a heroine she was. Even in the direst situations, she wouldn't admit defeat. She was tough, clever, and had grown into an admirable character that I really liked.After Will having been absent for most of book 2, I was happy to see more of his in this book. He was just wonderful. He was clever, resilient and a more worthy man than he believed himself to be. Not to mention he was so sweet and devoted to Meg. I absolutely adored him.The romance was lovely. With Meg and Will together, it was clear to see how much they cared for each other, even if it meant having to wait to truly be together. They were a perfect couple.The plot was fast paced and I was completely hooked the entire way through. There were so many twists along the way, tons of thrills, and plenty of surprises. The reveal of who the culprit behind all the threats took me by surprise, especially with how it connected to Meg's family. I loved the story and the ending was just perfect.Shadow of the War Machine was a brilliant ending to the Secret Order trilogy. Filled with romance, thrills, secrets, and surprises, this book definitely doesn't disappoint. Fans of the series, you will love this book. And, YA lovers, this is a series you won't want to miss.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

A Most Improper Proposal was a nice historical romance. It was a quick, sweet read and I enjoyed reading it.Isabella was a good heroine. She was loyal to her loved ones and, despite a few outlying circumstances, did her best not to judge anyone until she got the full story. My only issue with her was that I wish she would have lightened up on the whole 'poor me' attitude. After so many pity parties, it got old and somewhat annoying. But, overall, I was fine with her.James was great. He was sweet and the first to admit when he had made a mistake. He wasn't the most memorable character, but I liked him just fine.The romance was a little iffy for me. On one had, I thought Isabella and James were very sweet together. They didn't bother to deny their feelings for each other and those feelings were never in doubt. However, I got little sense of an actual relationship between them.
