What was nice was everybody got a laugh from the book and the box and they probably woke up a couple of the older ladies who were probably napping a bit. As I said, the story in the book is really cute and normal, basically it was the title that keeps showing up, so you could use white out for the obvious word(s) or just tape a little piece of paper over the words and then they could get a good laugh from a older child. I may be older in age, but I still have the sense of humor of a young adult. These type of gifts add some entertainment to the Baby Shower.

First of all, I LOVE the Sistema brand of containers. I had the Noodle Bowl cup for the past year and used it all the time for soups and oatmeal,etc. I didn't realize that they also made juice containers, until I started a diet and had to drink more water. I like ice water when it is hot out or if I am very thirsty, but for the most part I don't really like water.I figured I could improve the taste of water by cutting up oranges, lemons and limes and let them "steep." This pitcher is made well and you have a knob on the top to open and close the pitcher, which with Rheumatoid Arthritis in my wrists, is very important. I was always been a kind of a klutz, but now it is ridiculous. All of the Sistema Klip Its are very help for freezing, cold drinks, reheats and especially with soup. The pitcher washes up easily and even after leaving the oranges, lemons and limes in the pitcher for some time there does not seem to have any odors, which is important when having a variety of other cold drinks in there.If anything occurs that require a change in my review, I will come back and update this review.''''''''''

I don't know how to put this....After my knee replacement, I guess that my replacement malfunctioned a few days after surgery while , luckily I was still in inpatient physical therapy and my entire right leg blew open from the top of my knee down almost to my ankle. It looked like there had been a bomb in it. I was medivaced to my Morristown Medical Center, where the very competent doctors not only saved my life but also saved my leg. The apparatus that malfunctioned sliced my nerves in the lower part of my right leg and I was not able to pull up my toes to point upward and had no feeling. I was told if I was very lucky the nerves would begin to repair themselves but it would only be about 1 millimeter per month (an extremely small measurement). I have gotten some of the feeling back but not enough to be able to drive a car. Since I live about 30 miles outside NEW York City, the traffic is horrendous at any time of day so driving is pretty much out of the question for a while, so I needed to have my daughter and friends get my groceries (oh yes believe it or not, my husband of 43 years died unexpectedly three days after my knee incident). I found that these HUGE and they are HUGE rolls of Bounty are great, especially the select a size so when I only need a sheet for a small job, I can just take a small sheet and there is much less waste. Some people are right, that the rolls might be a tight on some of their paper towel rack and I had that too. When I had to downsize after I was finally released from inpatient therapy after 4 months, I moved to a new place where the kitchen had just been renovated beautifully, but the top cabinets where the paper towel rack extends from, must have been put up by 7 foot men, because the cabinets are so high that it is difficult reaching the stuff in the top cabinets unless it get on a step stool which I am not about to do. I purchased a paper towel holder that sticks up under the cabinet and I did place it on the underside of the top cabinet and it is pretty easy to replace the roll and to dispense the amount of paper towels I need for the job. And the rack is plenty big enough to hold the huge rolls with absolutely no problem. The towels themselves are great and stronger than those other brands so they are great for cleanup. And I am kind of glad that they are not printed since I sometimes wrap a burger on a bun in the paper towel to reheat or to quickly cover the dish, although I now have the silicone covers that work great for that. These rolls last me a long time and I get the free shipping courtesy of my Prime Membership. I must be using the average amount because as soon as I get low the box appears at my door with a whole new supply and that is even that I give my daughter and her fiancé a pack of two rolls when the delivery arrives! I plan to keep using this method of receiving my paper towels because these rolls are larger than the ones I have seen in my local store, the quality and these ease of shipment!

When I moved into my new place the kitchen had been renovated very nicely, but the paper towel rack was difficult for me to reach to change the roll. I know it seems like a stupid thing to have to fix, but I also have rheumatoid and Osteoarthritis, a torn Rotator Cuff that was left I repaired by a surgeon I later found to be lacking, and fibromyalgia and a severe back injury, that all together make it very difficult to reach higher than normal. The person who did the renovation must have been very tall because most of the work (like cabinets...etc) is installed higher than usual.This towel holder was super easy for me to install myself. It was simple peel and stick. It is VERY strong adhesive hold and is easy to change the paper roll. I recommend this as a quick and versatile answer so that you can easily replace the towel hold where YOU want it located, without using nails and screws. I recommend this easy install paper towel holder. If there is any change in my evaluation of this item with normal use, I will update this review

I decided to try the new wave in adult relaxation.....adult coloring books. I figured I have done a few paint by numbers or painting where you pick the colors so why not give it a try. I tried pens and markers but read that you could blend colors by using pencils.i ordered them but forgot the most important thing, unlike markers and pens, pencils need a pencil sharpener! I looked through a bunch of boring black ones, but since it is for home I wanted something fun that wasn't really expensive. I found this one with different colors to choose from and chose the green color. I received it quickly and tried it today. It worked very well. I sharpened to a nice point without taking half the pencil like many pencil sharpeners I used have done and the price was good. If you have Prime you can get it in two days. I would recommend this pencil sharpener.

I downsized and moved last year  after my husband passed away suddenly. We had a knife block that came with the knives he liked and over the years some were lost. I purchased a few Cutco knives including a set of steak knives. The old block we had for about thirty years and it really needed to be replaced, but I could not believe how expensive a knife block with no knives was about the same amount as one with knives. I searched last year through several places and found nothing. I also only needed about ten slots because I really only used those Cutco knives and one or two of his occasionally, but there wasn't much difference, the block was still expensive. I had kind of stopped searching because there didn't seem to be anything in my price point. A lot of time passed and all of a sudden this appeared on one of the pages and decided to get it because the price was definitely in my range. But for the price I really wasn't expecting much, but if it held my knives and stood up on four bottom pads (our old one had finally reach the tipping stage because two of the pad were lost.I was pleasantly surprised when it arrived. It is nice looking and it has weight to it. It seemed to be wood throughout because of the weight but I am not positive. I really like that it is all black and looks nice on the counter. It hold the two knives my husband loved because my daughter liked them too so if she comes over to cook, she can use them. The was room for the big thick knife from Cutco and a couple more of the cooking knives and it also holds my six, wait scratch that five Cutco steak knives, with no problem. I did not notice a spot for scissors, so I just put them in the drawer with the rest of the things that aren't worth displaying as sit in the drawer waiting to be used. I wish I knew who accidently threw away my Cutco steak knife, because they are quite costly to replace, but in the event I order another one there is a slot for that too.I was pleased with this purchase and very pleased with the price!

I have been using a hand mixer for many years in spite of my husband wanting to buy me the very expensive stand mixers. I feel that $350 -$700 for a stand mixer is ridiculous. My husband passed away almost two years ago and I downsized. In my new kitchen I decided to make the theme color orange because I really hate to cook for the most part and figured a happy color might raise my mood when I have to go in there to cook or bake. I have Rheumatoid Arthritis and Fibromyalgia and discovered that I really needed a stand mixer, but wanted to get a good mixer without paying a ridiculously high price. I compared different brands and prices and when I found this one, nostalgia set in. My mother had a Sunbeam Stand Mixer, that looked very much like this one. When I compare items I also check out the customer reviews (a lot of reviews) and the reviews were very positive. A few reviewers even metioned that they had conditions similar to mine and had good results using this mixer. The mixer arrived quickly and arrived last Thursday, and I wanted to bake a cake. First of all I was impressed with the quality feel of this mixer. I liked how the beaters can be raised horizontally to take the bowl out. I positioned the bowl correctly and the bowl turned throughout the mixing  cycle. I stopped mid cycle and checked the bottom of the bowl and there was no dried part of the flour that had not been mixed in.  When I finished and was going place the batter into the pan, I noticed that the batter was smoother, with a more fluffy consistancy. There seemed to be more batter when put in the pan. The cake itself was tasty and had a nice texture. It was easy to clean up and the beaters and dough hooks can be stored right in the bowl for easy access. The several colors that this mixer comes in can match your kitchen. I picked the orange color that matched my kitchen colors beautifully. They also have this mixer in Sapphire Blue, Red, Pastel Pink, a pastel sage green and a few other colors.  the beaters and the. Dough hooks are especially well made. Especially the dough hooks, which are very large and sturdy. I'm sure I will be getting good use from this mixer and I would recommend this stand mixer to the average everyday cook. The only negative comment and it really doesn't apply to the Sunbeam Heritage Stand Mixer.....I wish they had included a smaller bowl along with it because since I live alone I need to make smaller size recipes and could use the smaller bowl much more.  But that said I realize thatIncluding the smaller bowl would drive up the cost and I have found a bowl that is supposed to be for this mixer at a reasonable price.

When I downsized and moved to a smaller place last year I purchased a Lysol Dish Soap Automatic Dispenser, which was not at all expensive when I originally bought the dispenser which came with 2 eight oz specially designed dispenser bottles. The sticker shock came when I went in to buy more bottles of soap for the dispenser, thinking that it was Lysol so how expensive could it be. Sellers were selling two  eight oz refills for $29.99, which is beyond ridiculous. My sister bought me a four pack from BJ's for $9.99, but I found out that those refills that looked exactly like the ones that came with the dispenser were actually for the bathroom dispenser and we're just a very slight difference that made it not work on the kitchen dispenser. We didn't see the refills in any local stores so that avenue was out. They were still selling the kitchen dispenser with the two refills for $9.99, so I bought a couple of sets which lasted me through the winter. I found refills for the kitchen dispenser for eight dollars for the 8 oz refill, so I bought two. When they were done I realized that I was paying a ridiculous amount of money just to put soap in the dispenser. I purchased an automatic dispenser and bought these to fill it with. There are two 36 oz bags for around $9.99 here on Amazon so I am now getting 72 oz of dish soap for almost the same as buying one Lysol eight oz refill. I have dumped the Lysol Dispenser. I just couldn't afford it!The soap has a nice citrus orange scent and seems to work well with the new dispenser. All I have to do is refill the well. I recommend spending a bit more for a dispenser but you will save a lot in the long run. If there is any change in my opinion of this product, I will return and put an update on here.

I have several disability problems that keep me from standing in the shower for any length of time. I have a bath stool with a rotating seat that makes it easy for me to get in and out of the shower. For years I have had a shower head with a long hose that enables me to rinse off and wash my hair easily. The shower head would just hang down because I could not reach the bracket that the shower head is supposed to sit in for regular use. My husband who used to position it for me passed away a year and a half ago and I have downsized to a smaller place so I was just leaving the shower head down until........I maintain what I can do by just keeping things neat and have cleaners come it to clean the house for me, since I physically could not handle it. The cleaners have cleaned for months with no problem until a few weeks ago. I went in to take a shower and realized that one of the cleaning people had placed the shower head up in the top bracket that I cannot reach and I have a grabber, but I couldn't get the shower head unsnapped from the bracket. It was almost funny because all the previous cleaning days no one had done that. Luckily my daughter lives down the street and was able to stop over the next day to bring it down. I ordered this after seeing it on Amazon. I serves its purpose well and so far the suction has stayed firm. Now I place the shower head in the clamp and it should send a message to whoever is cleaning the bathroom, that is where the shower head should be.I recommend this for anyone who uses the long hose shower head if for any other reason , then to hold the shower head while soaping up or shampooing. Also bath seats are becoming more common and it is better to have the shower head at a proper height. If there is any change with this review I will come in and put an update on it.

I purchased this mat for more secure footing because the mat I had was long enough, but constantly wrinkled up in the bottom of the tub  and was a bit slippery. The grassy texture I figured would not be as slick. It was listed as a bathtub mat, so I figured the length would be ok. I removed it from the package and realized that it was not long at all for even a normal size bathtub that had been installed about a year ago. I have several problems including two knee replacements and two hip replacements and a permanent severe back injury that prevents me from standing for any length of time, so I have a shower stool. I can put the bath mat from right before the drain and it goes up about one half of the tub in length. It seems to cover the area my feet are for standing up and when I move the stool back further to swivel the seat and get out. The grassy texture feels good on the feet and didn't seem to be too slippery. There are several suction cups underneath, but the mat still moves around. I am going to wet down the surface of the tub floor and try to get the suction cups to adhere. It is difficult because I can't get down on my hands and knees to push on every suction cup. Plus I have cleaning people who take the mat out for the regular cleaning.Right now I am giving it three stars because calling it a bathtub mat is stretching it because of the length and I have had bath mats in the past that just by putting it in the bottom of the tub, the suction cups would quickly adhere. I should have measured the length of the tub before ordering and would suggest anyone planning to order should do. The color is a nice green and adds a pop of color to a boring white bathtub.If there is any change in my evaluation of this mat I will do an update here in the future.

I really enjoyed reading this series. Actually I didn't know it was a series when I started reading "Going Home." It begins with a man trying to get home after an unspecified event spun the country back to a time without electricity, refridgeration, and rendered more modern cars useless. It does allude to this man being somewhat of a "Prepper" but not a crazy one. Just a guy who wanted to make sure his family would be OK in the event something happens. Going Home chronicals him trying to get home with not only the trouble you would imagine with no food, electric, access to doctors etc....but a more lawless world like we sometimes see today when people see or create an opportunity to take anything they want and to hell with anyone else. A world where you trust no one even children and never turn your back on anyone. He will see some really bad people, but will also meet others, who may be people that will be needed in the future. There are a total of five or six books but do not read this one first. Your enjoyment and understanding of relationships and occurances will mean so much more when read chronologically.  I was hoping there was going to be another, but nothing right now so I will keep checking. What happens in the books will show how far a man has to be pushed to save his friends and family and how important trusted friends and family are.  As I said there is quite a bit about the difference of being prepared in case of something happens with far reaching effects and not being prepared at all, but I did not feel that the author was beating me over the head with a one ton weight to get the point across. I recommend these stories that in order make up a very satisfying book.

I found this toaster here on Amazon and kept putting it into the save for later file. My kitchen major color is orange so I was thril'ed that an orange toaster was available. I was shopping on Walmart for other items and this came up at a price majorly lower than here. So I grabbed it. They said that the orange color was exclusive to Walmart so I don't know.......This toaster looks great on the counter with the sides an orange color and shiny chrome on top and front panel where the controls are. It is very lightweight. The orange color is more like pumpkin, not some crazy neon. I toasted a bagel this morning and it came out great. I would suggest setting the dial at a bit lower than the center for average toasting.it has a crumb tray that you can slide out and clean. The directions say that you can store the cord underneath when not in use. I use mine almost every day, so I just leave it plugged in. I also says that if you are toasting bagels or English muffins, you should put them in the toaster with the rougher inside toward the center. Depending on the amount of counter space you have, you could put it horizontally so the colored side is facing out. I have very little counter space, so I need to position it vertically, but the color still shows. This seems to be a good toaster, not only in appearance, but in operation and uses. There is a button for bagels and the direction booklet tells you how to toast frozen bread right from the freezer. I recommend this toaster, just shop around for price. This toaster also comes in several fun colors, maybe here on Amazon or where I got mine. Some of the colors I saw were red, pink, purple, teal, blue....

I like this brush, but I wish they made it in a large size too. This one is small, like a brush you would carry in your bag. I came in to Amazon looking for this brush, just larger and the only one I found had a wooden handle and seemed to be the same size as this one. I needed several surgeries on my knee and with the brutal winter we had with bitter cold weather and snow every few days, I didn't get out much and my thin, fine hair did what thin fine hair does best and tangled horribly. As luck would have it, the day this brush arrived, I had a doctor's appointment and since I can't drive two of my friends drove me and surprised me with a appointment at the hair salon, so by the time I used it, my hai was much shorter. But from what I can tell it works like a brush should work, nothing more, nothing less. I also have a problem with my rotator cuff so on the one side, I can brush the front and the side, but because the brush is small I can't get the back.I actually believe this brush is only perfectly sized for young children and like I said to throw in your bag when going out, but you would still need a full size brush in my opinion. It is for this reason it gave it three stars instead of four.

I bought these for my daughter and she loves them. They were one of these Seen On TV items and they seemed interesting, but my daughter tells me that I am a telemarketers dream......I didn't order them through the OSOTV order phone number because for some reason it takes them six to eight weeks to mail them out and by the time they arrive you forget you even ordered them. So I found them and ordered them here and got them right away under Prime. Anyway my daughter took them shopping and it seems that they do just what they are supposed to do and they do it well. My daughter told me that our local grocery store has a scanner on the cart so you scan the item and put it in the bag and when you are done you just take the scanner to the register and pay.  These bags are really good for that because the bags are already packed so you can just pay and go. They are very roomy, not like the reusable bags sold by most of our local stores. They are larger and they stay straight up in the car and they don't fall over like other bags. If you self scan or clerk scan, after groceries are on conveyer, just position the bags in the cart and either you or the clerk can just put the items in the bags after scanning at the register. If you have a larger family you probably need more than two. My daughter even said that she would like one of these bags in the insulated style for the upcoming summer, when it gets hot in the car and you can't leave groceries in the car very long. I have a problem with my knee right now so I can't drive, but when I can I am going to pick up a couple for myself.I or rather my daughter, recommend these bags. Make sure you get the Grab Bags brand since there seem to be bags that look like these also sold, but these are the bags that I bought.

I collect watches. What I have noticed that I miss is the day/date feature that isn't on most watches. Some have the small date number at the three o'clock position but since I only need glasses for reading, I can't just glance down, but I have to put on glasses. Just to see the date. This watch has all the information and I actually don't need glasses to see the info I am looking for. It is exactly the color in the picture. It has an indiglo feature and it lights up bright enough to see everything on the face of the watch. It also has timers and stop watch settings that I don't use and it can be set to chime on the hour which I do have set. It is not so loud as to be annoying or probably even noticed by anyone else. You can leave it on in the shower and use it for swimming but not diving. I have only had a couple of weeks, but it is keeping time very well. It also has 24 hour (military) time, but I use the 12 hour AM/PM time.I recommend this watch if it has the options you are looking for in a watch. If there is any change I will update this review here.

I purchased this after I moved and one day I realized that I didn't have a plunger. Good thing I hadn't needed a plunger💩!This set fits perfectly. One reviewer said it was too big for and apartment bathroom. Well I have lived in several apartments in my lifetime and none was as small as I have now which is a one person occupancy only!🚹 Anyway I put it alongside the back side of the vanity between the vanity and the back of the toilet and it fits fine. I have had it since October and it looks great, but of course I haven't had to use either piece. The cleaning ladies come every other week and in between the continuous cleaners work well.I am pleased with the purchase as one can be with an item such as this....I mean I don't conduct tours to show it to visitors or anything, but it certainly looks a lot better than those ugly brown plungers and the equally ugly brushes that usually were on the floor of the linen closet. My linen closet is in the hall now and is carpeted so I wouldn't want the brush in there. People have complained about how it looks after it is used....Wouldn't you clean it anyway  UGH!

My husband purchased this brush for me because I have a problem with rotation of my shoulder. At first it seemed to work, but this past several month I couldn't get out much and didn't get my hair cut and with longer hair it would not get down to the scalp, especially in the back where I really needed it. It kind of glides over the top layer. Also it is not good at all on hair that tangles after washing. It does not brush without painful pulling. The nubs at the end each plastic bristle fall off and make it very difficult to clean the hair out.I came in to shop here to get another long handled brush, only to find out that it appears THIS brush under different names is the only one made. That is terrible but not surprising. I seems many aids for people with ability problems, are made by one company with no competition which translates to terrible products because they don't care to improved parts, like the horrible bristles on this brushI guess I will look around, but for now it seems this brush, the same brush under different names is the only games in town and don't think these companies don't know it!UPDATE.....5/19/15 I again checked out all the brushes and purchased one by Drive Medical. The bristles are firm and when I comb the back the brush goes down to my scalp. I also just got my hair cut. I am hoping that the bristles stay in an upright position. The old brush had many bristles that were more horizontal than vertical.  I plan to review the new brush on the Amazon page for it and I am hoping this brush lasts longer and serves me better. As I said above, it seems that aids for disabled people are priced very high with little selection. The people are so happy to have anything that they give it five stars no matter what. That is why these companies do not see the need to re evaluate items that  have received reviews outlining real world problems.

Last summer I adopted a new cat that I named Toby. He is a Lynx Point Siamese with beautiful coloring. He is also smart and crafty. When I first got him, I used to joke that I didn't ever have to wash his dish because he cleaned off every little morsel. I still can't believe that he was almost euthanized in a southern state, but was saved by one of our local shelters. I figured that the volunteers at the shelter taught him well. After a few weeks, I realized that if a cat could be a vegetarian, Toby was it. He eats his kibble well, but he has a strange affinity for stuff on the meat or fish, but not the actual meat or fish. I tried a lot of different foods and he loves the Gravy Lovers cat food....he eats all the gravy and leaves the meat or fish. I get it for him because he drives me crazy every night for his YumYums! He also loves the cat food called Broths.So. every time he eats his gravy or broths and cleans off all the meat/fish, he does what a call the Poopie Scoopingg maneuver, where he moved as in covering the food . Sometimes if  he hasn't quite finished all his gravy/broth I don't want to take it away. He also loves to scoop out pieces of kibble and chase them around the kitchen floor, sometimes dumping over the bowl of kibble onto the floor. I have purchased several bowls for his food. Some were too small and even if the size was all right the bowl was too light and still too easy to flip over.These bowl are a nice size and have just enough weight to prevent tipping over by Toby. They are also attactive, well made and wide enough to clear his whiskers,, that I read about that if the eating area too small,  It can hurt his whiskers .  I must have put the dish in the cart twice, because when they arrived, it indicated that I ordered two. The inside is a pretty sky blue and the outer edge is like a black/dark brown with a raised sky blue mouse on the outer edge. Toby eats well out.of it with occasional Poopie Scoop.

My late husband was 100 percent Irish, so I would get a small gift each St Patrick's Day for him and my daughter. I purchased a mug made by the same company with the Claddaugh symbol. I chose this one for her fiancée. These mugs are well designed, well made, but most of all stunning. They come in a variety of Irish designs and the colors are rich and beautiful. Whether for everyday cups of coffee or tea, or a dinner party, they will add to the beauty of your table!

My late husband was 100 percent Irish, so I always got little gifts for them every St. Patrick's Day.This year I wasn't sure what to get my daughter. She and her boyfriend have a small place and with three cats, there isn't room for stuff. This mug is BEAUTIFUL. It is beautifully designed and painted. It looks delicate but is more substantial. My daughter loves it and she loves the Claddagh design. We all have Claddagh rings. I bought a mug for her boyfriend made by the same company and his is the Irish Harp. The shape is different, but  well made, well designed and colorful. I cannot stress enough that this mug to me is visually stunning. I definitely recommend it. If you are giving it for a gift, perhaps you should buy one for yourself because you will love it!

I love the colors in this valance. I moved a few months ago after my husband passed away. We were married 42 years and my husband, a policeman/detective loved his home and his family and we usually picked out items for our home together. So when I moved into my new place I realized that I would have to decide what colors etc...I wanted. Since cooking is not really a passion for me, I decided to make the kitchen nice and bright. I did an accent wall in a bright pumpkin (not neon) color. I bought a set of Rachael Ray cookware in orange and bought other items in orange. I bought a set of typical cafe curtains, but the top part was way too short and looked terrible. It was now November, so I found a  really cute valance with snowmen that looked good over the blinds and left the lower part of the window open for my cat Toby to take his naps. I spent hours looking a valances and nothing jumped out until I found these.First of all the valance, in my opinion is even nicer than the picture. The colors pop nicely without being tacky. It is not pleated like it appears in the picture. Also it first appeared to be, at least to me, to be made of a heavy lined material. It is NOT. The material is a bit thin, but not cheesy. I actually like that the valance is not pleated and heavy because those styles would be better in other rooms than the kitchen.Reading the reviews, I understood that the material was more or less breezy, but my problem was, how breezy. I also have blinds on the window, so I realized that the blinds would keep the light from giving the colors a washed out appearance. My window itself is 34 inches wide and I realized that if there was enough material, it could be arranged to appear more robust. I bought two valances, we put them up and they are perfect. One of the colors actually matches my accent wall. It is tightly bunched together, because it  is 144 inches of material and my actual window itself is 34 inches, but it looks fine and the colors do not get washed out by the light coming through the window, even when the blinds are all the way up or open. I imagine that if one valance is not enough, you could get the two and cut off a few inches from the second one and it would not be noticeable due to the way you can bunch it.Bottom line, I recommend this valance (s). It is colorful, bright and happy! I hope this review helps. I have tried touch on all the points that you might need to know in order to make a decision. As always, if anything changes my opinion from what I have shared here, I will update this review

i had a set of Corelle about 30 years ago and loved them, but my husband hated them, so after months of his whining😢, I gave in and we bought stoneware. My husband passed away a year and a half ago and I moved last summer. I bought new things for the new kitchen including the orange Rachael Ray cookware. I did bring the multi colored stoneware and bought the Fiesta silverware. I have RA, and the stoneware had become just too heavy, especially since for the first time in forty years I don't have a dishwasher🙀.  I was looking at the Corelle dish sets and came upon the "Happy Days" pattern and loved it. It came in the Amazon Prime two days and I was impressed with the way it was packed. It was in an Amazon shipping box with air pillows and the box with the dishes was well wrapped in bubble wrap taped securely so it stayed on. It took me quite a while to get the inner box open, but it was great because the set arrived perfectly with no chips, cracks or breaks. The pattern has the pop of color that the other Correlle patterns seem to lack. The dinner dishes are huge. The salad/dessert plates are more the size of my stoneware dinner plates, but they are all lightweight and easy to handle. As many other reviewers have stated, the dishes are all made from the well known Corelle materials, BUT the mugs are stoneware. I really don't know why, because the set we had all those years ago were made from the same material as the dishes. The mugs are a bit larger than my old stoneware mugs. I have an original one single serve Keurig Coffee Maker and the mug just fits. The dishes even match my kitchen curtains and accent walls.The only thing that is a bit strange, but I noticed seems to be the same with all patterns, is that the bowl is all white with a rim that matches the rust colored flower on the dishes. Even a flower at the bottom of the bowl would tie the bowl more in with the dishes. I don't find it a huge problem just an observation.Finally, I STRONGLY suggest you read the use and care instructions included with the dishes. There are some guidelines that you might not think about. The one that stuck out to me was not to use the dish in the microwave with food that includes a crisping sheath like Hot Pockets. Again, not a huge problem, but good to be aware of. Otherwise I recommend the Corelle dishes and especially the Happy Days pattern!

I purchased two kitchen dispensers last summer expecting to use one in the bathroom. My sister was in BJ's and picked up a 3 pack for$9.99 and it said Hand Soap but looked the same. I decided to try it and it didn't work because there was just a small fraction of difference between the Kitchen Refill and the Hand Soap Refill. I came back on Amazon and purchased a Hand Soap Dispenser. What really annoyed me was that greedy sellers were selling two refills for $29.99 which is ridiculous! So I got inventive and got out a small cake decorating set I bought on Amazon which included a syringe like apparatus (where you would put the icing) and a narrow round tip. I inserted it into the empty bottle and pulled out the air and filled the syringe thing with my regular liquid soap and stuck the tip and syringe fill with soap into the hole on the empty bottle. I pushed the plunger and filled the bottle with my own soap and it worked. That is what a seller gets when they charge too much! before I figured out the refill process I bought 2 more kits with the dispenser and 2 refills for $11.00.I was surprised when I came in looking at the hand soap and found six refills for $22.00' which is a good price, plus it was Prime with Two Day free shipping.My hand soap dispenser must have sensed that I bought a years supply of soap (the refill for me goes a long way), because every time I left the bathroom I would hear it dispense soap. So I came in a bought another Hand Soap Dispenser because they are very handy to have. It will be delivered tomorrow. Last night I took the badly behaving bathroom dispenser and inspected it. It looked clean except right by where the soap comes out. I cleaned it and while I was at it I washed the sensor and tried it again. It has been 24 hours and not one unneeded blob of soap. I still have the same batteries that I installed when I got it and they still seem ok, the clocks change tomorrow, so maybe I will put in new batteries so I won't have to worry.My kitchen has peach and orange colors so I bought two of these refills, which were still way cheaper @ $8.50 each than the $30.00 for two,

Love these Tunnels! Got 2 tunnels for less than the cost of one. At first my cat, Toby didn't know quite what to make of them, but now he loves them. He moves them around himself and he had a round scratch pad with a ball in a track around the outside. He hits the ball and runs into the tunnel which ends at the scratch circle and hits the ball again and hides from the ball in the tunnel. The tunnels are well made and keep their shape!10/16/15 UPDATE I have had these tunnels for almost a year and I really want to say that if you are on the fence about getting these tunnels, take the plunge. I bought these for my 2 year old cat named Toby. They were very well priced when I bought them and for the price, I didn't expect much. Well I am very impressed. They have retained their shape and they stand up to Toby running through them, back and forth. I have one of those circular scratch pads with a ball that spins around on the track on the outer edge. Toby goes to the end of the one tunnel and hits the ball so it goes fast around the track and he runs around and "hides" in the tunnel and then does the same thing over and over. With the smaller tunnel, I position it so the opening is in front of the track and he goes in the tunnel reaches out and smacks the ball so it rolls around the track and he backs up so that "wacky ball can't find him!

This is my second package of these Hershey Kisses. I am not a huge fan of white chocolate but these are really good. The white chocolate combined with the candy cane dust makes for a refreshing Kiss! They are very creamy and yummy. I recommend these heartily. Now if I can just stop eating them. I can't afford another bag at these prices. They should carry them all winter.

This is a BIG bowl. I like it better. After over 40 years caring for kitty family members, my new cat TOBY is a real trip.he is very interested when I roll the container with his cat food over by his dish and scoop new food to fill the dish. Shortly after I hear noise in the kitchen and he is dumping the bowl over. He also likes to take pieces of the kibble and plays what I call food hockey around the kitchen! I bought him a bowl a couple of weeks ago that was wider and flatter with rubber around the base. At first I thought that it would do the trick but even though it is supposed to hold two cups of food,it seems to empty too quickly and it is so light weight that TOBY pushes the bowl and the tray it sits on around the room and I almost killed myself falling over it where it wasn't supposed to be! I decided my quest for the perfect bowl was not over.When this bowl arrived today it almost looked too big, but once I washed it put it down and added food it seemed good. TOBY seemed to sense the bowl was for him as I worked to get it out of the bubble wrap and tape. (All the tape and bubble wrap is good because it does not come in a box and it arrived in good condition. So far bowl it upright and food is all still in it and it has been a whole four hours. It seems sturdy and well made and not too light. Right now I am pleased with this purchase. If there is any change in my review of this bowl I will update at that time.UPDATE: 5/25/2015Well, if I could give this bowl ten stars, I would. Even though he has tried, my cat Toby cannot dump this bowl over, no matter how hard he tries! It fits a nice 2 very full scoops of the dry cat food and I don't have to constantly refill it often. He also cannot seem to move the bowl and the plastic kitty tray it sits on more than a couple of inches. He still tries to dump the bowl right after I fill it and I don't have any idea why because he eats it all the time. As my daughter tells him...sometimes he is  a little weirdo! So with the way this bowl has worked so well for me for the past four months I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

My daughter introduced me to the Contigo brand a few months ago when she showed me a 16 oz travel cup and explained how they really don't leak. Until then even the ones that say leak proof always manage to leak. I bought that one in the store that day and loved it. I am very klutzy and am forever knocking over glasses, cups, you name it. I recently moved into a place with the scourge of my existence....beige carpeting!  The cup worked very well and even when I knocked it over, it didn't leak a drop. So I went on Amazon and bought the same type of travel cup in 20 oz for going to Dunkin Donuts, which had a great addition. There is an additional fail safe on this cup that locks the AutoSeal button so that it cannot get pushed by accident in your bag. All the Contigo Cups I bought have AutoSeal which is that when you want to take a sip you push the AutoSeal button and as soon as you take your finger off the button it automatically reseals. Then I found cold drink cups that have a lid that seals so you can shake up your drink like a smoothie or iced coffee after you add cream and sugar and then you push the straw through the straw opening.Finally I found these water bottles. They have a few different colors. I bought myself purple and bought my daughter the light green one. What I love about this water bottle is that you don't have to unscrew the lid Like so many water bottles have. The is no little cap to lose. This water bottle has AutoSeal technology too and like the travel cups you push the AutoSeal button, sip the water and let go of the button and it reseals. I use all the cups for different beverages almost every day and they have had no degradation in the AutoSeal and I have not spilled a drop, not one...which is big news for me.I wash all the cups and glasses by hand. I bought a package of acrylic replacement straws in case something happens to the straws that come with the Shake bottles (the water bottle and travel cups have no need for straws since they have the complete AutoSeal and the Shake bottles also reseal when the straw is not in place and I haven't had a spill even when the straw was in place). In with the replacement straws was a brush to clean the straws and I bought a bottle cleaner to get the bottles and cups clean. Some people use a dishwasher, but I think the parts will last longer with hand washing. When hand washing I depress the AutoSeal button and run hot water through the opening. Some of the cups have an inside lever that you pull up while washing.I highly recommend these cups. They are the BEST I have ever used. And I purchased every one of my cups. I did not receive any free for a good review.

My cat TOBY just loves to tip over his dry food bowl right after I fill it. We can't figure out why he does that because he likes the food and eats it up. I looked at all these different bowls and it can drive you crazy because some reviewers say that their cat knocked over the bowl and others say that it is great and the cat can't flip it over or send it flying over the tile Kitchen floor. The one thing that I did notice was that mostly all of the qcat food bowls seemed to come in one cup capacity. It is hard to picture how big the one cup bowl really is, so for the dry food, I went with the one bowl I found that had two cup capacity for the dry food.At night I give TOBY either the Broths or a three oz can of Gravy Lovers Dinner. I add a little water to especially the Gravy Lovers, and I guesstimated that the one cup capacity bowl would be fine. When the two bowls arrived on Thursday, I was a bit surprised by how small this one was and I was glad that I went for the two cup capacity bowl for his dry food.With this bowl I put the three ounce can of gravy lovers into the bowl and I add the water an stir. When take it to where he eats it is pretty full and now I am thinking that I should have just gotten two of the two cup dishes. Well time will tell if there is a major problem with this smaller size bowl. The bowl itself is nice the color is very close to the picture and with the wider base there would be less chance of it being flipped over.  It really depends how much you plan to feed your pet as to which size is the right size.As always if I need to I will update this review.UPDATE: July 21, 2015I used this bowl for a little while but Toby was constantly trying to tip it over and sometimes he almost did. I finally found a stoneware bowl that had substantial weight, and he definately has not even come close to tipping it over. Problem solved and some little kitty waiting for their furever home will have a nice little dish to eat from at our local no kill pet shelter where I donated the bowl to.

I recently moved and needed to replace the under the bed Rubbermaid Clear.Storage Container which was shaped like thi but it had wheels.I figured I would buy this because I read something about inserts and I thought the inserts were portioning off spaces in this container. Well I was wrong. The inserts were wooden pieces slid into the outer was of the container because unlike the clear plastic one if you don't put the inserts around the perimeter, the whole top will cave in. Even with the inserts in place,  it bends and wobbles because the inserts are not like four pieces one for each side. Instead there are several and in between the pockets you put the inserts in there is nothing to stabilize the rectangular shape and it goes into all kinds of configurations which makes it difficult to place under the bed. I did finally find one of the plastic ones and I gave this to my daughter so she can put her winter clothes in it and take it to the storage unit.I would not recommend this especially if you plan to use it like it do for shoes nesessitating pulling it out from under the bed when you want to get out different shoes.

My cat TOBY, has a plastic base on his food dish 👩😴with 2 indentations to place metal food dishes.  For some reason right after I  fill the bowl with the dry cat food, he flips it over. He eats the food completely and seems to like it so I just figure he thinks that it is funny when I end up having to sweep the food up. I bought this bowl in blue even though the picture is pink. It does hold about 2 cups of the Friskies Grillers and it looks like the picture but it is not heavy or weighted at all. It is very light. I only took one star off for that. The reason I am giving it four stars is because it looks like it does on line, it holds quite a bit of food AND I put it down Thursday night and filled it with food and he hasn't flipped it over........YET!!! If he does I will come back to update this review.I would recommend this bowl and especially this size because a large amount of cat feeding dishes are half this size at one cup. Toby is a 10 lb cat and I really can't see using any of the one cup bowls for him.I give him one of the 3 oz cans of  Gravy Lovers Cat Food and I add a little water to the food in the one cup bowl I bought him for that purpose and it fills the bowl right up.UPDATE: I finally purchased a stonewere bowl with some weight to it and have had no problems since. I did not take away any stars, because technically my cat never tipped the bowl over, which is why I bought the bowl in the first place. It IS a very light bowl for it's capacity and I am sure that a larger cat would find a way to dump it over. I finally donated this bowl to our local pet shelter so some other cat can get a really nice looking bowl to take home or a kitty ,who is waiting for their furever home will have a nice bowl to eat from!☺️💜

I have a Living Room/Dining Area. The Living Room Area has 2 accent walls in blue and in the Dining Area I have an accent wall behind the table in green. I fell in love with this pattern immediately when I saw it but just to make sure I scouted thru Amazon for a couple of hours. I still liked these the best followed by another set named Little Italy. When these arrived they were even better than on line. The colors are vibrant and the pattern is beautiful. They do tend to move when my cat, TOBY jumps up but other than that they are more stable than the cloth ones and definitely better than the Bamboo Slat set I got before this one. The Bamboo ones had green colors and not only did they slide around but the collapsed inward because there is thin bamboo slats woven together so if you were to hold them on your hands, whatever was not actually sitting on your hands, will just flop down.These are made of vinyl, nothing fancy but as I said beautiful. They wash off very easily and if they slide perhaps check on line or a crafts store for some kind of silicone pads that you could put in each corner so that they grip the table. I am going to see how much they actually slide and then make adjustments.  These will be great right through the spring/summer. I definately recommend them because they are BEAUTIFUL and I usually get excited about placemats!!!

I have seen all different types of chalk boards on my shopping trips through Amazon, but really didn't think I needed one. I just moved and downsized following the unexpected death of my husband, and somehow my canisters ( Flour, Sugar, Rice, etc...) somehow didn't make the journey😧. I bought OGGI clear acrylic canisters and decided to put chalkboard labels on them for something different and while I was at it I have a big wall in the kitchen that I hadn't figured out what to do with. In addition to the labels, I decided while I was at it to do a chalk board on the wall.This is a really good buy compared to others I saw. I didn't realize how much product there was. I read up on some of the other larger sized chalk board paper and the biggest complaint was that they were folded before packaging and when buyers open them the seams were difficult to get out when trying to apply them. Since I can't hang a picture straight, my daughter came over to help. It was great that the contact paper was on a roll so there were no creases to make application more difficult to apply. We cut two good size pieces one I plan to put notes on and the other would hold my shopping list. They applied easily and look good. There was even enough for my daughter to have a good size chalkboard for her place, all from this one roll. Really worth the price.I am glad that I picked this and recommend it

I just received the salt and pepper shakers and grinder (the set). Out of the box they look fine for a bit over $10.00. But when I held the salt shaker it seems awful light to have salt pre filled as it states in the product page description AND on the box. That is why I bought this particular set. It says on the product page "Comes prefilled and ready to use" and on the box it says "Proudly Filled in the USA. Since it is indicated in two different places I am not wrongly expecting a filled set, because that is what "ready to use" means to me! I am planning to contact seller to advise them to change what the product page says so that this won't happen to someone else. I am glad that these were for my own kitchen and not a gift, as that could have been embarrassing. I have seen lots of prefilled Salt and Pepper sets in stores and BOTH are filled.As to the buyer who had so much trouble filling the salt. I simply put a piece of tape outside of the salt shaker, covering all the holes, turned the shaker upside down and filled it. Put the cap on and turn it up right and remove the tape! I didn't lose any salt doing that. In reply to the reviewer who couldn't get the cap open on the salt, I thought mine was hard to unscrew, but then I remembered the old saying "Lefty Loosy and Tighty Righty." I attempted to turn to the left and it worked.As I stated, it only cost $10.98, and it does have at least the pepper filled, so other than the omission of the salt, they don't seem bad at all. I didn't expect stainless steel or any other metal for the price. On a more positive note, the are a good size, which is great for me because I hate filling the S&P! If there is any change in my opinion regarding this product, I will come back here for an update.c

I wanted to label my canisters, so I decided to try something I had never used before and get chalkboard labels and chalk markers. I also bought a large chalkboard sheet for the wall to decorate and write notes and shopping lists. I also went crazy trying to figure out which markers to buy and I decided to go with a very inexpensive set of bright dry erase markers that some other posters had recommended. For what I wanted that was a mistake, so I went back into Amazon and found this set of liquid chalk markers and the difference was like night and day.These markers are large and when you shake them you can feel the fluid in the barrel. The colors are nice and bright and they write smooth clean lines that are more like a marker. They are versatile with a tip that can go from chisel tip to bullet tip by just turning the tip around. I noticed that you can erase your work completely by using a damp cloth, because some remnants remained when I used just a dry paper towel. It does completely erase though. I recommend these markers, rather than less expensive choices (these are NOT the most expensive at $18.99, with many sets well over $20.00). Your final product will look really nice!IN REGARD TO COMMENTS MADE BY A REVIEWER NAMED "CRAZYHAPPYMOMMY" who has NOT PURCHASED THESE MARKERS yet GAVE THEM A 3 STAR RATING.....I did NOT receive these markers for free or at a reduced price. I paid $18.99 for them after studying reviews for hours before settling on PURCHASING these. I have NEVER written a positive review for anything that I didn't feel earned it!  Perhaps you should actually PURCHASE an item before issuing star ratings which UNFAIRLY reduce the average and dilute the ratings that those of us who actually purchased the item.

I bought these straws to use will my reusable iced coffee and iced drink cups. They last quite a while, especially with the straw cleaning sets they sell here on Amazon. And this set already has the brush to clean them with!

I purchased these placemats to place n my table that has oak edges with terra cotta tiles in the main part. I was surprised when they arrived and they were not stiff and firm like most placemats are. If you were to place the mat in the palm of your hand, the only part that will stay straight is what is on your palm. The rest will flop down. Also there is no backing, so they slide all over the tiles on the table ANF will not stay in place. May I should have considered the possibility of these problems, but I don't think that most people would foresee these problems. It would cost me more to return them so I will probably give them to someone who can actually use them!UPDATE 5/25/15. I tried to use these again and still found them to be very annoying. A breeze could make them move around the table and it makes the table look messy add that to having a cat and the fact that my table is near the front door because I have a Living room/Dining area, they just are not of any use to me. I can't even give them away because my friends and relatives can see that they would have the same problems as I have been having. It is a shame that there is no stiff backing that has a non slip surface. A positive note is that they are separate bamboo sticks woven together so you can just roll the placemat up to store it and when you use it, it lies flat right away. I am sure the problems I have had with these placemats might not be a problem for someone else, because they do look nice, so it is up to each individual what works best for them. That is why I gave them three stars instead of two.

I don't like to use scratchy fine point pens to write with. I saw these advertised on TV and decided to try them. They seem to write smoothly and I didn't get that scratchy feeling. I haven't had the opportunity to write much but if there is any change in my evaluation I will update this review.

A few months ago I purchased a single one of these Oggi canisters for my flour. I had just downsized and moved to a place with less storage, and my canister set had seen better days so they didn't make the move. I realized when I needed flour that I would have to get something to put flour in so I found the single Oggi and decided to try it. It worked so well that I decided that I needed one for sugar and after I received a rice cooker I wanted for Christmas, I would need a canister for the rice. I priced the single canisters and saw a three or four canister set that was about thirty dollars when I came across this set with FIVE canisters for twenty one dollars and it was on Prime.  The largest one used about three and a half pounds of sugar and the second largest held I believe four pounds of the five pound bag of rice. I also bought chalkboard labels to label each canister. I recommend these canisters, not only for flour and sugar, but for cookies, candy or nuts and other snack.

After my husband passed away suddenly last year I decided to downsize and I moved last summer. A lot of things from our forty two years of marriage ended up in storage and my daughter is doing a phenominal job on doing our family tree, so we are going through pictures. She wanted to scan pictures and save them onto an external hard drive so they all could be together, so she used some of the Amazon Gift Card I got her for Christmas to buy the hard drive. I realized what a great idea that was, so I spent some time on Amazon checking out all the different models and the pros and cons of each. I knew that I wanted 1TB so that narrowed it a bit, and I read tons of reviews on each. What I liked about this one was that it was shock proof, scratch proof etc...I am very careful with my electronics, but everyone drops things occasionally, so I was really interested in what this one had to offer. I liked the way the USB cord wrapped and attached to the Hard Drive Itself. I figured there would be less chance of it getting lost. My daughter put all the pictures we have scanned already on to mine. She said it was fast and worked well.The only negative thing about it and it was not enough to take away a star was that the cord attaches to two clips, one on each side. However the small black clips are not permanently attached to either the hard drive or the USB cord and they fall off quite easily. They fell off the first time a couple of minutes after I took the hard drive out of the box and again when my daughter gave it back to me after adding the pictures. I originally planned not to buy a case, like I usually do for all my electronics, because of the shock proof and scratch proof properties. I decided to get one so that I could be sure that I didn't lose the cord or one of the clips. All the cases come in as different sizes as there are portable hard drives. I took the dimensions of the hard drive from the product page and then compared them with the dimensions of available cases in the price point I wanted to pay and I found an Orico case on Amazon which was reasonably priced. I chose the green color and was surprised when it arrived that it fit the hard drive like a glove and the green almost matched the green edging on the hard drive.I would recommend this portable hard drive because it works very well and has plenty of space for a lot of storage. As I stated, the loose clips to fasten the cord onto the unit does not effect the way the hard drive works, so unless that would be a deal breaker, you could pick up a case and be assured you won't lose the cord.

I had purchased the set of five Oggi Clear Acrylic Canisters and wanted to label them for Flour, Sugar, Brown Rice and White Rice. I also got Decorative Chalkboard Labels. I noticed that one reviewer suggested these to write on the labels. She said they worked well and were much cheaper than getting the chalk pens. She was right these did work well and they wiped off cleanly from the label when I wanted to do a couple over. The price is only a fraction of the cost of the chalk pens, so you might want to try these out.UPDATE: I dropped stars from 5 down to 3I purchased a large chalkboard wall sheet for notes and shopping lists that I wanted to decorate and wanted more vibrant colors ( as I looked at the canisters I realized that the colors were really muted and not as bright as pictured. I looked on Amazon and found a set of eight bright markers with more of a selection of colors (red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, pink and white by the name Vegas Wand). Of course, they were more expensive at $18.99, BUT they are larger and when you shake them you can feel the liquid in them. The reason, however I dropped the stars from 5 down to 3 was when I wrote with them the difference was VERY noticeable! The colors are very vibrant and they write less like chalk and more like a marker with clear smooth lines. I really felt that I should at least put this information out there for your own evaluation. If you don't really want to do anything artistic and you are just going to make notes that are going to be erased shortly anyway, the Expo Dry Erase Markers should be all you need. However, if you want to decorate and want your project to look more polished, I would definately go with these. The only other info you would need is that you might need a damp cloth to wipe off the chalkboard when you want to erase anything and it will come up clean. With a dry paper towel, it appears like when you were in school and the teacher used the eraser to wipe the chalkboard. I hope this additional information will be helpful in making your decision as to which type of chalk markers to purchase.

I purchased a set of clear acrylic OGGI canisters and got these to label them for my flour, sugar, brown rice and regular rice. These look really nice on them. They are easy to write on, they peel off easily and go on to the canister smoothly. They are a perfect size to look nice. I made a mistake on a couple and they wiped off clean and very easy.I recommend them for any labeling needs. Just don't forget the chalk or chalk pens (I used neon dry erase markers that were much cheaper and did the job well).

I really like the way this looks and I  don't think it is for everyday use though. I had it on for about a week when I noticed a chip on the outer petal of the large purple rose. I hadn't dropped or banged it on anything, so I don't know how it could have cracked like that. I still like it but I think I will reserve it for special occasions. It is very pretty though and it looks just like the picture. Everything is three dimensional. There are no decals and they give you a couple of extra gems, I guess in case you lose one. Too bad there wasn't an extra rose😢

I would think that a company like Bissell whose name is synonymous with floor care would not put out poor quality products.I have a Rocket  vacuum and since I have people come in to clean well every couple of weeks, I wanted for everyday pickups on the kitchen floor and in the carpeted living areas, something light and easy. I started with a Bissell Cordless Stick Vac which proved to have to dismantle at least 3 pieces in order to empty the dust cup and poor suction in general, even with all my troubleshooting. I had a Shark for a few years, but the price and write up was pretty good on this so I figured I would get this one. There were a few reviews that stated that after a month or so it would be dead, but as one reviewer on something else stated, with thousands made you are probably going to have a few duds.Out of the box it was very simple to assemble. I followed all instructions and charged it before using it for about 24 hours. I worked, it was quiet and it seemed to pick up okay. Then after about a week and a half I went to use it and it would not turn on. I had charged it and I know the electric going in was fine because the light was lit. I tried everything and could not get it to start again. Very disappointing. I will be calling Amazon today and I do not want another one because I am done purchasing Bissell products. I do remember there being some comments in the reviews that people had been told by Bissell to ignore the light, that it doesn't mean anything. My question is, if it doesn't mean anything, why is it there. Obviously it is a problem so why didn't Bissell fix whatever the problem is. This model is the newer model of this particular sweeper, so you would think that Bissell would have addressed all the problems people have been contacting them about. Me, I am contacting Amazon today to return it and I plan to buy a different brand.

I've only had it for two weeks but I'm impressed. The first 2-3 shaves were disappointing and I almost sent it right back. I know they say it takes weeks or a month for your face to adapt but I wasn't hopeful about this working out the first few tries. But, then something changed - maybe I got better at using it - maybe my face adapted. I'm not sure but I like this thing and it really is about as close to a blade shave as I can imagine. So, I'm a convert.It was probably just technique and I needed more practice time. Anyway, this is the first electric I've used in 20 years and I'm impressed. I wanted to try an electric out for travel. It's a winner and I recommend.

Broken in right out of the box? That is a new one for me. I've only had that experience with Ecco shoes. These were a little pricey but they're also much much better than all the others I tried so it's worth it.- Light- Nice 'roll' to them - toe to heel - while walking- The soft walking on clouds feel (likely the gel) allows me to go further than usual- Great tread- Much better padding around ankle than usual. This likely aids in the ' no break in'- Sizing was right onI always have issues with new shoes, sneakers or sandals - a little break in period, a couple of blisters etc. I experienced none of that with these.If they hold up, this could be my new 'go to' sneaker. These are my first Kayanos and I'm impressed.

Seamless wools socks rock. I've been adding more to my collection and tossing the older cotton ones. I think I've found a winner with this brand. I wear size 11 and the large is perfection. Be aware these are a little stretchier than expected. For that reason I started with an extra large but found them to be a little too stretchy - they get bunched up at the ankle. But the large is perfection for size 11.What I Like:- Seamless- Great price- Like me, made in Vermont- Sizing was right on- Quality is obvious- Lifetime guarantee? I'll take it.- The 'cushion' thickness is right on - just what I like - mediumDislikes:- I wish there was a higher percentage of wool in this model. But, I'm going to try some of the others they sell too - their other styles go up to about 70% wool- Partly due to the comment above, they're very 'stretchy' - more than I expected.These are a winner - I recommend.

Did not work for my Pentax SMC-P DA -L 55-300 lens - despite it being a 58mm. I know it says this hood works with 'virtually' all 58mm lenses but still disappointing. Will try to return. I would have kept if it fit. The hood seemed well made. Since it did not fit, it's hard to know if the pushbutton mount would have been cool or fickle.

I love it when products just work as expected - and this thing delivers. I have no complaints and I wouldn't change a thing. And, of course, drum roll...if I lost it today, I would absolutely order another one immediately. I'm using this with Mac OS X Maverick on two Macbook Airs.- Small and light- Feels solid and well designed- Intuitive layout- A button for everything you'll need- Decent padded case for travel- Up and running in seconds every time - just plug it in

I always get large and I like things roomy and loose. These are roomier and looser than I expected. And, they hang down to about mid-knee on me (5'10" / 175). I'd say they're the largest, baggiest shorts I've ever owned in fact. But, that being said, I like them and I'm keeping them. For me, they're just for walking, hanging around the house and trips to the gym.- Super roomy, but very comfortable- Ridiculously good value for the price.- Like the other review said, I would call these 'tennis approved' due to the huge pockets.- Seem well constructed

I've been buying a few rechargables at a time as needed and of course always in a state of 'not having enough batteries' when I needed them. So, I finally bought this Power Pack and I'm very pleased. Now, when I go to grab a pair of AA for a new geek toy or flashlight, I already have them in the drawer.This is a good deal compared to buying a few at a time. But, it depends on your needs - for me this was perfect. I'll probably buy another at some point.

I leave this in my backpack all the time. And, when I'm going out with camera and gear, just throw the camera into this holster in the main backpack compartment and it's good to go. It's really the perfect size and level of protection for my needs. Very pleased.

I had my doubts but they are amazing. I've wanted the over ear version for a while and finally decided to buy them before a long trip to Cambodia. Saw these and had just enough time to order, try and then return for the others if they disappointed. They did not disappoint. These are keepers and I've used them on a few flights now so figured I would write a review.What I love:- with a click of a button, it's like I'm in a library and not on a plane. Awesome.- I've used the MIE2i headset for years and already thought it was the best out there in terms of comfort.- One thing that always kept me from buying the 'over the ear' version was the size factor. I already have a ton of stuff in my backpack and couldn't imagine fitting these in there too. So, I've always gone with the cheaper 'in the ear' headsets before now.- These fit perfectly in an eyeglasses case - and much better protected. The case that comes with these headphones is pathetic and they should be embarrassed to send us this.- Thick tangle proof cords have pros and cons. Yes, they're thick and can be annoying at times. And, kind of tacky so they get caught on clothing sometimes. But, the cord is heavy duty and feels like it can handle some travel abuse. The pros outweigh the cons for me. I want these to last and I'm surprised but I think they will.The rechargeable battery would not have been my first choice. But, it lasts 16 hours, charges fast, and I always have a battery in my bag so I could charge it in the airport before boarding if I forgot to charge it or ran out of juice unexpectedly.Lastly, yes, using these with music or a movie on a flight is a slice of heaven. But, I use them alone too -  just for the noise canceling for the entire flight - and since they're 'in ear' style, I can snooze too.If you can spare the cash, you want these.

I used to buy shoes like this when I was younger and was always surprised by the quality for the price. They lasted a long time and the soles were so good you could easily go outside once in a while. Not so much with these. I returned them.I didn't like:- the general quality was below my expectations.- loose threads, etc. They wouldn't have lasted long.- The sole was weak and cheap - not even close to the pairs I used to buy years ago.Even at this price, they're not worth it for me. I spent a little more and went with leather mocassins. If you wanted to really save some money and didn't mind a little effort, get a leather moccasin kit and make your own - the kit is less than half of just buying the mocassins already made. I bet you can get a kit for under $20 and they're going to last a lot longer. My two cents.

I wasn't sure how this would turn out but I'm very happy with this light.- It's small and transportable. Throw into backpack, etc.- Easy to handle since it's lightweight.- Worked great with my rechargeable batteries.When I need just a little more light to take care of some shadows - like in our kitchen usually - for pics of food, etc. - this light delivers. No complaints here.

I was concerned about the fit and read all the reviews. My foot is 10.5 exactly but I almost always go with size 11 - they feel better, more roomy etc. I like things loose. In this case, because these are all leather, I went with my exact shoe size of 10.5 figuring they would stretch a little. And, they did - and I love them.These moccasins work beautifully for me. They felt a little rough at first with the laces rubbing the top of my foot a little uncomfortably. After a few hours, everything started to come together and they were stretching to fit my feet like a glove. I should say I only wear these barefoot. For socks I definitely would have had to go with size 11. I should say, I had to loosen up the laces - they were tied to tightly out of the box and that's why they were rubbing annoyingly on the top of my foot. New sneakers are the same for me every time.I'll probably do the water trick and wet them down and wear them for a few hours so that they truly fit my feet perfectly. But, they're so close already at this point, after a few days, I may skip that trick.Very happy with these. If they last for any length of time - like a year or more - I'll buy again in a heartbeat and they have a customer for life. Super comfortable.

My wife and I both needed the extra storage on our MBAs. And, this works out perfectly. I tried one out for a few weeks and it worked fine so I picked up another. It's perfect for our use - we offload a lot of media files onto this drive to keep the laptops running a little leaner.- So small it's hardly noticeable. Will be left in permanently.- A good amount of storage for $45- Sure I wish it was faster but speed hasn't been an issue.If I lost it , I'd buy another. It's exactly what we needed.If you go this route and don't already have a powered USB hub - I recommend picking one up. Because with this drive permanently taking up one precious USB port on my laptop, a powered hub is absolutely necessary - IMHO.

We went with this brand for the first time to give it a try. It's all stainless steel and a fraction of the cost of Cuisinart or All Clad. It is definitely heavy, but it’s try ply and works beautifully. Very pleased and would buy this brand again. This thing will last forever - seems very durable and in fact indestructible.
I bought this to use as a face cover while traveling in Asia - pollution etc. while riding the tuk tuks. Worked like a charm. Quality as expected. Easy to wash and dries quickly too - bonus.

I bought this to use a hand or wrist strap for my Pentax DSLR. Works great. It was cheaper than the camera straps I looked at and far more rugged and bombproof. I noticed that it was the same length as the camera straps I was looking at so I figured hey it's worth trying.Great for the price. Can't comment on it for rock climbing.

We've had the thicker, heavier Bear Motion leather case on our full size iPad for a while now and love it. I tried this Yooboa because I wanted to see about the weight difference and maybe save a few ounces. It looks like you save about 4oz and get thinner leather for about $10 or so more. I'm happy with the purchase so far. I'll change my review if there's a durability issue. The Bear Motion was bomb proof and my wife and I both think they're outstanding cases.For the Yoobao, I like the following:- Quality leather - has a very nice feel to it - will be enjoyable to carry around- Looks sharp- Corner protection - in fact, total edge protection all around- Light - thinner leatherDislikes - but I can live with them - personal choice:- These kind of cases protect from scratches primarily - I don't think they'd make a big difference if you dropped the iPad. But, still I've had both and much prefer this kind of case to the Otter Box kind that adds bulk. For pure protection, Otterbox rules. In other words, if you drop your iPad, it won't have any scratches on it - but it will be broken. Personal preference - I prefer leather and just try to be careful - YMMV.While I loved the Bear Motion case, I always thought the lack of corner protection was its Achilles Heel. You could still get the corners scratched and bang it up a little while in the case. But, that being said, we never had any problems. This Yoobao has total edge protection all around - that was one of the deciding factors for giving this one a spin too.I don't think you can go wrong with either this or Bear Motion - if you're not sure, order both and return the one that doesn't work for you. I'm happy with this one so far.

These days what vehicle is complete without one of these. And, this one is solid and stylish too.What I like:- very small- solid feel - has a good industrial strength feel to it.- has a nice Apple sort of cool factor look- I really like that I can now use my usb cable to charge my gps - sweet because the cable is much thinner and shorter than the normal one - result is much less clutter. Bonus.And appeases the multi device vehicle - which is everyone these days.

For the price, these are a great value. I normally wear 36 pants and they would normally feel baggy. These 36s fit perfectly just not quite the bagginess I would want for a hot, humid, trekking kind of vacation. So, I went with 38, and tightened the belt a little - fit perfectly for my needs.I took off one star because of the zippers and flimsy velcro on most of the pockets. But these are a solid 4 and great value. I'm not sure about durability but even with the few issues, these should last at least 3-4 trips. And, at this price, it's an easy decision for buy again despite the opportunities for improvement.What I like:- they're great shorts - nice long inseam like board shorts- incredibly light and easily packable pants- multi functional brilliance in terms of travel clothing- adding/removing the leg parts is pretty easy and fast- material is very thin and breathes well in hot, humid climates - or sitting on a plane for 12-hours. It seems rugged and rip stop so it should be durable - it's just so thin I can't help but wonder. I'm pretty sure the zippers will fail first.- Dry very fast - easily washed on the go and dry by morning - very nice.- front pockets are nice and big and deep- easy hemmed for fit perfection (no side zippers)What I didn't like:- zippers could be better - left cargo pocket couldn't be closed with one hand because of cheap zipper getting caught every time. Annoying. Better zipper choices would have been better.- right cargo pocket should be zippered instead of tiny little piece of velcro. While the velcro was handy for grabbing a camera lens or park ticket for quick access - I kept checking to make sure I didn't lose something.
