These were huge on me.  I could hardly walk across the room in them.  I returned them and ended up buying a similar style by Clark's at DSW for way too much money.  I should have just exchanged these for a smaller size, but I was afraid to try buying shoes again on line without being able to try them on first.

This is the last of the first three Gabe Quinn series of murder mysteries.  It's been a while since I've read this, but I still think about it.  It takes place in Alaska and is a culmination of all of Quinn's previous nemeses.  It ties up the trilogy nicely and still has a surprise ending, with room for more stories to follow.  I read all three of the Gabe Quinn books in one week, one right after the after.  Couldn't put them down.  Definitely not your typical mainstream mystery series.

These caps do double duty.  The cranberry is good for keeping UTI's away and the D-Mannose is really good for your eyes, according to my optometrist.  He says that D-Mannose is a type of glucose (sugar) that keeps your optic nerves healthy.  I do have a history of optic neuritis and I've had no flare-ups since I began taking this product.  No UTI's, either.

I opened these up and was like wha....?  Until you try them on, they do not look at all like capri leggings.  Once I actually got into them, though, I really liked them.  They're a nice weight for summer, but not terribly, terribly sheer.  You definitely want to wear these with a long top or under a skirt, though, to avoid showing the world what color underwear you're wearing.

This is a really unusual piece, in that the edges of the decal are not rectangular, like an ordinary poster, but are rather cut to look like flowing water.  In the picture above, the white edges you see of the rectangle are actually the wall, and the decal itself is the blue water and the marble-colored staircase.  The effect is magnificent, blending seamlessly into my wall, as if the Little Mermaid just appeared there in a puddle of water, like a mirage.  It's really unique and very cool.

This is a very pretty top.  Looks like old lace.  However, it is WAY too small on me - I wear a US size 8 with 36" bust, and this is a crop top on me.  Also, the "white" is not actually white but ivory/off-white.  I don't know if they sent me the wrong color or what, but this definitely does not look like the picture.

This was a bit snug in the waist, even when I scrunched it up to try and hide some small tummy bulges.  The sequined layer is longer in the back than in the front.  The back looked nice, but the front looked like I was wearing a clown collar.  I'm high-waisted, and the sequins just didn't sit right on my chest.  Also, this is a bit too glimmery for daytime wear, which is what I wanted it for.  The material is medium gray, not white.  It looked more white on my monitor.

This is a beautiful top, great for a night out or even paired with denim shorts for day with extra sparkle.  The back is plain gray material without sequins.  The neck closure has eye-and-hook clasps, which is a little hard to close by myself; would have preferred a snap, but not too big a deal.  The sequined front is not lined, so it's a little itchy.  I'll wear it with a strapless bra.

Super fun tank top.  Form-fitting, and yet somehow the shiny material is very forgiving of tummy bulges.  I will wear mine under a white crochet top, but it looks good enough to wear alone if you have the body for it.  Nice quality.

Really cute, funky top.  I love the bright yellow with the vivid purple, and of course Boticelli's Venus is beautiful.  3/4 sleeves with boat neck.  The material is not too thin, but not so thick that you can't wear this in summer.

What a terrific deal, 6 bottles for this low price!  My friends and I mix coconut oil with a muscle relief essential oil blend (such as DoTerra's Deep Blue or Eden's Garden Muscle Relief) and put it in these little bottles.  Just roll it over wherever you hurt.  The bottle is small enough to do wrists and forehead without getting messy.  Convenient and such a pretty shade of cobalt blue.  Use one for yourself and give the rest as gifts!

Great stuff.  Smells like wintergreen.  One gal in my support group tried this for pain related to her autoimmune disease and told the rest of us about it and now a bunch of us are using it to combat chronic pain.  We mix it with coconut oil (in the liquid form) and put it in little Aromatherapy Roll On Bottles (also available on Amazon).  You just roll it over wherever you're hurting and it really helps.

I truly did not think that I would enjoy this book as much as I did.  I had heard great things about it, but I was initially biased against it because it's self-published.  Stupid, I know.  Still, I took a chance... and immediately had to buy all 3 in the series.  I couldn't put it down and read all 3 books in a week.  Killing Hope is so much darker and twisted than anything you'd normally think of as a thriller.  At the end of every chapter, I found myself saying, "That is so F'd up!"  There isn't a whole lot I can say about the plot without ruining it for you, except that police detective Gabe Quinn chases a sadistic serial killer from Los Angeles to Las Vegas.  Everything else about it was a surprise twist.  I haven't read any interviews with the author, but, based on the structure of this novel, I'd have to guess that he wrote two or three prequels to Killing Hope, unpublished in the US, and then basically rewrote them before publishing this book.  I don't see how else he could have conceived of the extremely complex structure of this book.  Plus, there is a lot of backstory here - references to previously solved cases that led up to this one.  For example, when and how did Gabe Quinn get the nickname of Celebrity Cop?  He apparently solved a case and wrote a book about it while the killer was in prison.  This is referred to a lot as something that happened in the past, and yet that actual case is nowhere in the 3 Gabe Quinn novels published in the US.  I'd love it if those missing manuscripts were to eventually see the light of day.

It's hard to go wrong with Skechers.  Their shoes just fit really well and they have good arch support.  Plus they're really cute.  So glad I got these.  The memory foam insoles take a little getting used to; they're sort of hard on the arches until they get broken in, but then they eventually mold perfectly to your feet.

This top has an unusual design.  The bottom layer - the side on the left, when you're looking at the picture - is actually a separate piece of fabric that is attached on the sides only, leaving your belly exposed.  Then the top layer - the side on the right in the picture - drapes over it.  In my case, I could not get the bottom layer to lie flat against my belly, so it creates the appearance of tummy bulges.  It was very unflattering on me.

Ai!  What was I thinking?  Wanted to add a little bling for underneath my summer tunic tops, but these leggings are just awful.  The thighs fit ok, but loose in the knees, calves and ankles.  Also, I think you'd have to wear the tiniest of string bikini bottoms with this because it clings to the panty line.
Perfect for underneath all my summer tank tops.  Fits snugly without being uncomfortable.  Lined in front, unlined in back.
Looks beautiful and feels soft & silky, but runs larger than the sizing chart indicates.  I wear a size 9 and am exchanging the XL for a L.

I can't believe how much I love this shirt.  It is super comfortable and soft, fits perfectly.  The gold studs add just enough bling without being obnoxious or cheap-looking.  It's just a great summer T-shirt.

Very pretty but I really could have used another inch or two in width.  Also, the unlined lace was itchy on my back.  I prefer the KMystic Floral Lace Layered Bandeau Tube Top Bra, also available on Amazon.

This is great stuff!  I bought a bottle for my 73-year-old mom when she caught bronchitis and she was better within 3 or 4 days.  Then, when I felt myself coming down with the bronchitis that was ravaging my family, I took one capsule a day myself and didn't get sick - and I'm even on immuno-suppressants for an autoimmune disease!  Agarikon is an extremely rare mushroom found on old-growth conifer trees in the Pacific Northwest.  When you buy this brand, Host Defense donates some of the proceeds to sustaining the forests and keeping these precious mushrooms from becoming extinct.  Look up the September 15, 2012 issue of The Huffington Post for more information on how agarikon mushrooms have been clinically proven to resist such bacteria and viruses as tuberculosis, cowpox, swine flu, bird flu, herpes and potentially many others.

The premise was great:  one legendary financial trader bet another that he could "raise traders like they raise turtles in Singapore."  To this end, a small group of students was chosen to participate in the experiment to determine whether great traders are born or made.  Known as "the Turtles," the students spent a month learning from the best all the tools and tricks of the trade.  The top-earning Turtle, 19-year-old Curtis Faith, made more than $30M in just over four years, but even he concludes that great traders are both born AND made, not either/or.  Faith's book, Way of the Turtle, aims to reveal how the Turtles made money, why some Turtles were more successful than others, and how you can apply the Turtle Way to your own trades.  Well, let's just say that Faith is a much better trader than an author.  He talks "about" how the turtles made money, but doesn't get into specifics.  As for why some Turtles did better than others, the answer seems to be to just follow the rules and don't overthink it.  The rules, however, are incredibly vague.  As for how to apply these teachings to your own trading, well, I did not find a single useable nugget of specific information here.  Honestly, except for the intriguing back-story of the bet and the triumph of Faith as the underdog in the class (he being the youngest and least experienced), I don't see why Van Tharp calls this "one of the five best trading books ever written."  For me, it was a cute little story, but I didn't learn anything.  You'd be better off reading Tharp's "Trade Your Way to Financial Freedom" or Stan Weinstein's "Secrets for Profiting in Bull and Bear Markets."
The green is not as vivid as in the picture.  It's more of a grayish olive color, with taupe and white background.  Fits perfectly.  Very flattering cut.  Incredibly comfortable.
My particular tie-dye pattern is more orange than yellow.  Fits perfectly, based on the size chart.  Soft and comfortable.
I totally love this top.  Fits perfectly.  So cute, yet elegant.  Soft, silky material.  I'm going to buy more of this top in other colors.

This top does not hold its shape.  The built-in bra shelf has pads that don't stay in place.  Also, the neckline on mine didn't lie flush against my breastplate.  The whole thing was just uncomfortable.  I guess you get what you pay for when it comes to athletic tops.

This is a really great top.  I bought it in black, brown, beige and ivory.  It's just gorgeous.  Plus, it's lined - something I would not expect for this price.  I'm a size 9, with 36" bust, and I bought this in an XL, based on the size chart.  It fits perfectly.  The ivory, just so you know, is off-white; the picture on my screen looks white but it's more like the color of antique lace.
I bought this in medium and it was huge on me.  I'm a size 9 with 36" bust.  Just can't imagine wearing a size small, so I returned mine.

I'm a size 9 with 36" bust and the Large was too small on me.  I exchanged it for an XL, which was much too big.  Too bad; it's a really pretty  top, soft material, not too thin.  The cut-out sleeves make it extra special.

I'm a US size 9, with 36" bust.  I bought this top in medium and large, in a variety of colors, and BOTH sizes fit fine!  I really can't see the difference between the two.  I guess the medium is somewhat tighter across the bust, but it's really a toss-up.  The length is short enough to wear with knee-length shorts, and long enough to cover your butt when you wear with leggings.  The color is slightly more peachy than in the picture.  The material has a nice weight and softness.  I own several MBJ (Made By Johnny) pieces and the quality is consistently great, at a price you can't beat.
This is the perfect little black skirt.  Fits great.  Very flattering.  Hits about 2-3" above the knee.  I'm 5'6" with very long thighs.

Here's a case where the Asian sizing really makes a big difference.  I would normally buy a medium in this style top, but I trusted the sizing chart and got the XL for my 36" bust, and I'm glad I did.  You really do need the extra material in order to get the proper drape effect.  The color is a bit brighter than the picture, somewhere between bubblegum and neon pink.

I usually would wear a medium and that's what size I chose for this top, and it fits great.  The color is beautiful.  The material is really soft, like your favorite T-shirt.  Elegant enough to wear with a skirt for a night out, but basic enough to look good with jeans or shorts.  One of those go-to pieces that become a staple of your wardrobe.

Perfect, perfect, perfect in every way.  The Asian sizing is always tricky, but I got this one exactly right.  I have a 36" bust and went with the large on this.  Not too tight across the bust, not too loose under the arms.  The gathers at the waist give it a lot of shape without being clingy on the tummy.  The length is perfect - you can wear it with shorts or leggings.  The fabric is soooo soft.  This is destined to be one of my favorite summertime tops.
I'm a size 8 or 9, with 36" bust, and this was huge on me.  Looked like a tent.  The workmanship was nice, though.
I'm a size 9, and these fit me perfectly.  Very comfortable.  Color is true to the picture.
I'm a size 8 or 9, with 36" bust, and this was small on me, even in the plus size.  The seam goes right across the middle of the bust.  Also, the orange print material is very thin and feels cheap.

Run of the mill microfiber towels. I found them to lint a quite a bit even after washing. They're good for light duty cleaning, or for cleaning the door jams of cars because they're cheap enough to be sacrificial (especially with S&S on Amazon). They're an 80/20 polyester/polyamide blend and made in China. Remember to wash them only with microfibers, on warm, no softeners, no bleach, and dry on extra low or air. I'll buy more as needed of this product.

I was never a believer in Grit Guards until I decided to paint correct my car. I figured anything I can do to lesson scratches the better. These are quite inexpensive and a good investment. There IS crud and scum at the bottom of the bucket. These don't fit in all 5 gallon buckets, so be aware of that. The Home Depot buckets will allow these to rest at the bottom, the Lowes ones they will sit a few inches above from the bottom. I think this is actually better as it leaves more distance from the crud and scum at the bottom. I have a bucket from Autozone that will barely let one of these go half way down in, so I use that for my wheels now. I got two for the two bucket wash method.

I purchased this stuff because I saw a video on how much it foams up. The more suds, the better as it lifts and carries away dirt. Since it foams so much, you don't need to use much, about 2oz in a 5 gallon bucket for me. I also use it in my Gilmour Foamaster foam gun to presoak my car with foam. After rinsing that off, I sponge wash, then soak in foam once more with the foam gun then rinse. Great results, and the foam gun doesn't really use a lot of water so I don't feel bad about water waste. It smells like honeydew, obviously. This is more expensive than the Meguiars God Class car wash and shampoo I was using, but it always foams A LOT more, and works better so I'm ok with spending 3x as much (the Meguiars I got from Costco).
Good towels, I got these for my car's interior so I could color code by use. They are a light-medium weight towel and perfect for my intended use. Price was fair, and they work as I expected.

This product has a lot of 5 star reviews for good reason, and that's why I decided to try it. I used it on my tires and black trim, with excellent results. It is necessary to wipe off/buff the residue to achieve proper bonding and full protection the directions say. I like that the sheen is more of a satin rather than gloss. This stuff is more expensive than the others, but that's because it works better. I used a foam pad to apply and an old (not dirty, just one I could throw away) cotton towel to wipe off and buff. Highly recommended.

I got this to rinse/soak my car with a high suds foam detergent before I took a wash sponge to it. This thing is so easy to use, and works really well. A little expensive in my opinion, but what can you do. The dilution can be adjusted, and the spray tip can be set to be vertical or horizontal. The trigger head has a quick connect to the sprayer itself, so you can easily disconnect it. Also, the sprayer swivels at the quick connect, so it always stays level. Trigger head is a zinc alloy, and the quick connects good quality machined brass, sprayer body is plastic. Great product, made in USA.

I love these 3M Aura respirators. I've always used the ones without the valve, but they were not in stock when I needed them so I got these instead. They're double the cost, but more comfortable to wear, obviously. Can't go wrong with these, they fit well, are more comfortable than the cone style (for me anyway), and work great.

I got this kit because it's far cheaper than buying the pads individually, even if you only need three. They work great, and the backing is strong. I've had them up to full speed on my Bosch D/A sander/polisher and they haven't come off, and peeling them off repeatedly hasn't damaged the Velcro backing yet either. Washing them isn't too bad, I prewash/soak in a sink first to get the bulk of the compound/polish/wax etc. off then throw them in the washing machine. I've washed them on hot, with a little TSP and detergent and had good results. The included cleaner is great for prewashing/soaking. Your car's finish might respond better to a microfiber pad for paint correction, so you may need to experiment. The red and black pads are great for wax and sealant application, respectively.

If you have just one car to correct paint on, this sample kit is great. You really don't need a lot of this stuff when you use it, so these small bottles go a long way. I used the 32, 34, 36 on a neglected Chevy truck that rarely got washed and was never waxed in it's 9 year life. I wasn't trying to get a $1M finish obviously, but just breath some new life into it. These compounds and polishes worked great. If I spent even more time and put more effort I'd have had a better result, but again, I wasn't trying to get a showroom finish on a 9 year old truck. Paint correction takes a long time, it's not something that's done in an afternoon, so be mindful of that. If you go through all four of these products to correct your paint, you're looking at two full days of work, at least.

Another great Pelican product. Got this to replace the set that came with my 1450 case after I got more things to put in it. I do wish they sold only the pick and pluck middle section of foam, and that's really the only one most people will ever need to replace. In any case it's a great product.

I was repairing my kitchen faucet and while I knew I probably didn't need this part I got it anyway. I have very hard water and figured the mineral deposits might have caused a problem with this. Wasn't the case, but I changed it anyway. What I did was buff and polish the outside of the ball for even smoother action against the rubber seats. I also put it in an ultrasonic with an acidic cleaner to give the surface more of a corrosion resistant passivated finish. Most people don't have access to this and it isn't really necessary but I did it anyway. Facet works great now.

Thankfully Amazon carries this, which saved me a trip to a home center and the hassle that goes with that. It has all the parts to replace the pieces in your faucet (as long as they're compatible). Everything went smoothly and for a few bucks you can stop leaks and have a faucet work like new.

Used this to replace the part in my 13 year old Delta kitchen faucet. Worked great, couldn't be easier. Pull out the old one, push in the new one, and done. I'm sure this is available at many home centers or hardware stores, but I can buy it here and have it delivered to my door.

This is a very good laser measure, with some great features, but also a couple of minor shortcomings.The pros are:Small, lightweight.Very easy to use.Uses readily available AAA batteries.Comes with a holster."Signal strength" indicator (how well it can read the laser beam from a surface).Backlit screen with battery level indicator.Minor shortcomings are:Can only measure a minimum distance of 8".No angle measurement (inclinometer).No 1/4x20 threaded mount.The shortcomings aren't much, and really the biggest one is the minimum distance it can measure. Also, the accuracy is +/- 1/8", a little "loose" in terms of accuracy. Overall though, I think this is a good product especially for a DIY or casual user. It can measure in feet (fractions and decimal), inches, and meters. It will do area and volume as well, and store the last 10 measurements. I think the price is a *tad bit* on the high side, but then again the pros/cons balance it out. Thankfully technology gets smaller and cheaper every day, and things like this will only benefit from that. All in a all a good product and one that I don't think someone would have regrets about purchasing.

I have two Bostich framing nailers, and both have been great tools. This combo kit is great, and although I'd guess probably aimed more toward DIY types, would work equally well for professionals also.The compressor is compact, relatively lightweight, and has two ports which is a great convenience. Being oil-less, it is rather loud, however. I used to have a Hitachi 6gal pancake compressor, and it was definitely quieter. This one goes up to 150psi though, so that means it'll cycle less frequently. The included hose is light and flexible, and for most applications the 25ft length should work fine, though I use a 50ft polyurethane hose.The 18ga brad nailer works great. It had no trouble sinking the included brads into hard maple, and certainly no trouble with pine. It's a *bit* heavy for what it is, heavier than my Paslode. However, I think this one is built more stoutly.The 16ga finish nailer is great tool as well. I LOVE the tool free jam clearing ability. I found the depth adjustment needed a plier to move at first, but it was probably just over tightened at the factory. This had no trouble sinking the included nails all the way into hardwoods, and I found the arrows on the rubber pad helpful for placing nails.The stapler is the only tool I am not as fond of in the kit, though that's not to say I don't like it. I had a strange issue with it. Setting the compressor to 100psi (max pressure for this tool), after shooting a staple, then trying to shoot another it wouldn't go into the wood. The pressure on the regulated gauge showed 60psi. At this setting the tool failed to work properly. After raising the regulated pressure to about 130psi, it shot multiple staples fine. I didn't have any problems with the nailers when the compressor was set to 100psi. The stapler is great for upholstery, securing tar paper, and things like that. It uses T50 type staples, which are widely available in different lengths and metal types.The fit and finish of all items in this kit are very good, and from my experience typical of Bostich quality. The tools have a 7 year warranty, the compressor I am not sure of, but I'd say it has to be at least a year. Stapler made in Taiwan, brad and finish nailers made in China, and compressor made in USA. This kit is a really great value.

This is a great device for a layman type person and one that's easy to use and read. I got this to check and verify light output of light bulbs and it's done its job nicely. The price couldn't be better, and frankly for a non scientific type person like me, using it around the house, it couldn't be better. Would buy again, or recommend to to others.

I'll be blunt and say right off the bat that these LED bulbs impressed me.Now, here is more. The light color, or 4000K temp. of the bulbs is, for me, absolutely perfect. Not yellow at all, and not blue at all. A nice, clean, crisp WHITE light. The size and look of the bulbs essentially mimics old incandescent bulbs. This isn't too important for me, but it's nice none the less. The output of light by these IS more than the 23W CFL they replaced. Not only was this perceived output, but verified by a lumen lux meter. I measured light output in three placed, all the same distance, and one of these put out more light than the CFL they replaced. Not a huge difference, but definitely more. The CFL was 3500K. The power draw for this bulb is about 10W measured with a Kill-A-Watt. They also don't get as hot as a CFL, as measured by a non contact IR thermometer.I installed a "Y" adapter in my light fixture so I could put two of these in. I like LOTS of light. Now my room looks like a bright sunny day. So, two of these bulbs consume about 20W, 3W less than the CFL, are 500K more in color temperature, don't get as hot, go on instantly, and don't give off UV. The real test will be longevity, and hope they last at least 5 years. At about 7.50 each as of this writing, they are a great value as well.I am very pleased with these bulbs, and hope they offer 100W equivalent versions soon. Highly recommend these!

Once again Freud delivers. A great blade at an even better price (less than most competitors). I put this in my Makita 18V saw and it cut very well. I don't expect furniture quality cuts from this blade or a cordless saw but it did a great job. Even though it doesn't make sense to sharpen a blade like this, it's got nice thick carbide on the teeth. Very good blade, one that I don't think anyone would regret purchasing. Made in Italy.

Wow! This stuff works really well! I used it to clean a TV in my kitchen and bedroom, my PC, and my netbook and even my phone. Did a great job on all items. A little goes a long way. It's got a little viscosity which is nice as it doesn't really run when sprayed. Great stuff!!

This is another great Calvin Klein scent. Not overpowering and obnoxious, lasts a good while, and great for casual or formal wear. A little expensive though. I think most younger women would not be too keen on it, however.

This is another cool toy in the Fisher-Price Imaginext line of DC comics super friends. It's got features to keep young boys (and girls) entertained, and goes well with the other toys in the series. There's a couple of LED lights that light up when the eyes open, and the snake slithers as the elevators rises and lowers. There are some swords and projectiles too. The toy doesn't have any sounds like the Joker's laff factory that's also a part of this series and that's too bad. However, this is a nice compliment to the other toys of the DC super friends series.

I love this stuff. Thank goodness Amazon carries this, even though it costs three times as much as it does in stores, NO stores in my area stocked this color. I needed exactly this color to paint a Wilton machinist vise I'm restoring, and it's about as perfect a match to the original color as you can get. Dries fast, durable, and just perfect.
Worked perfectly for me. It fits and works perfectly.

I used this blade to cut about 18 lineal feet of drywall and plaster/lathe and while it got the job done, the blade was worn out at the end. I didn't have any broken teeth but they were worn down. I kept rotating the blade to expose fresh teeth and by the end of the job the blade's life was over. A little disappointing since it's a BiM TiN coated blade and Swiss made. On the blade it says "wood metal fiberboard" but I can't imagine cutting much fiberboard with this blade since that stuff is even more abrasive than what I was cutting. I would not buy this blade again.

I've used these beam style wipers from other manufacturers and found them to not conform to the windshield as well as the old style. I thought I'd give these a try because I had purchased this manufacturer's silicone (old style) wiper blades and liked them. These perform well so far and don't streak as much as the other brands of beam style wipers I've used. However, there is a spot right in front of my sight line on the windshield that has a streak. Since these are rubber and not silicone, I don't expect them to last as long as silicone blades. I can't speak to their ability to handle snow/ice since I'm in southern CA and never deal with that. This is a good product, though not exceptional.

I would have given this five stars if the tines on the comb side were closer together. As it is, they are spaced a little far apart and don't work as well as they would if they were closer and more. However, it still works and comes in handy to prolong the life of expensive brushes. Made in USA

Bless the inventor(s) of this type tool. These are extremely handy, versatile tools that every DIY person and contractor should have. Bosch doesn't disappoint with this one. Typical top notch fit and finish, and thoughtful engineering from Bosch. The quick release feature is NICE, and holds TIGHT. The variable speed is also nice, and a must. A long (13.6 foot) cord is always a plus. The motor is plenty powerful and I have not found the tool lacking. To be honest it IS a little heavy, so for prolonged overhead work it would get tiring, but otherwise I haven't had an issue. It can be a little noisy but I almost always use ear protection with power tools, so not a huge factor. This kit comes with a good mix of accessories, but most are sanding pads so bear that in mind. I use only Bosch accessories so I can't speak to fitment and compatibility with other brands. A nice accessory box as well as a carrying bag round out a great kit. I got the depth stop too, which is handy. Made in Switzerland.

My wife changes the case on her phone as much as she changes her shoes, so she thought these would be great. They are so-so. They're soft and provide protection, but in my opinion no where near that of a firmly fitted case like a Spigen. These fit rather loosely. There's ten of them to a package and it came with two plastic screen protectors. Decent product, but my wife is "eh" about them now and I wouldn't trust my phone to one personally.EDIT:I am copying and pasting a comment from the manufacturer for posterity:Hi Gauda!So sorry to hear your cases aren't fitting as snug as they should be! Though it is rare, on occasion a mistake or flaw can occur, and we'll always replace any products that fail to measure up. Please contact us at the customer service link provided below and we will do all that we can to make this right by you!Have a wonderful weekend!Kendall / The Friendly SwedeBecause of this customer service, I'm upgrading my review to four stars. Sometimes, even if a product isn't great but the maker stands behind it, that earns some points. I am in sales and service myself and understand this intimately. I'm not yet sure if I'll contact them, but I am pleased to see they care about customers and stand by their product.

I got this after seeing a video by a machinist on YouTube where he used one of these and wow, I can't believe I didn't know about these before. This one is well made (not sure where though) and works well too. The spring has applies a good amount of force to the tap/wrench which helps to keep it straight. A super handy tool and one I'm glad to have now.

I really like this book. I have two other books on kitchen cabinets, and while both of those books provide good information (I have no regrets buying them), I like this one the best. The author does a very, very good job of explaining the building process and devotes a lot of time to the organization process. He tells you why it should be done, why it's important, and what can happen if you don't do it. The other books by Udo Schmidt and Randy Johnson don't really delve too much into this. What the other books lack is real information on European or frameless style cabinets. This book has far more information on that subject, which is of particular interest to me.Yes, this book is a bit dated in some aspects (like using biscuit joinery instead of pocket screws or Dominos) but the illustrations are well done. I wish the photographs were color, but this is a small thing and doesn't really impact the book. I really suggest this book for anyone wanting to build cabinets but honestly would say that it would be good to get the ones from the authors mentioned above as well (Building Kitchen Cabinets -Schmidt and How To Make Kitchen Cabinets -Johnson). One can never have too much information and each book is a valuable resource.

BLU products did a great job with this phone. It's super thin and light (more so on both than an S5) with a sleek look. Setting it up is as easy as any Android phone. Just pop in your SIM card (don't lose the tiny key for the SIM door), activate with your carrier, and sign in with your Google account. The display is really, really nice. Crisp and bright. Sound was clear and without issues. I thought the camera took pictures of good quality too.Bear in mind, this is NOT an LTE phone, but it will work on 4G (and 3G and lower) network signals. Frankly, this isn't that big a deal as the difference between 4G and 4G-LTE isn't as significant as say, the difference between 3G and 4G. This phone is also a little slow due to only 1GB of RAM. Keep in mind though, that those are the compromises for a phone that costs only 200 bucks. It really isn't fair to compare this phone to flagship products from Apple or Samsung that cost 3 or 4 times as much. This phone holds its own for the most part even against those phones I'd say.Another thing I really liked about this phone was that it came with a TPU case and a screen protector (plastic) in the box. Of course, it included a charger and ear buds too. Overall I think this is a great value for a phone of good performance and great quality.

What an awesome ring especially for thirteen bucks! Wow, really, wow. Why pay hundreds for precious metals when this looks just as good and could fool anyone at an arms length (if that's your thing)? Cheap enough to buy a few as back ups. Love the domed, polished look. Very pleased with my purchase, as is my better half. I'm buying a few more as back ups as a matter of fact.

I got this instead of the Blitz brand cleaning solution that I was using mostly for the lower price. I found that it worked just as well and did a great job cleaning jewelry (which I use my mini sonic for). A little goes a long way with this stuff, and one bottle lasts me about a year. Made in USA, so all the better.

This is something I seldom use, but when I need it I'm glad to have it. Installing and adjusting it couldn't be easier, and there's even an instruction booklet in the package. It's made of plastic, so I exercise a little care with it. A handy accessory for such a versatile tool. I got it when the price had dropped a little, so I like it even more. Made in Hungary.

I really like this cologne's scent. Not over powering, but it's definitely there. The body wash smells like the cologne, so if I use one I won't really use the other since it would be redundant and I'd smell like I poured the whole bottle on myself. This is a great gift set and on par as far as cost with most other sets like this. Other than the cap being a bit hard to pull off, there's not much else to say about it.

A little on the expensive side, but still reasonable compared to the HEPA filters. I used this in conjunction with the yellow type H bag in my small ShopVac. I was sanding plaster with my power sander that I had hooked up to my vacuum and non of that fine dust escaped inside the house. Overall a good value. This size fits 5 gallon and above, except the wall hanging one and the portable one.

I put these in my small ShopVac that I hooked up to my Bosch sander. I was sanding my wall that I patched and these did a great job of catching that ultra fine dust. A little expensive, but they last a while and do the job so I can't complain.

This is a good product, but the reason I gave it four stars is because there is no wet cleaning cloth in the package, and there is a pair of plastic tabs and a plastic film that seem to have no apparent purpose. Of course, there are no instructions included to tell you why those are in the package. It goes on and works like any other glass screen protector, and for the price it's a good deal. I'd still buy again.

Dickies are a classic. I've had many pairs over the years. These are great, except they fit small. I'd recommend ordering one size up, as I did. If you're tucking in shirts you might want to order two sizes up. Dickies are crunchy when new, which I hate, but they last a long, long time. A good value. If they fit true to size I'd have given five stars.

Exceptional protection at a fair price. Installing it couldn't be easier, just clean your phone's screen with the wet wipe included, buff with the microfiber included, and stick on the glass. Press it on and work out the bubbles with the microfiber and that's all. It doesn't completely cover the face of the phone, there's about .5mm around the perimeter that's exposed. This allows cases not to interfere with it and vice versa. I'll be buying one of these for my wife's phone, and recommend it to friends and family for their phones as well. Glass screen protectors actually protect your phone's glass screen from cracking, unlike plastic protectors which really only provide scratch protection.

Got this for my mom, and she likes it a lot. She wanted a case that would protect her phone while it's in her purse, and this fits the bill perfectly. Clasp is magnetic and keeps the case firmly closed. The TPU wrap around case fits perfectly and the cut outs are spot on. About the only thing I can say is the molding isn't perfectly smooth around the top part near the screen, it feels a little "rough" but for twelve bucks (as of this writing) I can't knock off a star. Made in Korea.

I found this stuff to work pretty well. My car doesn't have too much leather, but after using it on the steering wheel and shift knob I was disgusted at the amount of filth that it took off. I used it on my leather couches also and it did a good job cleaning and conditioning them too. It's as easy as spraying some on the microfiber cloth, rubbing the leather, then buffing it off with a clean microfiber. I sprayed some directly on the leather in the more soiled areas. If your car is all leather you'll probably go through a third to half a bottle of this in one use, so it probably won't last that long. I actually liked the scent of it, smells somewhat like leather itself.

This is a really nice wax that gives a deep gloss. Very slick surface once buffed off. Also, buffing it off is not that difficult at all which is always a plus. The scent is pleasent as well. Most of these waxes I've used, carnauba based, and in this price range last me about 3-4 months in southern CA. I would have given it five stars but I really don't like the small container. It makes getting the wax on the applicator a pain. The Griot's Garage wax is in a large tin and there's no problem getting the wax on the applicator. This may seem like a small thing but it really makes using the wax a hassle.
Good case that provides decent protection. Not as good as my Spigeon "tough armor" case but this one is less bulky and half the price. Got this for my wife, she likes it.

No regrets with this purchase, especially at the low price I was able to pay. Made in USA, C-L is a recognized name in metal working. The description is either wrong or I got lucky because the drill I received actually has a 135* split point tip not a 118* conventional point tip. Just remember to run your drill press at the slowest speed it'll go down to and use cutting fluid or oil.

I think wireless charging will be more and more common, I wouldn't be surprised if phones come with wireless chargers from the OEM within the next couple of years and cases become more common for them.This charger is great in that works and works well for what it does. It doesn't come with a plug, you supply that but it does come with a USB cable. The stand itself is sleek and nice looking. When the special included case is on the phone the magnet on it securely holds the phone. Charging takes as long but not longer than plugging in the phone, at least in my observation. As far as the technology and how well this works, that's all good. So why only four stars?The case is the issue here. The included case must be used so the phone can charge on the stand. The problem is that the case doesn't offer much protection for the phone, and what protection it does offer is not so great. There are a lot of notches and cut outs instead of more precise cuts and molding. Also, the sides of the phone are barely covered by the case. However, the greatest problem is that the bottom portion adds quite a lot of extra length to the phone. It makes the phone with the case really, just...bulky. It's impractical to change cases every time you want to wirelessly charge your phone, if you're going to do that then might as well plug it in. Also, for a day to day case this one is sorely lacking in protection.I gave this four stars essentially because of the case. everything else about this product is good but the case really needs some refinement and R&D. Once improved, or more aftermarket cases come out that are wireless charging capable I think this would be a great product.

This is a great, low cost scale that looks really nice and would blend in with pretty much any decor. Set up is easy, pull the plastic tab from the battery compartment (I had to unscrew the cover, no bid deal) and put your foot on it and press with force until you see units. It's ready to go and weigh you. If the scale moves or is bumped, it needs to be initialized in the same way, press with some force and wait for units.As far as the calories and BMI calculations, I tried it but found the feature kind of pointless. I mean, there's a lot more to calorie intake than just maintaining your weight. There are  A LOT of variables. If you're an athlete you may need 4,000 calories a day or more. If you're a sedentary person who doesn't exercise you may need less than what the scale tells you. BMI isn't a foolproof indicator of healthy weight either necessarily.Setting up that feature isn't hard, and there's an instruction manual that explains it. Personally, I use the scale as just a scale and found it compared to my other scale within half a pound (or less since my other scale goes in half pound increments). I think for the thirty bucks this is a nice looking, accurate, and good scale.

These self fusing tapes are a lifesaver. Couldn't be easier to use and they handle a wide range of emergency uses. I keep a roll in my car and one at home. They're all basically the same stuff, some maybe better than others but I've had good success with this product. Cheap enough that everyone should have a roll or two handy.

This is one of those things that's better to purchase locally because shipping can and will damage it. Mine arrived broken in half, and I didn't want to hassle with a return/exchange so I used some epoxy and glued it back together. It worked out fine for my small job, and the thing itself worked well. The price has nearly doubled since I bought it a week ago, and it's no longer such a good value. For the price I got it for it and the job it did this was great, especially the larger size of this brick. Again, good product at a great price (for what I paid at the time), but probably better to buy locally.

I've had good experience with Lenmar products in the past and was happy to see this available. It's got 150mAh more capacity than the OEM battery and for thirty bucks it's a heck of a deal. External battery packs are all the rage now, but if your OEM battery dies this is a great replacement or even good for a spare while traveling. Great product at a great price. I will update this review if the battery pack gives me any problems within the next six months.

Long dark winter days.  Cabin fever.  Snowed in.  No activity.  Kids climbing the walls.  What to do...We're all heading into the basement where we have collected fun games over the years, like an air hockey table, Foosball, electronic darts, an electronic basketball hoop....and now our new addition, the light-up lawn darts game.  It is a blast in the basement (although we keep a little bit of lighting on).  This is so much fun, and really adds a unique game to break up our wintertime boredom.Here are a few tips that may help you.1)  We put a few streaks of glow-in-the-dark paint on the rings, to brighten them up a bit, and it worked wonderfully. We got this super bright green glow in the dark paint for about $10 here on Amazon and it worked great:  Ultra Green V10 Glow in the Dark Paint 1/2Oz2)  Don't give a second thought to replacing the batteries.  It's easy.  I buy all my replacement button batteries from Amazon.  In fact, these lawn darts take the LR41 batteries, which you can get from Amazon for about $13-14 for 50 of them:  50 Pack Maxell LR41 AG3 192 button cell battery "NEW HOLOGRAM PACKAGE " or if you prefer to buy 10 of them for about $6, you can get these:  Maxell Watch Battery Button Cell LR41 AG3 192 Pack of 10 Batteries.3) If you need replacement parts, which is honestly unlikely, as these things are sturdy as heck.  And if you need information on replacement parts, you can email:  replacementparts@franklinsports.com  or you can call 1-781-341-5178.Thanks for reading my review.  I sure hope it helped you.

Hospital days.  Long days keeping track of a million things in between a bunch of medical appointments for family members.  No pockets or worse, shallow pockets that a phone easily slides out of.  Hanging onto a phone but needing both hands so you set the phone down for a second that turns into "where did I leave my phone?"Perfect solution?  Use this armband to hang onto your phone and keep it close the entire day.  Yes, it looks ridiculous as you wear it like a giant watch (pictures will be posted soon).  But who cares if it looks silly, as opposed to losing it or stressing out trying to keep track of your phone all day.  And actually, if you have a good sense of humor, like we do, it's a great conversation piece.It is comfortable, and unlike the athletes that did reviews, sweating isn't a problem when you keep your phone on your wrist like a giant watch.  It is SO PERFECT that I wish I'd thought of doing this a long time ago.  It fits wonderfully, is comfortable and not bothersome at all.  It is the perfect solution, and not just for long hospital days with the family.  It is great for those of us that have difficulty walking.  When you leave your phone in one room, and drag yourself to another room, then you realize you left your phone in the first room....well, it takes energy and increases your pain when you have to make an extra trip just to retrieve your phone.  Not to mention the whole "where did I leave it?" mini-game that you have to play in order to find it, which may or may not include calling your cell from a landline in order to locate it.I ended up getting these for my elderly mother, who keeps forgetting where she set her phone down, as well as a couple other family members that have similar problems keeping track of their phones.  We all have the Samsung Galaxy S5 phone, and it's a perfect fit.Thanks for reading my review. I sure hope it helped you in some way.

My mom collects angels, and my grandma (her mom) collected bells.  Since my grandma passed on, my mom has missed her terribly.  When I saw this beautiful Lenox figurine that is both an angel and a bell, I thought it would be the perfect gift for my mom, in honor of both of them.  I plan on giving it to her before the holidays, though, so she can enjoy it longer.  I get tears in my eyes every time I think of how touched she'll be with this lovely remembrance of her mother, my dear grandma.To make it an even more perfect gift, it's a Lenox.  The Lenox brand has always meant high quality, beautiful keepsakes.  Both my mom and my grandma have always loved Lenox keepsakes. One of the reasons we love the Lenox brand is that they have a way of making their keepsakes look delicate and fragile but in fact they are very solid and well-made, and they definitely stand the test of time.  Lenox included a red ribbon that is meant to go through the angel's halo to hang it on a tree.  If you don't have pets or kids that might disturb the tree, then it would probably be safe to hang, and would look beautiful.  We tend to be more cautious about these things, though, and would prefer to display it on a shelf or in a curio cabinet.  It's up to you, but it is a nice option that Lenox included the high-quality red ribbon, just in case you choose to hang it on your tree.I want to emphasize that this beautiful angel bell is sturdier than it looks, and Lenox makes long-lasting, high-quality keepsakes that will definitely stand the test of time.  I'd like to thank you for reading my review, and I sure hope it helps you make your decision.

FINALLY, a headset that is super-comfortable and works great!  I have tried several different headsets, and I'll admit I tried the cheapo way first, at the recommendation of fellow gamers.  I bought a $12 headset, highly recommended, and the microphone was spotty and then just died.  Bought a second set, different brand, for $15, and they died 40 days into it  (Amazon and the third party sellers usually have a 30-day return, and my karma usually means that the item will die after 31+ days).After asking around some more, and reading reviews, we finally decided to give these Turtle Beach ones a try, and WOW!  We are thrilled with them.  The sound quality on our end is superb, and everyone says they hear us perfectly.  We love having a switch for the volume and a mute button, on a solid little rectangular panel along the cord.In addition, the different colors are a nice feature, especially since we now have three headsets in the house because we liked them so much!  Having the different colors means no fighting over which headset belongs to which kid.  That brings me to another point:  these are really solid and sturdy, and have held up wonderfully with kid-use and gaming.Highly highly highly recommend this Turtle Beach headset.  Goodness, talk about burying the lead.  I should have started with the fact that these are made by the well-known and reliable Turtle Beach brand.  Yes, I paid a bit more than I did for the $12 random ones that pooped out on us after a month, but it is well worth the extra money to know that you have a quality headset backed by Turtle Beach, a well-known company with high quality products.  Thank you for reading this review.  I sure hope it helps you make your purchase.

I hate writing negative reviews, but there is no way around it with this particular item.  I have knee troubles which make it hard to get up from a seated position, so I use a raised toilet seat.  In addition, my mother had hip surgery recently, and is with me a lot, so we both have experience with this seat.First off, the arm rests are ridiculously short.  Yes, they are there for you to grab when you are getting up, but they are also there to provide a more comfortable seated experience, AND to keep those with balance issues from tipping over.  I have no idea why the manufacturers would put the arm rests so low.  Even in using them to hang onto and lift yourself up, it is awkward having to reach down so low to use them to get up.  We had a super-comfortable raised toilet seat already on the toilet, but after several years, even with regular cleanings, it was just time for a new one.  This Drive Medical one looked very similar, so we ordered it and installed it.  Since this wasn't our first seat of this type, we can speak from experience that this is one of the most UNcomfortable seats ever.It's not just the super-low arm rests that make this seat uncomfortable, but the seat itself is not contoured as comfortably as it should be.  I'm going to get some pictures to add to this review when I can, but the back part of it is very narrow, and that makes it painful (yes, painful) to sit on.  The one we previously used was contoured so well in the right spots that it was still comfortable to sit on.  This Drive Medical seat, however, is not contoured enough, and it feels incredibly hard and painful to sit on.Here's the embarrassing part (what has my life become that what I'm about to tell you is even more embarrassing than describing what a disappointment our new raised toilet seat has been!).  I skipped the most important step of choosing my purchase and didn't read the reviews of this before I ordered it.  Can you believe that?  I review my purchases for Amazon because I try to share my buying experiences in the hopes it'll help someone else make more informed choices.  And in this case, I totally dropped the ball and didn't check out the reviews.  So it's my own fault that I'm stuck with a super-uncomfortable seat, until I can find one that I like better, or figure out how to get a duplicate of the one we just got rid of.  So color me embarrassed for making a bad purchasing decision by skipping the reviews, but I sure hope that THIS review will help someone to make a good decision and skip this particular seat.  I sure wish I had.

Star Wars: Battlefront - Deluxe Edition - PlayStation 4 was at the top of my son's Christmas list, so this adorable Star Wars ornament will go perfectly with it.  He was lucky enough to play the beta of the video game, so we know already he'll love it.Now, about the ornament.  Obviously, it's always wonderful to have the quality that goes along with the Hallmark brand.  It is well-made and sturdy enough to survive the holidays, while lovely to look at and a perfect rendition of our favorite Star Wars characters.Definitely recommend it for your favorite Star Wars fan!  Thanks for reading my review, and I hope it helps you.

This multi-cooker has changed my life.  As much as I love to cook, and I love to make a variety of delicious meals for my family and friends, it has become a big ordeal with lots of pots and pans and a lot of prep and clean-up.  I just don't have the time or energy for that anymore, and when I had the chance to get a Phillips Multi-Cooker, I jumped on it.  I am absolutely thrilled with it.  One thing that I absolutely MUST have when it comes to a kitchen item is that it has to be easy to clean, and 99% of the time, needs to be dishwasher-safe, or I just really don't want it.  The cooking pan inside it is removable and dishwasher-safe.You can read the technical details about this above in the description, but let me just tell you that there is not much you'd want to do to prepare a dish that this crafty little cooker can't do.  One drawback for some people might be the size.  It's not huge, but I've cooked quite a lot of food in it.The instruction booklet and the recipe booklet are both user-friendly, and I highly recommend searching online for more multi-cooker recipes.  From the included book, you HAVE to make the Chocolate Cake (YES, it makes cakes!!).  I've made everything from stews to chicken teriyaki to amazing rice dishes, and more.If you have gotten bored with what you usually cook, try the Phillips Multi-Cooker.If your have downsized kitchen space and need an appliance with a lot of bang for the buck, get the Phillips Multi-Cooker.If you have physical/medical limitations and you can't zip around the kitchen like you used to, try the Phillips Multi-Cooker.I could go on and on, but let me just say again that this has changed my life, and I'm thrilled with it.  I have experimented with it for awhile now, and waited to do my review when I had a substantial amount of experience with it.I highly recommend this incredible sous chef appliance, and I hope you enjoy it as much as we have.  Thank you for reading my review.

These worked just as well as the more-famous Depend brand, but were a more economical purchase.  According to my aunt and mother who both tested these for me, they did the job just as well as the bigger brands, and in some ways were actually more comfortable.  These were more cottony-feeling instead of plastic-y feeling and that made a huge difference in the comfort level.  They both mentioned that these Always brand underwear seemed cooler and smoother on the skin, which were both huge benefits.  Trying these actually converted both of them over from the Depend brand to Always, because of the comfort level.  Also, they held up better at the elastic around the legs and kept the rest of them dry.  Hope this helps someone.

OK, we had a problem in our house that we didn't think there was a solution for, so we just accepted it.  This handy little device actually solves that problem, even though I'm embarrassed to admit that when I ordered it I actually thought it did something else entirely!  So here's the scoop.I love to listen to the audio of the TV shows being watched by the rest of the family, while I'm fixing dinner or taking care of other things in the house.  It's relaxing for me.  Sometimes music does that for me, but more frequently my mind needs other things to think about, and TV or movie dialogue does it.  By hooking this gadget to the TV or stereo speakers, then pairing it with my smartphone, I can carry my phone around the house with me while listening to whatever is on TV, or I can put some of my own shows on to listen to.  This really makes time move faster for me, and I love it.  I have good reception throughout the house, which was a nice surprise, and with smartphone speakers being what they are these days, I'm thrilled with the sound as well.Very pleased with this, and I sure hope I've helped someone with this review.

As far as shaving, this shaver gets 5 stars.  It's smooth, the smoothest shave ever.  But the inconvenience and lack of reliability for the cleaning system forces me to go with 4 stars, along with the bulkiness of the charging base.  It's like real estate:  location, location, location.  Whether it's in the bathroom, where counter space is limited, or in the suitcase, where it's also limited, this just doesn't work out to as much of a convenience as we expected.But that can still be worth dealing with if you like the smooth shave so much.  There's one big caveat with that, however.  If you have sensitive skin like he does, then this may not be the shaver for you.  When the razor pulls up the hair to cut it, you kind of have to push it a little harder onto the skin.  So  if you have sensitive skin, or any bumps, etc., on your face, then you'll have to deal with that as well.I definitely am not trying to talk you out of ordering it.  It's a great razor.  If space isn't a problem for you at home or on the road, then that's a non-issue.  If you don't have sensitive skin, then that's a non-issue, too.  Without those two issues, I would highly highly recommend getting it.  If you have to deal with either of those factors, then you'll have to make your own judgment.Sure hope this review helps someone decide.

Our whole family wears these as sleep shirts.  They are super comfortable and you can't beat the price.  They last forever, and it doesn't matter how many wash cycles we've put them through, they don't get thin or worn out.  They still look fine, and more importantly, they feel great.As far as size, of course these definitely shrink some when you wash them, between the hot water during washing and the heat of the dryer, but we all know that is common for cotton.  We like our sleep clothes loose and comfy, so we buy big enough sizes that even after shrinking some they are still bigger and feel great.We may be wearing Grandpa's undershirts, but we are sleeping like babies!

I've tried a lot of the toilet "drops" that you put in the tank, and I'm most satisfied with these Clorox ones.  I like that they have the combo of the Clorox level of cleaning plus the blue factor that...well, it just makes it look cleaner in the toilet bowl.  Of course, I love the Clorox toilet bowl cleaner  Clorox Toilet Bowl Cleaner With Bleach Rain Clean Scent Bottle 24 Oz, 2-Pack  that you squirt in the bowl and clean with a brush.  But you don't have to do that nearly as often if you keep these little tablets in the tank.  And I just love minimizing the actual toilet-scrubbing, who doesn't?  Highly recommend.

We have been Avery product users for years, and like many other people, know we can count on Avery to bring us high-quality products that last a long time.  These Avery Labels are no exception.  We had a laminating machine that just died on us recently, and we really didn't want to replace it because our need for laminated items wasn't that high.  At the same time, we weren't happy with the unprofessional look of printed labels with tape over them.  So what to do?  These Avery Self-Laminating labels are the perfect solution.  We can still have the official look of a nice printed label, with the sealed-in look from the laminated covering.Very pleased with the look and use of these, and highly recommend them.

I put this on my kitchen floor right away.  I had separately ordered one for my mother who was recovering from a broken hip, surgery, and lots of physical rehab.  So we tested ours out at the same time.  There are two cautions to note, first.  One thing that's really important to know is that if you "shuffle" when you walk, maybe because you can't lift your feet up with each step, then be careful of tripping when you go to step onto this pad.  It has really nice, gently-angled edges, so that it's not a big step up or step down, but for someone who shuffles, it can still trip you up.  The second caution is that the gently-angled edges are kind of slippery, so in bare feet or socks, you may slip on it easily.  With the traction of shoes, that would be no problem.  So with those two cautions out of the way, let's get on to the positives.My mother and I, as well as other family members, definitely felt that this mat does indeed take pressure off your feet and back when you have to be standing, and does as promised as far as lessening fatigue while standing.  You can't underestimate how much this helps those of us with any kind of foot, leg, or back pain.  It's not a magic carpet, so to speak, and it won't cure all that ails you, but it definitely can lessen the pressure and pain that you may be dealing with.  Those of us without ailments already, with healthy backs and legs, found it to be more comfortable and less tiring than the plain hard floor.  It feels like memory foam might be inside it, that's the closest way to describe it.So overall it is a great help to those in pain and those not in pain, easing foot, leg, and back fatigue.  Just be careful stepping on and off of it, as the edges are so smooth as to be slippery.  My son took care of that by putting a border of duct tape on the slippery part so we wouldn't slide off and fall.  OK, so that's a little redneck of us, but that's just how we roll sometimes...

One of my earliest memories is my brother and I getting in trouble for racing our Hot Wheels cars on the top of my parents beautiful wooden stereo cabinet.  Not only was I lucky to be the little sister of a big Hot Wheels fan, but I was allowed to have my own little collection of Hot Wheels cars, separate from my brother's collection.So when I say that I love Hot Wheels, it goes way back to my own childhood, and continues to playing Hot Wheels with my son and seeing him enjoy his own collection.  Collections now though, include not just the cars but a dizzying array of choices in tracks, themed sets,and even video games (which are awesome by the way.)We have quite a few sets of the Hot Wheels Trick Tracks and it is a lot of fun to connect them together and make really long tracks that take up a whole room. One of the biggest advantages of playing just about anything Hot Wheels is the longevity of it.  The Hot Wheels name means you can continue to play with the vehicles, sets, tracks, etc., indefinitely.  Hot Wheels just doesn't make things that you're going to get bored with.Until they made this particular set. Don't get me wrong, it is a really fun track for a little while. First  you have to get over the fact that it needs 4 D batteries, and you set it up, which by the way is pretty easy.  It is a lot of fun seeing how fast the cars zip around the track, and we laughed in surprise at the collisions.NOTE:  It may sound overprotective, but we highly recommend safety glasses while your kids play with this. The cars are going at a surprising rate of speed, so often the collisions happen and the cars are flying off the tracks and into the air.  Since your children are sitting close to the set in order to keep adding cars to it, the chances of one of the cars hitting them in the face, especially the eyes, are pretty high.  In fact that happened at our house.  Once one of the cars flew off the track and cracked one of his friends in the cheek. Another time the car hit my son's eyebrow, dangerously close to hitting him right in the eye. After that we decided they should wear their safety glasses when they play with it.Beyond the safety issue, I hate to say it, but this Hot Wheels set just got boring. How many times can you watch the cars going around and crash?  It was really fun for several different days of gameplay, but after that it got relegated to what we call "going on vacation" in our house, which is  in the basement.  We repurposed the D batteries for one of his nerf machine guns and sent this track on vacation. we rotate the toys out in this way, but there wasn't ever any interest in bringing that one back up. I hate to give a Hot Wheels toy anything less than 5 stars, but between the safety issue and the boredom factor, I can't really go more than 3.

Arthritis sufferers have known for a long time the benefits of tart cherries or tart cherry juice in easing some of the joint pain.  However it can be really challenging to get enough of the cherries or juice in you daily to keep consistent benefits coming your way.  The tart cherry capsules definitely solve that problem.  Of course the best benefit comes from the original source, so we try to get the real cherries or juice (even dried cherries work) as much and as often as possible. But in those times when we don't have cherries or juice around, these are a welcome substitute. There are several of us in the family with arthritic problems, and we all use these tart cherry supplements because we have found them to be extremely helpful.Nature's Bounty is a brand we have used for years and have found them to be high quality at a reasonable price, so this particular brand of the tart cherry capsules  are the perfect choice.

These bladder control pads are good for inside your underwear if you have a light to moderate situation going on.  Just don't mistake them for the kind of pads (commonly referred to as booster pads) that can go inside adult diapers to handle higher volume.  That's not what these are meant for.  The difference is the backing of the pad. On these the backing is the kind that seals out liquid from going through, so that if you wear them inside your underwear,  it won't leak through your underwear.  A booster pad, however, does not have that plastic type backing. That allows the liquid to first be absorbed by the booster pad and then go through that to be absorbed by the diaper.I hope that explaining the difference will help you to select the right product. If what you need is something that goes inside your underwear to catch a light to moderate leak, then this is your solution at a really affordable price.

UPDATE on 8/17/15:  I just had to update this to let you know that these glasses are every bit as sturdy and good as the ones you can buy for much more at, well, just about anywhere!  They feel great on, the arms open and close smoothly, the hinges are sturdy and these glasses are so comfortable that I forget I'm wearing them.  And this is from someone who has gone through many, many "cheater" glasses from stores that either end up breaking or I lose them.Again, I want to emphasize that for this price, you can put them in each room you use your glasses in and not have to worry about losing them.  I keep a pair in the kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, and living room.  Oh, and in my purse.  No more wandering around the house, " have you seen my glasses, I set them down somewhere..."ORIGINAL REVIEW  (still accurate)I wear the "cheater" glasses that are basically magnifying, but I'm constantly losing them.  I can't stand wearing a strap around my neck, and if I don't have a pocket, I'm always setting the glasses down in whatever room I'm in.  Then I have to go looking for them.  I hate shelling out $12-15 for a pair of glasses.  I found these cute little designer type glasses, and I love them!  They ended up being a much better bargain than any that I buy in the big box stores.  This way I can put them in separate rooms, which alleviates the need to keep track of them at all.  I can do this because they are super affordable, and can I say again that they are ADORABLE?!  I was pleasantly surprised to see the quality, which is great.  They have cute designs (you don't get to pick the colors, you just take your chances).  All you have to do is tell them the strength you need, and you're all set.  I have no idea how long they'll last, but I love the price, style, colors, and the fit.  Highly recommend.

What else would you expect from Antec, a company that has been around a long time and is known for quality electronics.  This little bluetooth speaker has a lot of bang for the buck!  We've tried various other portable speakers, but this one is fantastic and a must-have for us.  It sets up in seconds, and the sound quality is excellent.  We are very pleased with it and highly recommend it.

I've tried a lot of different trimmers, by different makers and in different price ranges.  Despite the name, "Mangroomers," I am really happy with this trimmer.  You can use it both wet and dry.  The different sized attachments are very handy. I found that it works really well, and is easy to use.  I've used it for 2 months with no problems,  but I usually like to update my reviews after using the product longer, so I'll be back with an update in a few more months.

While I know that this is intended as a beard trimmer, I've been using it for some nice neat trim work when I cut the fella's hair.  Having the different length attachments really helps with getting the back, around the ears, and the ever-important sides, all neat and looking good.Since it is smaller than the hair trimmer I use for the bulk of the haircut, it is much easier to handle and actually does much more precision work.The only complaint is that it uses a battery, which on the plus side means no cord, but I really would rather have a rechargeable one instead.But overall, this is a great value, and works really well.  We have quite a few Philips Norelco products already (like the nose trimmer), so picking this brand was a no-brainer  They've always been reliable with good warranties and long-lasting quality products.

Absolutely LOVE these huge Ziploc bags!!  So great to store stuff in or carry in, and you can easily see what you have.  So convenient, I wish I'd found them much sooner.  I started out with the XL ones, but have already ordered the Large ones as well.  Finally a viewable place for my son to store his Skylanders (so much easier to find the one he needs and get it out of the bag, instead of rummaging through a bag you can't see through!  I use another one for backup supplies from the medicine cabinet, like extra band-aids, etc.I took some over to my mother's house and transferred some of her things into these jumbo Ziplocs.  It makes it much easier for her to find things.  Then she and I together took some to the nursing home to see my aunt, and she was just as tickled as we were to start using them.  We are so happy to find these, they are already making our lives much easier.

We are happy with this attic fan, but boy, I sure didn't realize how much would be involved in installing it.  I kinda thought that following the instructions and going step by step would get us through it, but we ended up calling my dad, who is handy with these kinds of things and was an electrician at some point in his life.  If you don't have someone like that around to help, and you can't order one on Amazon (yet!), then I would definitely get some quotes on getting it installed, and here's why:  ELECTRICITY, which is absolutely dangerous in inexperienced hands, and a good second reason:  WATER, if you don't install shutters or a louvre or something to protect the fan from the rain.  Since electricity and water are obviously not good together, and it's important to hardwire this fan correctly, my advice is that it may not be the ideal home project to attempt on your own, and you're better off having someone qualified to install it.  All that being said, it's a really great fan and we noticed a difference pretty quickly.  We are using the temperature feature, but decided to pass on the humidity feature since we are in a very rainy area.  High humidity on a sunny day would be a great time to have the fan on, but since humidity includes rain, I don't want to have it run unnecessarily.  The metal is thicker than we expected, and very sturdy. We've noticed a difference already in how much less the air conditioning runs.  Other than being overwhelmed by the installation (to be fair, that's completely because of our own inexperience), we are very pleased with our choice.

WOW!  This is the first time I've been excited about a laundry soap!  That either says something about my life or the laundry soap, or maybe both.We've been using the "free" version of All for years, and it's been "OK," but not spectacular.  After the laundry is done, there's no point in taking a whiff of the clean clothes like we used to do, because there is really no smell.  But with this Babyganics laundry soap, it not only does a fantastic job cleaning but has a very faint, pleasant fragrance, which is natural because it's definitely "fragrance free!"We also were thrilled that since it's so concentrated, we got a lot of bang for our buck.  What more could we ask for?  We are pretty much brand-loyal, but I have to say it took about 10 seconds to decide to break things off with All and stay with Babyganics.  We're very pleased with it, as it does a great job cleaning our clothes, smells pleasant, and is a good value.

I'll be honest.  Yuck.  These are tough for us to get down, because the taste is pretty bad.  But if you look at what's included in these gummies, you'll be amazed at how much nutrition they pack into them.  That makes it worth it, money-wise, and health-wise, to tough it out and get them down.  I guess it's because we are used to the Lil Critters line of gummy vitamins, which do include sugar and some of which are quite tasty.  But honestly, how can you get a vitamin that includes vitamins, minerals, fiber, omegas, and D3?  And while not cheap, it's certainly a lot of bang for your buck and very very well worth it because of the goodness you're getting.We came up with a compromise so we can get them down.  We start with the Lil Critters Immune C with Echinacea, and the Lil Critters Calcium, chew them halfway and then put the SmartyPants gummies in our mouths.  That way they mix with the sweeter ones and the kids can tolerate them.We just can't believe how much nutrition they packed into these!  Worth every penny and we are now regular customers.

I was shocked to find this tea tree product because I've used tea tree oil for years on painful joints, with great results.  I'm very convinced of the benefits of tea tree oil as far as pain relief, but I had no idea that it was also used as an air "purifier."  It makes sense because it is an anti-fungal and antibacterial, but I was really surprised and happy to see this product available.  I have used it for about a month now, and am very pleased with the results.  My son and I have breathing difficulties, and it is allergy season in the Midwest, so it's been the perfect time to try to make a difference in the indoor air.  I have to say that we have several air purifiers running throughout the house, so I can't give this jar of Safe T Air all the credit.  But....I put a jar of it in each bedroom, and once we got used to the strong smell (had to put it a bit away from the bed.  Even though we are used to tea tree oil's smell, this is very very strong when you first open it and can knock you over if you breathe it too close.)  Anyways, it seemed to make a difference, especially on rainy days, as far as any kind of stale, damp air inside.  I've ordered another one to use in the vehicles.  I'm going to divide it up into smaller jars for that, and I'd like to put a couple in the basement, especially by the sump pump.Overall I'm very pleased with the results.  It's not a miracle, but it did make a practical difference in the quality of our indoor air and our resulting ease of breathing, so we are sold on it.  Hope this review helps someone.

For the last couple years, I have been on a quest to find the right vacuum cleaner for our home. I thought I had found it with a cordless vacuum that I've had for about 6 months now. Unfortunately, when using the attachments, the hose was way too short. So in trying to use the attachments,  you end up pulling the vacuum cleaner over.That was my most recent experience, so I was very very excited to have the opportunity to test and review this Miele vacuum.First of all, I was really relieved that it was packaged well, but only because I didn't need a locksmith, a musclehead, and a couple of hours to get it out of the box. It was packed very securely, but I was still able to unbox it with reasonable time and effort.I would best describe this vacuum as having the old school features of the vacuums my mother used, but updated and upgraded with current technology.  I found it to be a great marriage of the two, and as consumers we definitely benefit.I know some people complained that it was heavy.  I am not very strong, but I had no trouble at all maneuvering it around.  In fact,  my mother and I both felt it moved very easily, almost like it was self-propelled.  We also loved how it swiveled itself in any direction with snakelike movements.  It automatically adjusted height based on the floor, which was another great feature.  The light is nice and bright, easily illuminating under beds and in shadowy corners.One of the problems I've run into with other vacuums is where to put the attachments.  I am thrilled that the Miele designed the back to hold all 3 attachments.  Having them onboard makes using the dusting brush, upholstery tool or crevice nozzle very easy and convenient.
