What gave me an immediate sense of how the Bronx came burning down was Jerome Charyn's reference to a pack of wild dogs that roamed through Crotona Park in the aftermath of the greatest upheaval to ever hit the borough. There's even a rumor that they mauled to death a small child. Later, a prominent gang adopted that vicious canine emblem to grace its bags of heroin. And that in a nutshell sums up the disheartening tone of BITTER BRONX, it's fall into destruction and chaos that no one could stop. All that's left for Charyn to do is lament what once was of this "brick wilderness."And there's no telling symbol than the most recognizable fixture of the Bronx—Yankee Stadium. Or should I say, the NEW Yankee Stadium, the mecca by which all success is measured. In "Major Leaguer," the leader of the Crotona Dogs invites superintendent Will Johnson to join him for a game in his box seats. The gangbanger remembers his Papi talking about watching Will play center field for the Yankees, and how proud he was of Will's glorious achievement as a native of the Bronx. But Will's not so proud. He only played one game as a Yankee, and he didn't even get a hit. The nostalgia factor rings false for Will. He doesn't believe himself to be worthy of any accolades, and he's not going to kowtow to the Crotona Dogs. He has too much pride for that.Charyn, a native of the Bronx himself, nails the vibe of the place. You can feel the monotonous movement of the subway in, "I had to ride the local in and out of the Bronx. Each stop was a kind of purgatory. Freeman Street. Simpson Street. Intervale Avenue…" You can feel the rot and ruin in, "The Art Deco palaces along the Grand Concourse have been refurbished, but the blight will never really go away." You can feel the eminent sense of danger in, "Paradise Road had sharpshooters reigning from the roofs. The drug lords had put them there. But after a while the sharpshooters were bored to death and would pick off children and old men."It's no wonder Charyn compares the broken landscape of the Bronx to bombed-out Belfast, and why he's reluctant to revisit his memories in print, no doubt because they clash so painfully with what he finds there today. It's heartbreaking to see one's home turned into something unrecognizable. It's sad that a fresh wind of change has never come to the Bronx, especially when New York is a city that's ever changing, dashing dreams, while raising others up.But one thing is certain. Despite its many flaws, the Bronx did one thing right. It gave birth to a literary talent like Jerome Charyn.

I started a new health kick and began eating and drinking natural, organic and chemical-free items. I wanted to start making my own healthy beverages and juices so I needed to purchase a strainer. I purchased this nut milk bag made out of hemp as a great alternative from other strainers. I found that this bag is strong and resistant, mold-free, anti-microbial and does not alter the natural taste of my drinks, which I found annoying with other strainers I have used in the past. It’s the perfect size to use for small and large batches. I found the seams are really strong on this bag. The curved design of the bag prevents things from getting stuck in the corners. And I love that this bag is easy to clean and can be used over and over again many times over. It will last a long time and you can get some great use out of this bag.

This short story of Virginia and Brad's romance is certainly delightful, as the book's title eludes. As any parent can relate, you only want the best for child. Virginia's parents don't think Brad is the "best" for her, thus arises the main conflict of the book. Yet Virginia and Brad seem to fit together despite their different backgrounds. I like how the two overcome the objections of Virginia's parents, and the other characters that are introduced in the book. This story is quite enjoyable and entertaining. I found myself rooting for Virginia and Brad. I was also happy with how the story concluded.

There's something inherently sexy about staging a romance in a remote location. The brooding loner on the moors who ignites with a little firecracker from the city. A girl who wanders onto his sprawling property caught in a "fine driving rain that seeped into your bones." The environment on Black Mountain is lonely, silent, scary. It's certainly not what she's used to, until she sets eyes on him. Then the barren landscape starts to look pretty darn appealing.Even though her new boss is drool-worthy, Riley has a hard time adjusting to life in the Welsh countryside. As the new outdoor activities assistant, she has to muck out stalls and lead nature hikes, staggering over the beacons. For a Londoner who's afraid of heights, her new mountain home gives her more than a case of vertigo, especially when the only form of entertainment is having the old men down at the pub spike her drinks.Jago loves the wilderness. It's where he thrives. He knows every aspect about the rugged terrain surrounding his homestead. He offers horseback riding excursions. He guides canoe trips. He takes groups up the mountain on foot. And none of that ever scares him, until a spiky-haired spitfire comes to live under his roof.But Riley adjusts, making friends with Jago's untamable stallion, Farley. She has a knack with animals, slipping into a groove as she finds her way in this strange environment. Jago tries to help her, but usually only after she's already gotten in trouble. He treats her bleeding, blistered feet after a torturous trail walk. He looks after her when she's thrown from a horse. He makes sure his cook, Emily, feeds her ravenous appetite. But he always pulls back, when it comes to giving her more of himself.Riley does everything she can to draw him out. She swims in his pool in her underwear. She drapes her bra across Farley's rump. She flirts with other men to make him jealous. But it's not until they spend some alone time together as a couple, that things start to heat up. They find out more about each other and what makes them tick. Nature brings them together, softening his edges and calming her nerves.But ultimately, working as a team is what does it. They face everything from snake bites to sheep dips and come out stronger on the other side. He gets her to love nature, and she gets him to love life. Like a sunny day ending in a moonlit night, they learn how to compliment each other while learning to bring out the best in one another. A true romance, indeed.

I needed to purchase this book so I could pass the certification exam to be a SAP certified associate. Simply stated, this is a “must-have” resource for anyone who is pursuing this type of certification.Written by experienced industry professionals who specialize in helping students enter the HANA consulting market, this book provides approximately 200 multiple-choice questions similar to those found on the actual exam. But rather than just providing the correct answers, the authors provide the reasons for correct (and incorrect) answers. This unique approach encourages the students to learn the concepts that will be addressed in the real test. The screen shots and examples are also very helpful.Candidates will also find that the book covers some of the toughest topics on the real-life test, including security authorization, data modeling and data provisioning. Other topics include reporting and SQL scripts.

I just started using this product, at the recommendation of my acupuncturist and so far I've seen some good results. I just mix 1/4 teaspoon into whatever I am drinking, usually water, and it goes down the hatch pretty smoothly. I've noticed improvement in my bowel movement because other products have caused stomach issues for me. The BulkSupplement products are fairly priced and are of high quality. I will be trying other supplements from them.

There are a lot of things going on in this mystery.Some definitively aid the plot while others turn out to be quite head-scratching. The plus side is that Sharon St. George offers up several quirky elements that really set her mystery novel apart.  For starters, her heroine, Aimee Machado, lives next to a field full of llamas. So even though she takes on the dangerous work of investigating a murder in her spare time, she has no need for an alarm system. Why? Because llamas let out a ferocious bleat whenever they sense a predator nearby.Another factor is the zany pack of suspects that fall under Aimee's radar. The biggest shocker is the cross dresser who's later revealed to be the wife of a prominent community figure. St. George even has Aimee go on a date with her, thinking she's a man, before learning her true gender. Yikes!Things get even more peculiar when Aimee's focus shifts to the dodgy couple, Mr. and Mrs. Underhill, who happen to be running a cryogenics non-profit organization called Everlasting Pets. This shady endeavor operates under the guise of one day being able to clone the family dog, cat, llama, whatever. These two turn out to be even more bizarre when they elude to the numerous three-way sex romps they used to have with the murder victim, even soliciting Aimee to take her place and become their new partner.But the novel isn't all about shock value.  There's plenty of substance to the plot, particularly concerning the class structure of working in a hospital environment. There is a definite food chain mentality in the pecking order, especially when Dr. Beardsley, a noted plastic surgeon becomes the prime suspect in the killing of his trophy wife, Bonnie. She was beautiful and manipulative with a voracious sexual appetite that he just couldn't satisfy, but Quinn, the hospital administrator doesn't want to hear any of that. Oh no, his loyalty is to the hospital, and solidifying its reputation, and ultimately its profit margin. While the security attendant, Orrie Mercer, the person with the grave responsibility of guarding the outside entrance, is harshly reprimanded by Quinn for failing to use the designated restroom.As the new hospital librarian, Aimee must weave her way through this complicated maze of conflicting interests. She's a college-educated professional, but she's only allotted two elderly women as volunteers and a space deemed of little value in order to set up shop. Her situation gets even more dicey when Quinn asks her to spy on Dr. Beardsley for him. Aimee quickly becomes disgruntled working under these conditions, feeling like this isn't what she signed up for.Her frustration over her job begins to filter into her day-to-day life when her brother, Harry, comes under scrutiny for committing the murder. He was one of the last people to see Bonnie alive, and due to some bad blood he has with one of the cops on the small town police force, the circumstantial evidence against him begins to mount. Aimee refuses to let her brother go to jail for a crime he didn't commit, but Quinn makes it clear to her that he won't get involved in the way the investigation is heading, whether Aimee's brother is innocent or not. What's good for Dr. Beardsley is good for him and therefore good for the hospital.Aimee, at her wit's end, starts taking a lot of unnecessary risks in order to get the spotlight off her brother, and the consequences are dire. Her tires are slashed. Her apartment is vandalized. Her body is physically assaulted. Yet Aimee's a tough cookie with a heart of gold, and she won't give up no matter who tries to stop her. She's loyal, passionate and unwavering in her support of her brother, and as she starts to piece all of the clues together, she finds out more about the people she's working with than she ever bargained for.

In this second installment of the Lovely Obsession series, Melanie and JD return for another novel full of passion and drama. The glamorous lives of these two characters are unfolded throughout the book, complete with its many ups and downs and twists and turns. Melanie and JD have new obstacles to overcome---sexy exes to contend to, developing careers and family drama. Both are their own individuals, yet Melanie and JD complete each other as a couple. While the first book focused more on introducing these two characters, this second book is more about character development and the various complexities of a budding relationship. This is a great follow up to the first novel. I can't wait to read more from this author.

Melanie and JD are both two flawed characters who happen to find chemistry with each other, as well as companionship. The two develop a romance that is stemmed from realistic circumstances, not from overly dramatic and unrealistic overtures. Sometimes two flawed individuals can find love with each other, such as the case with these two. Coming Home is a great new contemporary romance novel that will warm your heart as both Melanie and JD struggle with their personal circumstances. I was drawn to the Manhattan setting and the way Melanie and JD's romance unfolded. I can't wait to read more from this author.

This first book in the Obsession series is off to a great start. JR King introduces two distinctive characters, Alexander Turner and Elena Anderson, who share a rather unique obsession for each other. I like how the author writes in the first person from both their perspectives. The transitions between the two characters are flawless. Alexander Turner is obviously powerful, ruthless and a complete bad boy. Elena is an innocent flower whose virginity is stolen from her at the age of sixteen. As the story progresses, Alexander's intensity and obsession with Elena grows. Women throw themselves at him, yet Alexander isn't interested in a sure thing; it's far too boring for him. The game of winning over and having Elena on his terms is what drives Alexander. The author does a great job of creating a passionate chemistry between Alexander and Elena. The love scenes were certainly erotic. I was surprised by the ending of this first book, but I'm so ready to read the next.  I can't wait to see what else JR King has up their sleeve.
I bought these for my husband and they fit and look great on him. I like the feel and quality of the material. He also says they are very comfortable to wear.

"The Blind King" introduces Prince Efren, the first born son of King Nilan. Efren was born blind, and because of this disability King Nilan declared that his second son, Gannon would be heir to his throne. King Nilan is embarrassed by Efren and wants nothing to do with his son so he decides to marry him off to Ryshel, the daughter of a Duke. Despite the arranged marriage, Efren and Ryshel do fall in love. In order to keep the peace between Ra’jhou and their neighboring enemy Na’zora, King Nilan marries off his only daughter, Aubriana, to the son of King Tyrol, Prince Ivor. But King Tyrol has other plans and soon war between the two kingdoms is inevitable.I love how the author, Lana Axe has created a well-written fantasy novel complete with detestable characters, interesting warfare, elves, dwarfs, sorcery, mages and more. I felt compassion for Aubriana's misery and Efren's struggle to rule in a kingdom where his blindness is ridiculed. Yet Efren's intelligence and foresight prevails and he quickly asks the elves for help.As a big fantasy buff, I really enjoyed "The Blind King." It contains a well-crafted story with a great conclusion and wonderfully developed characters. I can't wait to read more of Lana Axe's work.

Here is another exciting serial killer fiction book loaded with murder victims, assassinations and conspiracies, all elements that I've come to expect from James Kipling. The Paradise Hotel has a murderer walking its halls, and it's up to Detective Michael Young to figure out whodunnit. As he works his way through hookers, staff and guests, the body count continues to rise. This novel contains great characters and a plot full of twists that make this an exciting read. Kipling is turning out to be a crime writing machine!

The idea of "ethnic cleansing" is a very chilling topic, especially when incorporated in this novel. The premise of "Genetic Bullets" by JC Ryan is very original. The idea that the government has somehow formulated a genetically induced weapon to kill off a particular race is quite scary. I was happy that this novel lived up to my expectations. JC Ryan infuses several themes into his story, but everything meshes really well, especially since the book is so well-written. I enjoyed the progression and depth of the characters. I was completely engaged in the story, especially with the subplots and the different twists. This is a great follow up to JC Ryan's other two books in this series. I haven't read a good thriller in awhile, but I'm definitely recommending this one.

Developing social skills may not necessarily be easy for some people, but this book is a great resource for helping the introvert get out of their shell. As a former introvert myself, I realize that it takes time and practice to develop the right social skills to thrive in today's reality. I don't consider myself a full extrovert---in fact I'm somewhere in between an introvert and an extrovert---but I still found some useful information from Gabriel Angelo's book. The author nailed it on the head when he said that by nature humans are social creatures---we thrive on the social interactions we experience."Social Skills" takes on a modern day twist on how to develop social skills for any situation. I particularly liked the chapter on using social skills in the workplace---I found it relevant to my particular situation. I thought the chapter about developing social skills in children to teenagers was smart to include for all the parents who have socially awkward kids.Overall I thought this book was useful and a good resource for anyone wanting to brush up on their social skills or develop their skills better.

I live a busy life and I'm constantly trying to find ways to save time and be more efficient. I enjoyed reading this book on speed reading because it provided some really helpful techniques that will help me obtain the information I need, but in less time. For my job I am constantly sifting through documents and sometimes I don't have the time to read every single page in great detail. This book has helped me become a better speed reader. The exercises the author provides are also easy to follow. The book itself is a quick read, but the techniques are worth reading.

Edie Phillips is a licensed realtor, who for many years, has been helping people find their ideal property, whether they are first-time home owners or real estate investors. I picked up this book because my sister is currently in the process of buying her dream house and I wanted to give it to her as a gift. I've bought property before so I know how stressful the whole process can be. Edie Phillips' manual is very easy to follow---she breaks down the whole buying process in a step-by-step manner, from choosing a realtor, to putting in an offer and going through the close process. This is a great guide for anyone purchasing their first home and have no idea what to expect. There's some great information in this book that can only be provided by an expert in the field. With Edie's manual you'll no longer feel clueless.

"Alexander" is book two of the Alexander Trilogy but now Alec is all grown up and a renowned physicist. There's so many great elements to this new chapter of Alec's life---the story is just as imaginative and vivid as the first novel. This book is philosophical, intelligent, full of adventure and addicting. I enjoyed Alec's journey to Machu Picchu, a place I've always found fascinating.I love the fantasy genre so I think Law does a good job of continuing Alec's story while creating a whole new existence for his character. Law has written a wonderfully crafted story and I'm excited for the last book in the series.

I was completely drawn to L.C. Moore's story and fascinating characters. The book is set in different time periods, but it becomes obvious that the characters are all connected in some capacity. I was intrigued by Dan and Odette's love story---how a personal tragedy drove Dan to enlist as a soldier in World War II where he ultimately finds his soul mate, a beautiful French freedom fighter/soldier named Odette, who nurses him back to health after he is injured.There are a lot of elements to this book, which includes the idea of soul mates and the feeling of Deja vu. I love how the author manages to flawlessly transition between the characters and time periods. The themes of love and war are strongly infused into the story. "All I Longed For Long Ago Was You" is a well-written, beautifully crafted account of a love that stands the test of time, that true love will always be reunited. I was completely enthralled with the story that I finished Moore's book in one sitting. Highly recommended book!

My parents came to the U.S. as immigrants seeking a better life. And although I wasn't originally born in the U.S. I consider myself to be an American so I can identify with some of the characters in "Living La Vida Spanglish." Achieving the American dream is what so many people strive for. This particular book contains a collection of short stories of Latin immigrants and the struggles they must overcome in order to achieve their American dreams. The reality is that immigrants who come to the U.S. face various obstacles that most of us cannot even imagine. This book is a revelation of these struggles. Poignantly written, "Living La Vida Spanglish" is both heart wrenching and moving. Highly recommended!

Ever since his roles in "Lord of the Rings" and in the show "Lost", I've become a big fan of Dominic Monaghan. Monaghan takes on a different role in "The Millionaire Tour" as an unsympathetic criminal. He does a great job of playing a villain despite his previous "good guy" characters. This movie had me completely on the edge of my seat and had me totally engaged in the fast-paced story line. I kept wondering how the cab rider was going to get out of the dangerous situation he was in. The movie includes an original script and good acting from all the characters introduced. Overall an awesome movie that I would definitely recommend.

Written in a journal-like format, "I Found It!" is a powerful book built on strong Christian beliefs. It follows John Stazdas, a young poet living in Lithuania, struggling to find himself as a person while rediscovering his spiritual ideologies. There are also various depths to this book---it also focuses on philosophy, spirituality, morality and the overall human soul. The author writes freely and effortlessly, which makes this book an enjoyable read. Overall, a great contribution by Levas.

I love the fact that the author begins the story with Rebecca (Becky) in disguise, attempting to catch her cheating boyfriend on tape. Then her two best friends, Abigail and Julia are introduced as they watch the tape and confirm Becky's suspicions. Things get really interesting when Becky is then asked to seduce Isabella Coomb's husband, Charles. Becky finds herself in a moral dilemma when her initial beliefs are tested.I really enjoyed Becky's character---she is considered old fashioned but she's smart, beautiful, and driven. Her two best friends also add to some of the more comedic moments in the book. And if you love drama, there is definitely a bit of that. I love Zara Kingsley's writing style. It is energetic, sassy, and smart.

"Shiri" is a powerful and suspenseful historical fiction novel that commands your attention the moment you begin reading. Shiri is a young shepherd girl driven by desire to avenge her family's murder. With no other choice but to run, Shiri is constantly running...running for her life and salvation, running away from danger, running towards love. She finds she must quickly grow up and become a strong-willed woman in order to survive what's to come. Gripping and intense, this book has all the trimmings of a great novel. The characters are well-developed and I like the historical aspects that are woven into the story. Great job on Taylor's part in keeping the reader engaged.

I have actually dated a few people who in their own right were celebrities, a big time Hollywood producer and a few up and coming actors. My producer ex-boyfriend knew everyone and hobnobbed with famous musicians, celebrities and politicians. It was very overwhelming for me, but I saw how fame changed people. I like this book because it's very honest and doesn't hold back any punches. The author discusses several stages of celebrity status and reveals how this book can help "ground" you. Had there been a book like this when I was dating my ex, it might have saved our relationship. Great book overall and very easy to read!

I've been struggling with paying off my credit card debt and increasing my credit score. I eventually plan on buying a house so I need to get my finances in order. I enjoyed reading Jason Moser's, "Debt Payoff Plan" because it was very helpful and an easy read. The author breaks down what you need to do in order to get out of debt, all in a step-by-step method. What I really found helpful was the Compounding Your Debts Away section. The author talks about using this method to "dwindle down your bills by compounding the payments from one debt to the next until all of your debts are paid off." Everything that is described makes sense---the author just has a way of explaining everything in a simplified manner. I'm definitely going to start implementing Moser's methods. Overall, a very helpful guide to getting out of debt.

I haven't been sleeping well and have developed some dark circles under my eye. After reading the positive reviews I decided to give this product a try. I have to say I love this product! Punch under eye cream helped diminish my dark circles and puffs eyes. It feels weightless and not at all greasy. I also love the fact that the cream is organic, and only contains the best and natural ingredients. If you're looking for an eye cream that's effective, Punch is a great product to try.

I was looking into creating a will and I didn't want to spend money on lawyer fees so I found this book and found it very helpful. It's a great alternative to hiring an expensive lawyer. This book contains all the forms you need to get your affairs in order. It guided me through the legal process in order to legalize my will. In addition, you can also create a living trust. This book also provides you with the most common estate planning legal forms so you can create your own estate documents. Some sample forms include designating a power of attorney, check-lists that will help you make the sample forms into legal documents, and more. This is definitely a great resource you can refer to time and time again.

"Convicts Clique" is certainly filled with lots of drama and suspense, even when the main characters find themselves in jail and fighting for their lives. Even in jail trouble seems to find Cee-Cee and Snow. Their friendship is tested to the limits and they are caught up in prison politics. Who knew that a women's prison could be so hard core? If you're into drama, you should give this book a try.

"Above the Law" is a suspenseful, heart-stopping, action-packed thriller that has plenty of twists and turns to keep the reader engaged until the last page. When you're dealing with international terrorism and espionage there is most certainly going to be a degree of heightened suspense---this book has just the right amount. Marlon, a dirty Federal Agent, is highly flawed, but I enjoyed the development of his character as he seeks redemption for his past mistakes. If you're up for a good thriller, "Above the Law"  is a great novel to read.

"Fort Ross" incorporates various elements such as action, adventure, and science fiction, but it is ultimately a historical fiction novel that takes place in Russia. This book certainly caught my attention the moment I began reading it. Given the volatile relationship the U.S. has had with Russia in the past, this made for an interesting read. I always find the whole time travel element to be fascinating. The characters are dynamic and progressive. When Dmitry and his film crew are accidentally transported back in time, the story takes on a wild twist where danger is lurking at every corner. I found myself enjoying the story, as well as the Russian history lesson.Dmitri Poletaev writes a well-crafted story in "Fort Ross."

Isabella does an excellent job of progressing Reagan and Chad's story in this sequel to the "Executive Disclosure". It just seems that no matter how much Reagan and Chad try to stay away from each other, their worlds continue to collide. It's definitely a sign that the two are meant for each other despite their hurtful pasts. "Surviving Reagan" is just as well written as the first book. And the romance continues to sizzle. I have to commend Isabella for a great follow up.

I wanted to read a book that would make me laugh and "Night Shitf" (no, this isn't a typo) certainly did just that. This book contains a crazy cast of characters, but that's what makes the story so enjoyable. The misadventures Moses and Carmella get into while at the hospital is completely insane, laughable and definitely puts a smile on your face. I really enjoyed this book---the author really does a good job of re-creating this real-life account based from his time as an orderly. I've always viewed hospitals as a place of seriousness and depression---little did I know that there is a sense of levity as well. I'm so glad I read this book---I got a good laugh out of it.

If you're studying for the medical administrative assistant exam, this is a great guide to help you prepare. The questions are relevant to what you would expect to be on the exam. Plus the answers are given to you so you can understand which question you missed, and why. I'm looking forward to the next set of exam examples in this prep series.

I was completely hooked the moment I began reading "Aegis Rising". The premise of the story peaked my curiosity, but as I delved further into the book, I really began to identify with the five main characters. When Aari, Mariah, Kody, Tegan and Jag survive the plane crash, they are discovered by tribesmen who call themselves the Elders---they believe the five were sent there to fulfill an ancient prophecy. The five teenagers are then faced with a new challenge---they must battle an evil corporation intent on destroying the world as they know it.I love a good science fiction and adventure novel, and this was certainly it. This novel was well-written and included a lot of vivid imagery. I really enjoyed watching the author's imagination unfold as the story progressed. I'm excited for this series because it has a lot of potential and I can't wait to read the next one.

I wanted to lose weight for a wedding I'm a part of so I decided to give Liporidex PLUS a try. I've tried other weight loss pills and supplements but they never seem to give me the results I want. With Liporidex I was extremely happy with the results. The pills suppressed my appetite so I felt full and they didn't give me any unwanted side effects. As a result, I was able to lose some of the weight. I also notice how much more energy I have now. This is a great product to use if you want to see effective weight loss results. I'm so glad I gave this product a try!

The 17 year old protagonists begin the story as kids who are only interested in the party scene and popularity. Clark wants to be the on the football team and his girlfriend is a cheerleader. While Donny and Chloe are geeks and Charles is a pompous rich kid. But the stereotypes end at the party when the characters are united over a mysterious object that gives them the powers of immortality. Like the characters in “The Covenant,” these characters possess the powers of telekinesis. They can do almost anything and that comes with choice of making very powerful decisions. The author weaves an interesting tale of teenage fate for the superhero genre.

I found this parody of the Fifty Shades of Grey books to be funny and entertaining. It's interesting how the story is fashioned in a choose your own adventure sequence. Basically, you determine the outcome of the story based on decisions you make. I don't want to spoil anything for the reader, but if you've read the Fifty Shades series like I did, you might find this book an amusing treat, especially if enjoy comedy. I literally laughed out loud a few times because the scenarios presented in the book are completely outlandish. Great parody by the Parody Brothers.

In this magical realm of dwarves and elves, resides a powerful female dwarf named Kaiya whose magic and abilities is the only thing that can save her village from an evil illness. With the help of a powerful elf named River, Kaiya must summon her sorceress powers, find a hidden artifact, and battle an evil sorcerer. I like the author's choice of incorporating a strong female dwarf as the heroine of this novel---you don't often see that. Overall, this is a great book for anyone who enjoys the fantasy genre. It's got a lot of great elements to it: an exciting plot, great characters, magic and sorcery, and plenty of action and adventure.

The coin of luck is at it again, working its magic as this time it's passed on to Rachel Connor, a talented writer who was born with a very noticeable port-stain birth mark on her face. Despite the birth mark, Rachel remains a very positive individual---she doesn't try to hide who she is and she accepts her flaws with grace. She is a strong female character who I quickly admired. When the coin of luck enters her life, Rachel's dreams begin falling into place and a new romance develops. I enjoyed reading the May installment of this series. Zetterwall writes another moving romance novella.

"Crown of Betrayal" is the first in Marie F. Crow's 'Siren' series, and I must say this book is a great start. If you're a huge fantasy buff like I am, Crow introduces into her story, a lineage of mystical mermaids. The book drew me in immediately the moment I began reading it. There are other themes infused into the story line such as action, adventure, and romance. I love how Crow has the ability to capture a moment through the use of vivid imagery as part of her writing style. I also fell in love with the characters. I'm definitely hooked to this new series, and I can't wait to see what happens in the next installment.

"Twins of Prey" is the first book in the Twins of Prey series, where a pair of deadly twins, Tomek and Drake are introduced. The twins are discovered by an elusive man, who found them in a car crash wreckage that left their mother dead. The man takes the twins and raises them as his own, teaching each of them how to survive in their harsh environment. Tomek and Drake refer to him as "Uncle." Before dying, Uncle makes sure the twins are more than capable of taking care of themselves. Then unexpected intruders arrive and Tomek and Drake are determined to drive away these unwanted strangers at all necessary costs. Full of thrills and suspense, W.C. Hoffman has crafted a well-written survival story that had me on the edge of my seat from start to finish. I'm looking forward to the next book in this series.

"The Dragonrider’s Quest" is a gripping fantasy novel where time is of the essence for the main characters, Marius and Aenor. They must travel together to the Capital in order to save the crown prince. Despite their initial mistrust for each other, there is no denying Aenor and Marius share an attraction for each other. I enjoyed the development of both characters, especially Aenor, who is a strong-willed female. And of course when you bring dragons into the mix, it makes for a great adventure. I love fantasy novels and "The Dragonrider’s Quest" is a great read from beginning to end.

"Last Stand" had me on the edge of my seat as I read the story of John Mack helping his family and neighbors survive when all hell breaks loose after all forms of technology is extinguished. I love survival stories, especially ones as well written as this. The plot is very plausible---the world would turn into anarchy if technology is wiped out. The circumstances precluding the EMP event are very realistically described. The author has a great way of building up the story and keeping the reader in suspense.I enjoyed the various characters and the helpful survival tips that were included. I was satisfied with the conclusion of the story. Overall, for a first book, the author did a great job.

I really enjoyed the message behind Fitch and Sam's story, which is unveiled by their diary entries. They grow up together, but they lead completely different lives despite their friendship. The diary entries are written weekly, and at the end of each week the author provides a lesson. While Fitch is always the negative one, Sam is always positive---she sees the glass half full rather than half empty. She takes care of her mind and body, and she lives a proactive life. Fitch on the other hand is completely opposite. As a result, things keep happening TO Fitch while things happen FOR Sam. The ultimate lesson behind this book is that in order to succeed, you must learn from your failures. Life is a succession of failures, but it is what you learn from them that will determine whether you succeed or not. One thing the author mentioned that really struck home for me was when he said, "Individuals who fail often, often reach far greater career and life successes than people who never fail. Failure helps you learn, grow, and understand!" Eric McNeal writes a smartly written self-help book that is both enjoyable and thought-provoking. I highly recommend this book---I really love the lessons the author teaches despite the negative connotations towards failure. Who knew that failure is sometimes a good thing?

The concept of a man switching places with his wife is pretty outlandish, but not without some degree of entertainment. Sometimes I've wondered what it's like to be a man and "His Wish" certainly gives me a glimpse of what that's like. I found this book to be entertaining, erotic and gratifying. I like how the author uses the characters in this book to convey the true message of the story. I can't wait to see what other works the author has instored.

"The Perception Transformation" is a great self-help book that will help you transform your way of thinking. I've always been a very positive person--- I try to see the glass half full rather than half empty. What I like about this book is that it can help negative individuals change their way of thinking. It can also help positive thinkers enhance their perceptive abilities. If we perceive things in a certain way, whether good or bad, the outcome is what we expect it to be. If you perceive everything in a negative light, the outcome will be negative. I've read dozens of books on positive thinking, the law of attraction, etc, but this book is great because it provides some real life examples. It's also a quick read, but you'll find some very valuable information. Again, a highly recommended self-help guide.

"War of the Wildlands" is a well-crafted epic fantasy series involving the world of elves and Na'zorans, battling to exterminate each other. The book starts off with Yori, a half blooded elf and human, being accused of a vicious crime. He is released from prison only to keep his promise to Prince Aelryk of crafting a runed weapon that wields great power. I don't want to spoil anything so I'll leave it at that. But the story only gets better from there, and plenty of action and adventure awaits the reader. I like Lisalla's character because of the fact that she wants to be perceived as a strong female, not a helpless damsel in distress. I love fantasy---it's my favorite genre---so I'm interested to see where this series goes. I can't wait for the next book.

This book was perfect to read to my nephew because of the cute nature of the story, and the fact that he loves strawberries. I liked the lesson behind the story and my nephew really enjoyed the adorable illustrations. This is a great book to read out loud to young children. "The Strawberry Garden" is a definitely a winner!

I received this product as a free trial offer and I immediately began taking it. I took these pills while also maintaining a solid exercise plan and I've never seen results happen so quickly. I like that this product contains green coffee bean extract because I know the ingredient is great for fat burning. I was able to lose a few pounds in just a matter of days. I'm pretty happy with the results so far---I can't wait to see how great my body will be a few months from now.

The success of a business is dependent upon its leader(s). A great leader can create exponential growth for a business. A bad leader can lead a business to ruin. This book is great because it teaches individuals how to develop their leadership skills in order to achieve any type of success. It includes some important case studies and valuable research that will help improve your leadership abilities. Clearly an expert in this field, the author has written a professional and well-written book on leadership development. This book has already helped me become a better leader and achieve some personal business goals. Highly recommended book with great concepts.

I enjoyed reading this book because I'm a huge advocate of goal setting---it is the best way to get tasks completed. However, there is a certain process and technique to setting effective and achievable goals. This book teaches you these methods in an easy-to-follow format. Not only will you learn about the "how" and the "why" behind your goals, the author teaches you how to increase your productivity and create better habits. I really found this book to be helpful, inspiring, motivational, and effective. I enjoyed learning about the different techniques in order to make me a more successful person.

This is a unique book in helping us become more innovative because the author uses animals as analogies to get his point across. From A to Z, Jeff Zias uses beautiful animal illustrations at the beginning of each chapter and describes each animal's importance in innovation, each letter used as an acronym. Each animal also includes a valuable lesson. "The Innovation Animals" is a great learning tool for anyone involved in business and anyone who loves poetry. The book itself is creative, well-written, and complete with great ideas. Overall, a great book that comes highly recommended.

I lost a family member to cancer last year. "How to Kill Cancer Cells" is a powerful book, setting clear guidelines for readers on how to control susceptibility to cancer. We all have cancer cells in our body, but we can prevent and neutralize cancer through proper diet and nutrition, which is what the author focuses on. This is a great resource to have, especially since the author is an expert on nutrition. This book contains a lot of great information---the knowledge you gain here can literally save your life. A "killer" book that comes highly recommended.

If you've ever wanted to be your own boss and become financially free, this book tells you how in a step-by-step easy-to-follow format. There's a lot involved to becoming an entrepreneur, and with the right type of action, your dreams of financial freedom can be achieved. As an entrepreneur myself, I found this book to be very helpful and full of valuable information for anyone just getting their feet wet. Take the first step to becoming your own boss and following your dreams---read this book and follow the guidelines.

The Eagle's Secret is a heart-stopping political thriller that will grip you from beginning to end. It's a mixture of mystery, intrigue, crime, terrorism and more. This book is jammed packed with excitement, and the characters are fascinating. As a reader, you're left wondering who the real villain is. The author does a good job of keeping the audience in suspense. If you're a fan of mysteries and thrillers, this is the book to read.

This short children's book asks and then answers the question, "What color is God?" It's a cute story about a curious little girl who asks her aunt this question. Inspirational and touching, this book will warm the heart and help you teach a valuable lesson to a young one.

If you need nutrition advice to improve your health, "Eat Healthy Be Sexy" is the book to read. Not only does it teach you how to eat healthy, it contains all the motivation you need to feeling great and looking sexy. This book is inspirational and very positive all around. My favorite chapter was Chapter Three: Eating Your Way to a Leaner and Sexier Body because the author provided some very important facts regarding the types of food we intake. The author is clearly an expert on nutrition---this book is professionally written and easy to follow.

The plot and the twists, the suspense and the thrills, and the romance...I just loved it all. This is the kind of book I like to read, and I enjoy any books in this genre as long as it is good quality. This book is good quality. It kept me captivated for days---I am ready to read the next book. In fact, I signed up for it already.

This isn't normally the type of genre I read, but I found some interesting twists to the story, such as Galen falling for his captor, similar to Stockholm Syndrome. There's plenty of erotica and sexual exploitation in this book; it's definitely not for the prude. It will be interesting to see how the author develops the story and characters, as this is just one in a series.

I received this kit to do an unbiased review and its well worth the $23.98 at the time of writing this review.It is identical to the iFixit 54bit driver kit (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008KOTNVA?keywords=ifixit%2054%20bit%20driver%20kit&qid=1447429583&ref_=sr_1_2&sr=8-2)With this kit it saves you $11 vs paying the $35 for the iFixit version.The only big difference between this and the iFixit kit is that the iFixit bit holder has clear markings of which bit is which.In my opinion its not worth the extra $11 to have clear markings of which bit is which since the reason most of us purchase a electronic bit set is to work on small electronics (iPhones, tablets, laptops).The quality of this set and the iFixit is exactly the same, with either set you can easily strip a bit/screw if you use the incorrect bit (ie, bit is too small or too large).The PROs:-Price! Save $11 buying this set vs buying a rebranded ifixit version-This set includes the special Y bit for Macbooks (when replacing certain components & battery replacement).-Sturdy case! (ive purchased other versions at computer stores where the case is really cheap and prone to hairline cracks and chips when dropped)-Magnetic!The CONs:-The bit holder(not the case) is flimsy made out of cheap plastic and not labeled for easy viewing such as the ifixit version, however this should not deter you from purchasing this kit since you're already used to looking for tiny micro screws on your electronic device, looking for the correct bit and reading the marking on the side of the bit should come natural to you.Overall you're better off purchasing this kit than randomly deciding to pick up a micro bit set at your local MicroCenter/Frys computer repair store, those versions are rarely magnetic and their cases scream one time use only.

Received this cable to do a full review and have been using it daily for the past 3 months for my iPhone 6 which I leave plugged into a wall at my home office.The first three months this cable has worked flawlessly to charge my iPhone 6 and my external battery(using micro usb). However after three solid months now whenever I plug in my phone it'll charge for a few minutes then an error will pop up on my phone that this device is not supported with my phone and charging stops.This is common for any lightning cable that did not come directly from the Apple factory. Ive reviewed many other cables and after a few weeks and months it'll just stop charging.On some days it'll fully charge my phone without any disconnect issues and on most it'll initially charge but to come back to my phone after an hour only to see that it has lost connection and didnt charge my phone is a disappointment.I would recommend this product for anyone who needs a spare charger. I personally keep a Apple branded cable at my office desk (since im there most of the day) and ill keep this cable at my home office. Throughout the house/cars I also use Apple branded cables.The other cables I have reviewed are either stored in drawers or in my glovebox for friends who forgot their charger/cable.Pros:-Price and dual functionality of the cable-Cable quality is really impressive flat cable design, has not warped or frayed in the past three monthsCons:-After 3 months the cable will have random disconnects when I only try to charge my iPhone

If you surf Gizmodo.com or Gawker.com regularly you can usually see a special code for these at $59.99!Ive purchased other Anker products for my mobile devices as well as laptop accessories (hubs/card readers/etc) and quality of Anker is always of the highest quality in every range of product they offer.I dont use the USB ports since I have so many other USB portable devices, but I bought this mainly as a LIGHTweight portable jump starter.My neighbors have this bulky handle type of jumpers in their trunk which takes up unnecessary space and after a few years they just dont hold their charge.I keep this in my 2nd car which I dont drive as often as my main one and I dont have access to a garage to attach a trickle charger. This helps me avoid the mess of asking friends for a jump or long cables.My only gripe is small Anker pin charger thats required to recharge this device, a mini-USB or micro-USB would've made it a lot more user friendly.

I have been using this product for years along with another Gatsby wax (Moving Rubber Spikey Edge 80g PINK), a little hairspray with low heat blow dry helps keep everything in place.I can also just use this alone to give it a more natural matte look to my hair (works better with shorter hair than longer hair if you just use this alone)Im Asian and everyone that doesn't normally style/spike their hair naturally believe it takes me hours to prepare my hair when in fact it only takes me a good 2-3 minutes.Pros:-Keeps my hair in the style I want all day and night, I can easily fall asleep wake up and adjust it if need be!-Not oily compared to others, Ive used American waxes/gels/clays and it leaves an oily residue when I wash my hands and hair as if someone spilled corn oil on my hands.-Does NOT damage my hair, ive been using Gatsby products for years (8+) and after daily washes my female friends always mention how soft my hair is when I dont use my Gatsby!Cons:-Washing it off my hands after applicationTIPS:-Best method to wash it off your hands is to use warm water and liquid soap to help rub it off.-Humid days use a little less than you normally would and use a little more hairspray, I just adjust my hair every now and then.-Works better when your hair is damp, I take showers at night so in the morning I just rinse my hair with plain water and blow dry then apply the product.Ive attached a photo with this review to give you an idea of how I style my hair before and after my haircuts!

I have been using this product for years along with another Gatsby wax (Moving Rubber Spikey Edge 80g PINK), a little hairspray with low heat blow dry helps keep everything in place.I can also just use this alone to give it a more natural matte look to my hair (works better with shorter hair than longer hair if you just use this alone)Im Asian and everyone that doesn't normally style/spike their hair naturally believe it takes me hours to prepare my hair when in fact it only takes me a good 2-3 minutes.Pros:-Keeps my hair in the style I want all day and night, I can easily fall asleep wake up and adjust it if need be!-Not oily compared to others, Ive used American waxes/gels/clays and it leaves an oily residue when I wash my hands and hair as if someone spilled corn oil on my hands.-Does NOT damage my hair, ive been using Gatsby products for years (8+) and after daily washes my female friends always mention how soft my hair is when I dont use my Gatsby!Cons:-Washing it off my hands after applicationTIPS:-Best method to wash it off your hands is to use warm water and liquid soap to help rub it off.-Humid days use a little less than you normally would and use a little more hairspray, I just adjust my hair every now and then.-Works better when your hair is damp, I take showers at night so in the morning I just rinse my hair with plain water and blow dry then apply the product.Ive attached a photo with this review to give you an idea of how I style my hair before and after my haircuts!

I use this brush primarily to clean my Crane Drop Humidifier.I dont have any kids however my sister has a son and once he stopped using bottles there was no need to clean bottles and one day she decided to dedicate this brush to cleaning out her humidifier.It has the perfect angle for reaching inside the tube of the humidifier to clean all mildew.Also comes with a clear protective cover for storage.ProTip on cleaning Humidifiers is to use a 50/50 Vinegar/Water solution.

I use this ONLY for brake fluid flush/changes.Since its stainless steel this is a perfect tool for the garage! I used a label maker to make sure no one accidentally takes it from my garage to baste their turkey.The added brush is a great addition which I use to clean the baster after fluid flushes.For those wondering I use this baster to remove the existing fluid from the brake fluid reservoir tank which ill then transfer over to an empty bottle for proper disposal. Then refill reservoir with new fluid and bleed the system.

Disclaimer I have received this mouse from Atlantic Castle to do a review.I was given this phone to do an honest review and to be honest I don't own an iPhone 6 (I currently use an iPhone 6+) however my older sister does own one and I had her use this case instead to do a review.My sister's previous case had a similar wallet design such as this one, however after a few months her case could no longer hold credit cards & ID in securely. Apparently once this part is stretched out it stays stretched out. This case since its new held one NYS drivers license and her bank card with a secure confident grip that if she were to hold her phone upside down (for when she gets in and out of the car or carrying bags of groceries etc) she doesn't have to think twice on if her ID and CC had fallen out.She did like the leather on this case vs her older case (older case had a more vinyl feel). The tan portion of the interior does feel like a faux suede, which is always welcomed.For the price of a decent phone case this one does the job perfectly. Shes not Kim Kardashian and realistically no one spends large sums of money on a designer case off Fifth Ave, so don't expect the leather to be from the same cow that they use for Kobe beef.There is a space behind the card holder to fit a few bills (id say roughly 5-10 bills comfortably).This phone does have the option for portrait viewing of videos/movies.She does drop the phone from time to time with carrying my nephew and baby bag from park to park and it has handled itself very well on these concrete jungles of NYC.The ONLY draw back was it did not come with a wrist strap or a hole where a wrist strap can be attached.The bonuses are that this case did come with a glass/acrylic type of screen protector to protect it even further for when my 2 year old nephew does decide to randomly chuck it across the park while the front flap is opened. This only adds onto the protection of jello fingerprints and having your Apple LCD crack from impact/smudges.I would recommend this to anyone who wants to have the whole wallet/case option. If I had an iPhone 6 I would highly consider going this route & ditching my wallet. Just grab it and you're ready to go!

Disclaimer I have received this mouse from Kingtop to do a review.For the price of a basic wired mouse this mouse offers multiple DPI settings on the fly.It has a total of 6 buttons (one for DPI setting).Light construction (a little under 4 ounces, not including the wiring)The build quality is that of any generic mouse however this mouse has sections of a matte texture body which allows for better grip and non-slip for when your palm gets sweaty after a few rounds of competitive game play.Right out of the box it works, select the DPI and you can play your favorite FPS game (CSGO, BF4, CoD)I would not use this mouse to play strategy games due to the size of the mouse it is hard to pick up and track it across the mouse pad to get your cursor to the other end of the map (ie. LoL, Starcraft).I have added photos to my daily mouse which is a Razer Orochi (MSPR $69.99) which is bluetooth & wired. Mostly due to its small form factor and since I use my 15" rMBP in BootCamp running Windows 8.1 Professional.There are 5 different DPI settings once you press the center "DPI" button, once you hit the "DPI" button you will see a color flashing which will represent which DPI setting you have selected.RED - 1000GREEN - 1600BLUE - 2400PINK - 3200YELLOW - 5500The LEDs on the mouse will change colors randomly when on and you can opt to turn off all LEDs if you hold down the "DPI" button.Pros:Light clicks (for FPS this is live or die when you rush a building)Wired (all competitive players will agree a wired mouse means a consistent signal)Buttery Smooth (I used this with a hard faced mouse pad and this thing glides) Photo included.Cons:Large (I'm 5'10" and I cannot palm this mouse comfortably, and reaching the 5th button is impossible). Photo included.No Software (cannot Macro the spare 3 buttons to assign to programs/functions or to select a specific DPI)Overall:I would recommend this to someone who isnt a daily gamer that has slightly larger hands than mine.If you're an avid gamer you would be better off investing in a more feature oriented mouse.I did not comment on the design of the mouse because that is really your opinion.

I purchased this to hide my rear trunk emblems.I was originally going to just spray the original black plasti-dip however ive seen some cars left out in the sun for a few months and that flat black looks horrible after it has faded (due to UV damage) almost making it look like black primer.I applied 3 coats of this Glossifier to add a little satin to my flat-black emblems which gave it a clean OEM look.(ive attached a photo for reference)If you add multiple coats the glossier it gets however with 3 coats (1 light 2 heavy) Ive achieved the look I was going for to blend my emblems with the black paint of my car.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I had purchased these for about $7.60 (on 2-20-15), price does jump around a few cents.These are very pricey for small slides molded out of acrylic.I normally purchase the Stack-On DS-60 for roughly $17-20 at my local K-Mart (Amazon has re-sellers selling them for about $38).The dividers are molded out of clear brittle acrylic and the newer Stack-Ons are made out of a cheaper more flexible plastic.However if you add a little effort you can easily clean these up with an X-acto knife and some 400grit wetordry sandpaper.After all the extra work you put into these small dividers they easily fit into place on the small DS-60 trays and keep my parts (I use them for Lego pieces) separated.I have added photos to better show you the quality of these dividers and what is needed to make them cleaner without fear of cutting yourself.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below.

My girlfriend wanted this but couldn't find them in stores (including retail Lego stores). We only wanted to build the ice cream truck. The colors and detail is amazing and the overall size and value has met or exceeded our expectations.The left over pieces are abundant and required if you want to build the "Ice Cream Machine" from the Lego Movie.I personally enjoyed this set because you can easily place this in any Lego City without looking out of place.However this will stay in a glass case with her other Lego collections.The top is easily removable to place minifigures inside the truck.I have included better photos of the detail in the ice cream truck and a bag of left over spare pieces which are required for the original "Ice Cream Machine"If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I use these with self stick on Dry Erase board paper (Wall Pops) which you can stick onto any wall to create a make-shift dry erase board.These are ideal for referencing back on notes/memos you had jotted down before. However these are not ideal if you want to instruct a class since the further you are from the board the harder it is to make out what was written. However for my GF who is in Med school the variety of colors do help her keep her notes and diagrams clear vs having them in one single color.I had attached a photo for reference.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I purchased two to lay them on top of each other in portrait mode with one slightly overlapping the other to prevent any marker ink landing onto the painted wall (I had also created a frame out of blue painters tape to further prevent accidentally writing onto the painted wall.When installing these I used a firm credit card wrapped in tape (to prevent scuffing & scratching onto the surface) and applied pressure from the center moving outward to the edges to remove any air bubbles. After applying this onto my wall I noticed more air bubbles had surfaced overnight. I quickly removed the WallPop and squeegeed out more air.If this doesn't work for you, you can always use a sharp X-Acto knife and poke tiny tiny holes for trapped air to be released.I attached a photo for referenceI had purchased this for my girlfriend who is currently in Med school and aside from all of her paper notes and post-its, she needed a dry erase board to jot down quick notes to reference back easily. I didn't want to buy the ones at local office supply stores because those are either too small or too big to be practical for use at home. Also since these WallPops lay flat on my wall it feels more natural vs writing on a board thats screwed onto your wall.You can easily remove this peel & stick and it holds enough tack to be applied in another room in the same house.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

0:05 MinsI bought this with additional other Hot Wheels Track sets in hopes to making a huge long track to reach one end of the room to my nephews room in the back. (keep in mind my nephew is 2 but he loves sending cars down loops and ramps)The quality is very durable, just like any other Hot Wheels track sets where you can bend and flex the pieces.-LOUD BoosterThis one came with a dual zone car booster (which adds thrust/speed of your traveling Hot Wheels car even faster). The booster is REALLY loud that it intimidates me and once I fed a hot wheels car into it my little nephew was hooked! All he wanted to do is feed the booster, however he feeds it an inch away from the booster which gives me more fear that one day he'll get his small fingers stuck in between the rollers and the gap.I can easily stop the rolling booster with my finger which will stop the rotation of the rolling bumpers on both sides, but I am an adult my nephew is not and his fingers are smaller than my pinky finger. I just removed the booster and will re-introduce it to him when hes much older and aware of how these boosters work.Each loop has a rubber band booster which resets every time a car passes through it, you dont have to reset it to allow a car to roll though the loop, however this rubber band booster just gives the hot wheels car additional momentum by hitting a flap which will slap the back of your hot wheels thrusting it into the loop. With enough momentum you can easily send a car around the loop without the rubber band booster. If you trigger this flap with your finger it will hurt (I have removed the rubber hand to prevent it hitting my nephews fingers)- Again my nephew is 2 and once he is 4 years old I will introduce the booster and rubber band slings -If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I purchased this to put up a new set of Blackout curtains to keep sound and light away from my desk which im mostly at during the day.The quality and strength of the rod is strong enough to hold my curtains, also considering that the rod and hardware are black it blends in without it sticking out like a sore thumb.It did come with3 Hooks with an adjustable screw to lock rod in place6 Plastic anchors6 Wall screwsIf my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I purchased two of these to fit over my living room window.Reason for my purchase was because my three monitor computer set-up which I spend most of my day is next to my windows.(all of my monitors are modified where I had removed the anti-glare coating for deeper rich colors, but doing so will increase your glare and reflections)In the morning ive been using binder clips to seal any sunlight from coming through my semi thick white cotton curtains I had on previously.Now with these I cant tell if its still day light or night without looking at my clock or opening them up to see whats going on in the world.The material of the curtains feel like thick mix of polyester cotton, but im not interior decorator and these suit me just fine.I did shine a 200 lumen LED light through it and did not see the light coming through at all.These are great from keeping heat in and cold out even if my windows are dual panel windows. Not sure what it will be like in the summer days.My walls are painted white and the contrast with black curtains do make me feel like I just put up a huge black panel on my windows. Overall this was a great investment when I needed to block sunlight and does dampen outside noise by alot (I live near a busy street).If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

No one likes to iron however if I was going to do it, might as well do it right the first time.Theres nothing worse than rushing to get dressed for work and pulling what you thought was an ironed shirt that still has wrinkles.This board allows me to get about 90-95% of my wrinkles out of my dress shirts. I love a crisp wrinkle free shirt to start my day.I did notice that when im ironing one side of my shirt (ie the button) I noticed that the other end of my shirt sleeve would touch the floor.Im 5ft 10inches and I wear small US sized shirts. Im sure other boards do the same its just I wish it were a little taller to prevent my clean shirts from sweeping the floor picking up any dust (this is when the legs are extended at its max height).If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Ive been using this tool more and more whenever I make any drill (drywall, aluminum, sheet metal).Im personally a striving perfectionist and I like to have uniformity when it comes to drilling multiple holes.This tool allows me to make a small indent on any area I need a straight hole. I normally used a ballpoint pen and just tapped it lightly with a hammer and it usually works on drywall and wood but not on thicker aluminum or metals.I do like how it has an adjustable knob on the end to adjust the impact force of the punch, I would dial it down when making an indent on softer materials (sheet metal and thin pieces of wood) to prevent it from cracking or deforming but still allowing a small enough guide dent for my drill bit.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

First of all I am an ASE Master technician and I personally use this for any troubleshooting with engine codes.Its always my first step!Im 28years old and I dont believe that ill ever need one of those $3000-5000 OBDII readers to troubleshoot issues.I have a computer which I can easily type in an error code and start my troubleshooting from there.A great example would be that all cars are different and if you type in any error code with the model of your car (ie, 2004 Nissan Maxima) you will most likely get either a online club forum or a common search which will have others ranting about how a Camshaft Position sensor always fails & why its better to invest in a OEM version vs a Bosch or generic auto parts variation (some have done the cheaper generic route and had issues come back after a few weeks).Easily clears codes and its basic two button operation I can teach anyone to use one in 2minutes.Be sure to have a pen and paper ready to write down your error codes to reference back to them later.Also beware of cheap eB@y knockoffs which will look the same but essentially do not work (from my experience). I have a few of these and I always need one nearby.As for more indepth troubleshooting they have USB/Bluetooth/Wifi dongles which plug into your OBDII port and allow you to view graphs charts dyno etc. My personal preference I use USB to always ensure a proper connection.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

To be honest ive been using dry cleaning wire hangers for majority of my life (besides the couple of nice plastic hangers which came with every suit/coat I purchased)The main thing ive noticed once I switched over to these hangers is that I now no longer have that crease on my shoulders when I put on a dress shirt.The second thing ive noticed is these take up more space but they do keep my ironed shirts evenly spaced to prevent creases.The quality of the wood is great! I purchased this because I saw it on Gizmodo.com, and it does the job perfectly!I wanted a portable work light which I can use in my engine bay under my car in the garage in small areas where light was needed.The stand is a great feature also the folding clear acrylic which allows me to position the light in any orientation.I glued about 6 small Neomagnets to the back which allows me to stick it onto the side of my toolbox or anywhere im working which has metal to allow the light to stick.The odd thing about this light is that it can take either 4 or 8 AAs (Im guessing if you use 8AAs it allows for twice the life).Taking battery cover off only requires a coin or keys however taking the batteries out is a little tricky due to its small constrained spacing.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Firstly I must admit I waited until the battery price dropped to $150 on Amazon which is the cheapest ive found anywhere online (including autozone/advanceauto etc with coupons/rebates/gift card rewards etc).I made my purchase and it arrived in a well padded box and the battery was unharmed.The manufacture date had a sticker of 9/14 (I purchased this on 12/14), out of curiosity I tested the battery which was in good condition but it had a 50-75% charge. I attached a smart 3.5A charger overnight and by morning it was at 100%I used it to revive a dead battery to allow me to reconnect it to my smart charger with ease, which I then reconnected the Optima to my smart charger to get it back to 100% which took about 5-10minutes on a 3.5A smart charger.Not only did I get this battery at an amazing price I broke my UPS drivers back, he was not a happy camper having to carry it up 3 flights of stairs to my APT.Battery weighs 37lbs and 2oz, the duralast battery weighed 37lbs 8oz so I shaved about a good 6oz for more performance!But more realistically I picked the Yellow Top over the Red because I have multiple electronics in my car (TVs, sound, DVR, radar, etc) My engine bay however has a red and black theme. I may have to do a battery relocation into my trunk to hide the YELLOW and Gray (that alone would shave 37lbs off the front of my Maxima)If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Ive been using Autozone batteries due to the convenience of being able to go to any Autozone and have them test and replace(if its still under warranty) without having to ship a battery etc.However with more research Ive realized that the Autozone branded batteries are probably one of the worst quality batteries you can buy.I must of had Autozone replace a battery under warranty once every year (I dont have a parasitic draw or a faulty alternator).Eventually I havent driven one car for almost 3 months and I believed that a simple jump would bring my battery back to life which it did however Ive noticed I would need a jump every week if I left it undriven.I tried to connect a SMART charger but the voltage was too low to even start at 6V, I then connected a good battery to my dead battery for an hour then had enough of a charge that my SMART charger would fully charge then trickle charge the battery.After about two days of charging I finally re-connected the Battery Load Tester and sure enough it was back to GOOD condition with 12.6V, did a LOAD TEST and it passed and the gauge went back to its original GOOD condition!As for the charger I purchased it off Amazon for a little over $25, the quality is okay and the cables are a bit stiff but with a heat gun to soften the rubber then re-adjust the orientation of the cables helped fix that issue right away.The clamps are copper but very very thin, the switch for the load test doesn't stay in the ON position to prevent end users from accidentally leaving a load test on thus creating a fire or melting something.The gauge is easy to read and since this is an analog gauge I would try my best not to drop it in fear of throwing off the gauge and thus giving me bad readings.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

When winter comes I usually dont drive as much as I do during the summer, so most of my cars are sitting majority of the winter.This bottle of HEET will treat my 20 gallon gas tank (16 gallons + 4 gallon reserve) to remove any water that may have accumulated over the year.The steps I take is I would drive until the empty gas tank light comes on, then I pull into a gas station pour an entire bottle of HEET into my tank then fill up my tank with gas. I pour HEET in first so when I pump gas into my tank it helps mix the HEET around the entire tank.The main reason water builds up in our gas tanks is the same as if you leave a half of bottle of water outside, condensation will build up in the empty space inside your tank and eventually will drip down into your gas.Best practice is to always have at least a half a tank of gas and fill up whenever you can.Also do NOT pump gas at the station when you see a gas truck tanker at the station, since in theory the gas tanker is there to deliver gas which will get pumped into the station which will cause all the old gas to mix in with the newly delivered gas.This will cause all the old sediments and dirt and water thats on the bottom of their station to mix into your gas pump.Yes there are filters in each gas pump however why still risk having unknown sediments from that gas station mix into your car.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Great simple tool thats easy to use and read.I use this mainly to test batteries NEW and USED, it tells me in advance on if I have any potential batteries that may need replacing.A great example would be my TV remote controller, it would work great on some days and horribly on others. I used the Amprobe BAT-200 to test both batteries on my 3 year old remote and sure enough one was in BAD condition while the other was in GOOD condition. I replaced the both batteries in the remote and kept the battery that was in GOOD condition in a separate box to use with other devices (ie. flashlights & other devices that I dont use on a daily basis).Once I have collected enough used batteries that are in GOOD condition I can then use this device again to closely match up the batteries since most electronics require more than one battery. Having a matched set of batteries in a device will always outlast a set of mismatched batteries.The build quality on the plastic does feel like cheap plastic however for the price you paid thats expected.The gauge is also great simple and easy to read but I would not want to drop it in fear of having the meter thrown off balance and thus giving me incorrect readings.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I use a 20oz bottle yearly as a routine maintenance on my 2004 Maxima just to clear out my injectors and prevent it from clogging.Ive recommended this to family and friends who report to me of rough idle and bad mileage, and after a normal tune-up I believe it helps increase gas mileage and prolong the life of your fuel pump/filter/injectors and engine components.NOTE: This is NOT a cure-all for any engine issues you may have however this is a great investment to help prolong the life of your vehicle.Making sure your fluids are topped and clean and well maintained it will help the overall health of your vehicle.I dont drive the Maxima daily and its a little over 130k today (12/3/14), and since ownership (when new) Ive driven this car in a spirited manner with long high revs across multiple states.My uncle had an 03 Murano (same VQ35 engine) where his fuel pump had failed last year (2013) and he had roughly 70-80k miles I recommended this to him after the pump was replaced and he hasent had any issues since.When pouring this into my tank I usually pull up to the gas station and pour the entire bottle in before I fill up my tank only to ensure the flow of the gas helps mix the Techron completely.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below
