This is my first actual aquarium filter I have purchased, I have no previous experience in building/maintaining an aquarium (freshwater).I have personally owned the small fish bowls here and there which houses a single betta for months, where I would change its water weekly without any chemicals/additives.My gf recently bought me a goldfish/betta/two algae bottomfeeders and I needed a tank (3gallon) so they can co-exist with enough space. However with 4 fishes means more poop and more uneaten food that will float around my 3gallon(12x12x12in) tank. This filter is the perfect size and flow for me.Ive noticed the build up of garbage around the main entry point of the filter which I can easily remove and wash and re-attach.I havent owned it long enough where I have to clean/change the inner filter yet.It does vibrate loudly every now and then and noticed it was the loose cover on top of the filter housing which was causing it to vibrate/rattle (sounded like the pump was going bad after a week of use but it wasent).You can adjust the flow rate of this filter and I normally keep it on low to medium since thats more than enough current going through a 12inch cube of water + fish.I use this with the Tetra 29095 Cube Aquarium Kit 3 Gallon which I had purchased for $20(on sale on Amazon). I use a sheet of paper towel to keep the filter spaced and mounted evenly to prevent vibration on the tank & filter.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

I never actually purchased an actual fish tank of this size before, usually smaller cup sized tanks for goldfish/betta that would last months.However I saw it on sale from its original price down to roughly $20 shipped VIA PRIME.I figured Id purchase this for a Goldfish/Betta/2 Algae bottom feeders so they can co exist together with enough swimming space, and if raising fresh water fish isnt as enjoyable as others have expressed I only lost a $20 investment vs spending over a $100 on a larger tank.The quality is pretty much any $40-50 tank you would expect to purchase (clear acrylic cube and plastic black base). I dont use the included filter I bought the AZOO Mignon Filter 60 which seems to do a better job of filtering uneaten food/poop. I also dont use the LEDs since my office is clearly lit. The quality of the included filter and led light do feel cheap and fragile.The only downside was the lid is a bit warped(two corners dont touch) however with a heatgun and a few seconds of heat I can easily form it back so the lid sits on the top flush.Keep an eye out for price drops on this aquarium, great for younger kids who want to adventure out and start their own freshwater aquarium without hitting the wallet.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Its essentially $1 per sheet, and under normal conditions you would use 1 sheet every month. However if you use your shredder daily it is probably recommended to use two or more per month, but at this rate you're probably better off getting the oil in a bottle.Each sheet is sealed which has enough oil to lubricate your shredder. Which will help prolong the life of your shredderThe reason is so that the motor running the blades arent stressed with friction from paper bits that are still attached to the blades. Oil allows it to lubricate the blades and allow a smooth operation of blades when moving freely(without any paper being shredded).The only benefit is that anyone can use this and not have to worry about getting oil everywhere.I would recommend shredding a few documents first to line the bottom of the catch bin so the oil pieces dont get stuck to your bin.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Ive tried multiple other brands of rechargeable batteries in the past and after months to a year ive noticed that the batteries lose their charge capacity.I firmly believe Eneloops hold the best charge in overall time since they were purchased, mainly due to the quality of the cell.I do know that the Eneloop PRO models have a higher capacity however they have 4times lower re-charge cycles which leads to lower life expectancy.I use eneloops with bigger devices that require C or D sized batteries with the Sanyo Eneloop AA adapters.If my review was helpful in any way please click the "YES" button below

Doesnt come with power adapter and ive tried multiple other adapters to see if it'll work (ie. network adapters/hard drive adapters etc) with no success.Since I keep this in my drawer to have an removable power adapter would just add to the clutter, so I use rechargeable Sanyo Eneloop AA batteries with C adapters (4x)That way whenever it states "low battery" I can easily just swap them out with other rechargeable batteries into the Sanyo C adapters and weigh my packages before shipping.The quality of the scale is very cheap (think dollarstore toy plastic), I feel if I were to accidently drop this onto a hard floor it'll shatter. Great $40 electric toothbrush, I believe this is the older model however when compared to newer models the only noticeable difference is the size of the handle/battery (this one will last a month on a single charge and I brush twice daily).I still prefer this to the other $80 sonicare models because of the price mainly. Lonely Planet's "Discover New York City" is another fantastic entry in the Lonely Planet travel guides.Like most Lonely Planet guides, this is a weighty book with high quality pages and half page photos on every other page with descriptive text so you know what to expect at your destination.  The guide is built to last so it will be something you can use for an extended period of time.The guide opens with a highlight of the key attractions of New York City, then breaks down into more detail sorted by location.Attractions are included such as a wealth of things to do and places to eat, but there are other excellent addon bonuses, too.  At the end of the book there is a "Survival Guide" which includes things such as places to find guaranteed electricity, public wifi, and information for travelers with disabilities.  There is even a small section for LGBT-friendly venues, to illustrate the amount of detail this guide has for virtually anyone.The guide concludes with a foldout map of New York City that includes a full street index and transportation info (including subway map) to ensure you are never lost in the big city.Highly recommended, a fantastic guide that is both portable and durable for anyone considering a trip to the big apple!

Before going into the details of this brewer, let me ask you a question:Do you own a iPhone or know anyone who owns an iPhone?  Is that person having a horrible experience due to Apple's closed ecosystem? Most likely not. Keurig, with Keurig 2.0, is attempting to similarly close the ecosystem on its coffeemakers much like Apple did on the iPhone.  Keurig wants control of and to get a cut of every K-Cup sold, just like Apple has control of and gets a cut of every App sold.I will explain first below what this all means to me, but please read the rest of the review also to get the details on this awesome machine that I purchased direct from Keurig.What this means is you can only use cups that are licensed by Keurig.  Meaning, imitation/unlicensed/bootleg K-Cups will not work with this machine.  I do not see the issue with this, though makers of these bootleg cups have started a lawsuit and are even taking out ads on YouTube to give Keurig 2.0 a black eye.  There are plenty of K-Cup brewers from other brands that will brew imitation/unlicensed K-Cups and they are much cheaper than this machine.  But the quality of those brewers and the quality of the imitation/unlicensed K-Cups may vary dramatically from Keurig's machines and licensed K Cups.  Heck, a non-Keurig licensed K-Cup could have toxins in it and there is nothing Keurig could do about it as they have no control over unlicensed K-Cups.  It also means you can't use your own coffee grounds - but why are you buying an expensive Keurig just to use your own grounds?? Doesn't it make more sense to buy a much cheaper traditional coffeemaker if that is what you want to do?  I call reviews implying these changes requiring licensed K-Cups in the Keurig are a nightmare scenario "unfair" as many "reviews" I have seen are just complaints about the new closed ecosystem rather than a review of the actual product beyond that complaint.  Further it appears many have not even contacted Keurig as they are replacing legit older K-Cups that do not work on this machine with newer ones that do work for free for the customer - all you need to do is call.Bottom line, Keurig wants to close its ecosystem to only use cups licensed by Keurig just like Apple and not support "bootlegs."  If you do not like it, there are a wealth of other options than this machine.  But I still recommend this machine wholeheartedly as it is Keurig's best effort to date, and Keurig will help you get new cups that work if you have a stockpile of licensed older ones that do not.I do understand some are passionate about the new closed ecosystem, and would like to hear and discuss with you your thoughts in the comments section of this review. Thanks!Some more details about the machine beyond the ecosystem:First, the compatibility with *licensed* Keurig pods is outstanding - it supports K-Cups (cheapest), Vue Cups (better flavor) and Carafe Cups (full pot of coffee).  K-Cups can be brewed from 4oz-10oz.  Vue & Carafe Cups can be brewed anywhere from 4oz up to the maximum carafe size depending on which number you select on the touchscreen prior to brewing (for instance 1=Carafe, 4=normal cup, 5=froth), though you really need a carafe cup if you want coffee that is not watered down at 22oz+ sizes.  Technically though if you use a Vue Cup you could brew a 32oz pot of coffee, though it would taste like water without a Carafe Cup - K-Cups on the other hand are restricted to 10oz max.  If you want more than 10oz, buy Vue Packs or Carafe Cups depending how much more you want to make; you can probably get away with 14oz on a Vue pack and still have a decent cup of coffee.The touchscreen is nice and the best of any Keurig to date, much more advanced than the Vue touchscreen due to having more customization options and better view angles.  The device is slightly taller and slimmer than a Keurig Vue but much lighter.  Still, it brews the best cup of coffee I have tasted from a Keurig, and it is also the best looking machine.The drip tray just pulls out and the carafe goes in, there is no button release.  This works well unless you plan to move the unit itself a lot, in which case you may find it falling out when you move the unit.  But if your coffeemaker stays stationary like most, this design is a lot easier to release the drip tray compared to previous Keurig coffee makers; this is a necessity as you need to remove the drip tray to use the carafe. which you will likely do frequently.The carafe the unit comes with is plastic and does not keep coffee warm for more than 10 minutes.  For a bit over $20, you can buy a steel thermal one from Keurig that keeps coffee hot for 40+ minutes, a worthy investment.The device has a customizable reservoir light which you can adjust to best accent your kitchen.  Time is displayed on the LCD screen and you can customize the color of that as well.  You can even set it up to brew you a cup or carafe of coffee at a set time, such as when you wake up in the morning.I have experienced zero issues.  No breakages, no spills, no problems.  It just works, and tastes great.Overall, this coffeemaker is the best Keurig has released.  It is a shame that is overshadowed by the fact that Keurig closed the ecosystem much like Apple did.  Machines like this cost a lot of money to research, develop, and market - and Keurig can sell it to you for a lower price if they know they will recoup some money on the pods.  But if you buy bootleg pods, Keurig gets no money from them and eventually this will likely result in having to pay a lot more for a quality Keurig machine or Keurig simply exiting the market.  Either option is not great, and frankly if you do not want to use Keurig K-Cups/Vue Packs/Carafes, I do not know why you are buying a Keurig in the first place.***NOTE: Some K-Cups and Vue Packs made prior to June of this year will not work on this machine.  HOWEVER, if you call Keurig's help line they will give you a one-time use coupon to redeem for an equal number of free replacement packs of your choice on their webstore.  Meaning if you have 50 packs that don't work, they will give you a coupon for 50 free packs - at least that is what they did for me.

The United Solutions LN0309 is a taller than usual laundry tote with a movable strap that can be placed nearly anywhere on the basket due to its novel keyhole design.  This will allow easier and less awkward carrying of laundry loads.However, the basket's plastic seems exceedingly thin, moreso than I am comfortable with.  It is very thin and flexes with little effort; this combined with the tall sides and a lack of stabilizing lip on the top makes me wonder if this basket will hold up over time.  Perhaps the thin plastic is stronger than most plastics, but for now I am not confident this won't crack.  The thin plastic also digs into the hands when carrying via the handles instead of the strap.In short, great idea and neat design with the strap - but a more sturdy basket would have been preferred.

This cable does exactly as advertised - it is a 25ft USB 3.0 cable that maintains highest speeds with no disconnect/instability issues.In fact, when you pair this cable with the "Kinect for Windows" adapter and an XBOX ONE Kinect 2.0 unit, you can get a total of a 34ft run from the Kinect 2.0 to the XBOX ONE - 9ft from the Kinect 2.0 into the Kinect for Windows adapter ($49.99 from Microsoft), then another 25ft from the Kinect for Windows adapter into the XBOX ONE.  This is one of the few ways one can extend the Kinect 2.0 if you need more than the 9ft it comes with.Well done Tripp Lite for delivering a product that matches advertised speeds unlike many other long USB 3.0 cables being sold!

First off, below are the specs of the Dell Inspiron 13 7000 I reviewed:Model: i7347-10051sLV13.3" Full HD Touch Display with WebcamIntel Core i5-4210U8GB RAM500GB Hard Drive (hybrid)Integrated Intel HD GraphicsWindows 8.1Wireless-ACBluetooth3-Cell BatteryMedia Card ReaderHDMI and USB 3.0Waves MaxxAudioBacklit KeyboardAnd now, the review!:I have previously reviewed an older Dell 2-in-1 and was not too thrilled with the design.This new Dell 2-in-1, however, is a whole different story and extremely refreshing.  In fact, I would say this is a competitor to the Surface Pro 3 and Yoga 3 Pro - but Dell offers a similar experience for much less money.Dell made some outstanding design choices with the Dell Insprion 13 7000 Series.  First off, is the luxurious feel - the material it is made of feels almost velvety in texture and appears to be some plastic/rubber hybrid.  If you have ever held a Lumia 1020, the texture of this Dell is very similar to that.  The design is very attractive as well with tapered edges that give the laptop a premium look - again resembling the Lumia 1020 ironically.The screen is a touchscreen that works quite well and has 180 degree hinges similar to the Lenovo Yoga.  This allows the screen to be positioned in many ways or completely folded over to be used as a tablet.  The tablet cannot be detached and it is too heavy to hold in one hand, but it works well for lap or table usage.  Picture quality is outstanding and has some of the brightest and crispest images I've seen on a 2-in-1.The keyboard is backlit and both it and the touchpad is very responsive.  Dell really nailed it with the design.  The only suggestion I might make is that Dell adopt a charging design similar to the Surface 3 Pro as it does not put as much pressure on the charging port as a traditional plug.Performance is excellent, and seems even faster than the Surface 3 Pro although I will be doing more tests later to confirm this.  Everything is very responsive and I will be updating this review with benchmarks and more impressions over time.This PC is also a "Microsoft Signature" edition, meaning it does not have the unnecessary bloatware that often accompanies new PCs.  I was very excited about this as it means less to uninstall and better performance out of the box.Connectivity is outstanding with 3 full size USB 3.0 ports, 1 full size HDMI port and 1 full size SD reader (fantastic for photographers).  This bests the Surface Pro 3 by far.The Dell comes with a capacitive pen that fits neatly within the chassis; while this is not as accurate as a digitizer such as that found on the Surface Pro, for less demanding tasks it will likely do the job.  However for more demanding tasks like taking notes on OneNote, you need a digitizer such as Surface Pro's pen as the Dell's capacitive pen will not do.Speaker quality is about average laptop quality, but better than what is usually found on a tablet.Overall, I am extremely pleased with Dell's new 2-in-1.  I believe Dell has hit the right price point and focused on the most important things to include.  In addition, they have done a spectacular job with the fit and finish, ensuring your PC looks good in addition to running good.Highly, highly recommended for those shopping for a 2-in-1.  The decision of the Dell Inspiron 7000 series vs. the Surface Pro 3 should boil down to whether you want a device that is primarily a laptop that can function as a tablet (Dell Inspiron 7000) or a device that is primarily a tablet that can function as a laptop (Surface Pro 3).  You will likely be satisfied with either one, but the Dell will be a lot kinder to your wallet.

You will likely be satisfied with either one, but the Dell will be a lot kinder to your wallet.UPDATE: I like the Dell I reviewed so much I bought a 2nd Dell Inspiron 13 7000 Series laptop, model# i7347-50sLV !

This set comes packaged with the following:* Two paddles (natural wood finish with two-toned black/blue rubber coating on each paddle)* Retractable net* Three ping pong balls* Bag to hold paddles and ping pong ballsThis is a fine set.  What truly makes this set stand out is the well-engineered retractable net - it is extremely easy to setup on virtually any table size so long as the table is no thicker than 1.75" and no wider than 6'.  The net pulls out and retracts very smoothly/quickly and uses spring-loaded pushbutton rubber-coated clamps to hold the net to the table - thus you can set your game up without needing to use awkward screw clamps that might damage your table's finish.  I tested and found the clamps to be stable even on a table as thin as 0.75"!  So, in summary, you can set this up on almost any table in less than 10 seconds, making it extremely versatile.  The only improvement I might recommend is a lacquer on the wood handle to make the paddles a bit more comfortable to hold, but they also would be more slippery if a coating such as that was added so I am not sure that is the best idea anyway.Overall, this is a wonderful value for the price and would make a nice holiday gift if you have a friend or relative who likes Ping-Pong.  I also think it would be a great set for parties due to its ease of setup and durability.  Recommended.

The Diono Rainer Convertible Plus Booster with Adjustable Head Support arrived in a weighty cardboard box.  From the weight alone, I knew right away that this was going to be a quality product - and my intuition was spot-on.Opening the package, you are greeted with a well-packed booster seat that is basically fully-assembled (just a few minor elements to secure based on how you plan to use the seat).  Instructions are included that detail setup with both numbered steps and pictures, divided into sections based on how you plan to position the seat (varies depending on age of child).In terms of the cushioning quality, I only wish they made a car seat this comfortable when I was a child!  The material of the cloth feels soft yet durable with beautiful stitching to boot, and the cushioning feels like the memory foam you find on high-end mattresses.  I cannot express how premium the cloth and cushioning feels, and it looks very stylish as well (almost like a Ferrari seat.)  Surrounding the cushioning is thick metal and plastic to ensure maximum safety for the occupant.  Buckles and straps are of similarly high quality. The unit is literally built like a tank, yet includes features demonstrating the manufacturers attention to detail.Setup is quick and easy, with initial setup being an intuitive unfolding process and securing the seat to your car generally being a 4-step process (6-steps for some configurations).  Instructions are clear, detailed, and illustrated.Best of all, this is one device that will last you for some time.  It will work for both infants and young children, and every age in between.Overall, this appears to be one fantastic deal for the price.  While it does cost a bit more than other car seats, it is no doubt worth it given the premium build and materials.  As you will likely be using this seat for many years, does it really make sense to spend less for a seat that will wear out much quicker, be less comfortable for your child and be more difficult to setup?  I don't think that makes much sense, so if this seat is anywhere near your pricerange I would recommend pulling the trigger - I believe both you and your child will be extremely satisfied with the product.

The Best Place to be Today is colorful, informative, and overall fantastic book detailing events around the globe at the best times of the year to do them.  While it is impractical that one could actually use this book to plan event attendance on a daily or even weekly basis due to the events contained spanning the globe, it makes for a fantastic read and may give you some ideas for potential vacation destinations.  Or, simply to read about something interesting going on today you might not have known about thousands of miles away!As mentioned earlier, one of the books strengths is that it is very colorful, with half-to-full-page color photos contained throughout the book.  But, it also contains all the vital details of the event pictured as well as some interesting facts about it - so it is much more than just a book of interesting pictures.  Due to this, it makes a great coffee-table book.In summary, this is not so much an event planning book, as the events are spread too far in distance due to their global nature.  However, it can give you some travel ideas for an event you may want to attend at some point in the future - or allow you to learn more about what is going on around the world on any given day.Highly recommended for the avid explorer!

The George Foreman GR260P Classic is a great sandwich machine that brings back the classic feel and size similar to the very first George Foreman grill.This grill includes a drip tray but does not include the spatula that generally comes with foreman grills to assist with cleaning.  I do not find this to be an issue as the spatula never cleans everything up anyway, and hitting the surface with a paper towel does a much better job.One feature you might miss from more expensive Foreman grills is the lack of removable/washable trays in this device.  You cannot remove the tray and clean in the sink, instead you must clean the tray while it is inside the device.  On the plus side, this version has a lift built into the feet and does not require additional attachments to raise the rear legs like the original Foreman grill.Overall, this works well if you are in the market for a Foreman grill.  Removable trays would have been a nice touch to assist with cleanup, but I do not feel losing them is a dealbreaker.  Recommended!

The Canon VIXIA mini X enters the micro-camcorder space with a thunderous boom, as it offers fantastic user interface and flexibility that other devices of this form factor usually lack.The screen is a touch screen that can flip up, and even includes an accelerometer to ensure that the orientation is correct depending on its position.  This means you can use the screen as pictured aiming upwards, or you can flip it facing the back of the camera, or you can flip it facing the front of the camera.  It also works in all angles in between!  On top of this, the camera has an adjustable foot on the bottom to allow you to alter the angle of the camera.  Canon has obliterated the competition in user interface here and has set a new standard for other manufacturers to meet, I cannot reiterate how much better the interface is on this device than other devices in this class.In terms of microphones, it has two front-facing mics which should work great for most content.  The audio section completely blows away what you might hear in a GoPro.  I have used one Sony micro camcorder which has a slightly better audio section, but both are very satisfying.  A tripod mount is also included for optimal placement.The video quality is also fantastic, though the choice of lens may not work for all content.  Instead of choosing a rectilinear lens, this device uses a fisheye lens.  What this means is that straight lines may be curved near the edges of the frame.  While this works for applications such as sports, for other applications such as music videos or family videos the fisheye lens may be distracting.  The device also has an automatic lens cover when turning the device on/off which helps protect the lens when not in use.  Charging is completed with a proprietary cable, and while it is proprietary as a result it charges much faster than devices that use MicroUSB.So, in conclusion, the Canon VIXIA mini X is fantastic as long as the fisheye lens will not be a distraction for the type of content you plan to create.  For some types of content like sports, the fisheye lens is often actually preferred.  If this works for you, do not hestitate to pick up this device and remember to buy an SD card as the device does not include one.

Those starting out with photography often make the mistake of investing a large sum of money in "high quality" lenses and camera bodies, but fail to invest even modest amounts of money into the accessories that will allow them to get their most out of their equipment.The Datacolor Spydercube SC200 is an accessory that is definitely worth having if you wish to take your photography to the next level, as it is the ultimate white balance/grey card tool.  It is unique as not many manufacturers are making what is essentially a 3D white balance tool.  Simply, all you need to do is take a picture with this device in the scene prior to taking the photo you intend to take, and then use software in post to correct white/color balance following this.Using the Datacolor SC200 one can obtain an incredibly accurate whitebalance as the 3D nature of the cube gives your photo processing software more information than a flat grey card would - as it will essentially allow you to consider angle of light source. In addition, it will help prevent crushing blacks and blowing out whites given the multiple shades of color on the cube.The SpyderCube SC200 includes a tripod mount and also a loop to hang the device, giving you a number of options in placing the SC200.  The only other product I know of like this does not offer such flexible mounting options.The only downside to this product is that it may not be practical for all photo applications.  Every time you change the position of the camera or light source, you would need to take another photo with this in the scene.  So if you are frequently changing the location of the camera/scene, using this may be impractical.  However, for studio shoots or times when you will leave the camera in one spot for most of the shoot, this is an invaluable device to have in your arsenal.

Cash N Guns is like a game of cops and robbers, except everyone plays the robber in this game.In short, every game consists of 8 turns total.  Each turn goes like this:-Showing the players the available loot for the turn-Secretly selecting with a card whether you are going to load your gun with a bullet or a blank.  Each player gets 3 bullets and 5 blanks.-Selecting a target to shoot at with the included foam gun-Allowing targets to "lay down" (similar to folding in cards), if for instance you have 3 guns pointed your way-Flipping over the card which shows if you have a blank or a bullet in your gun-Players who get shot cannot collect loot for the turn and get a wound token, 3 wound tokens and you lose the game-Remaining players collect the loot (read the game rules for more info on this, as it is more involved)-Turn ends and next turn begins, repeats until 8 turns are complete-Player with the most loot who is still in the game at the end of 8 turns winsOverall, this is a tense and fun game, but you must make sure you have the right audience.  Some notes on this:-Some players in my game felt the minimum recommended age on the box of 10 years old was too low for this sort of game.  Some felt that 10 years old was too young to be pointing foam guns at friends and family members even if it was make-believe.  Perhaps 16-18 years old would be a better minimum recommended age.-Some players who are against guns in general may have an issue with this game obviously, since you are pointing foam guns at each other and shooting each other throughout the game.  So ensure players know beforehand what the game is going to be like.I have to give kudos to the company who made this as it is a risky move given the nature of the content.  However, for a group of college friends this game might be at the top of their list due to the fun and tense nature of the game.Highly recommended, but please make sure you have the right audience who can both handle this game and will not have an issue with the guns aspect of it.

***CUSTOMER NOTE: The below review was written with consideration of the PC/Mac setup application which is not included in the box and is currently in beta testing.  Chad Thompson (Sr Director of Marketing and Product Mgmt) informed me that he was willing to assist users seeking the PC/Mac app by giving them access to the beta version.  His email address (which he was okay with me posting) is cthompson@logitech.com - please send him an email if you wish to have access to the beta version of the PC/Mac application.The Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home is the latest and most powerful universal remote released by Logitech's Harmony team.  With this remote, Harmony aspired to create not only a device that can control your electronics, but also home automation "smart" devices.  In some ways, Logitech was largely successful in achieving these goals; in other ways, Logitech still has a ways to go.In my opinion, the Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home is ergonomically the best remote Logitech has released to date.  Some have commented that moving the transport play/pause/etc buttons to the top of the remote has made them more difficult to access, but I felt if holding the remote as intended it actually makes more sense this way.  While having the transport buttons at the bottom was best prior to the introduction of touch remotes, placing the buttons as close to the touchscreen as possible will yield easiest access.  Logitech has shaped the back of the Harmony Ultimate Home to make it easier for users to access all functions of the remote, and the balance is excellent.  Additionally, the remote's touchscreen allows for gestures (i.e. swipes) in addition to taps meaning that you can now control volume and other functions without having to take your thumb off the touchscreen if you wish.The specifications are also impressive.  The Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home allows for control of up to 15 devices including smart devices (thermostats, lights, etc) in addition to the electronics it traditionally allows for control of.  The remote operates on RF frequency meaning it will allow you to operate electronics that may be behind you or off to the side in a cabinet while still pointing the remote forwards.  The hub emits IR signals to your devices and if the hub is unable to reach your devices two IR blasters are included to supplement the hub.Thus, Logitech/Harmony largely succeeded in the features and specifications department.  However, the implementation of this device is where some may run into trouble.Upon release, the Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home required iOS/Android in order to setup and use even the most basic of functions with the product, making it the first ever Logitech/Harmony product to exclude PC/Mac/Web setup.  In addition, WiFi access is also required for the hub to operate properly.  Since release, Logitech/Harmony has listened to user feedback and is working to make the remote more compatible to allow setup for users who do not own iOS/Android devices or simply wish to use PC/Mac.  Currently, a PC/Mac setup application is in beta which allows users to set up the Harmony in the traditional fashion.However, even with the beta PC/Mac application currently the Home Automation features are not available unless you own an iOS/Android device.  The only Home Automation devices that will work are the Nest Thermostat and Philips Hue lights.  Logitech/Harmony has communicated to me that they are working on moving the user interfaces in the future for all of the Home Automation devices to the remote to allow one to control everything from the remote instead of requiring you to switch to your smartphone; note that this feature is not yet available even in beta though, so it will likely be a significant wait before those without iOS/Android are able to use the product to the full extent.Yet, even after everything is moved to the remote sometime in the future, Logitech/Harmony to date has expressed no plans to develop for Windows Tablets or Windows Phones.  While some Windows tablets like the Surface Pro will be able to use the setup application, they will not be able to use the actual device interfaces like iOS/Android tablets.  Additionally, some Windows ARM tablets like the standard Surface will be completely incompatible with the Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home as the only available Windows setup program requires an x86 processor.  Windows on phones also will be completely incompatible with the Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home.  This is somewhat troubling as several other competing home automation products support all three major mobile ecosystems instead of just the two largest as Logitech/Harmony has decided upon. Note that at the bottom of this review I have included a list allows you to see what you can expect the remote to do based on the devices you own.In summary, the Logitech Harmony Ultimate Home is a fantastic piece of hardware with software that is a work in progress.  Out of the box the device currently will not function at all without an iOS/Android device, however a PC/Mac beta application is available from Logitech/Harmony. Yet, even after said PC/Mac beta application is released, the user will still be unable to use all of the features of the remote without having an iOS/Android device.  In the future, Logitech/Harmony states this will change as they move functions to the remote, however this still fails to address support for the third major mobile ecosystem (Microsoft).I rate this product as 4 out of 5 stars due to the great hardware and potential of the device.  Hopefully, the promised features and applications that are unavailable to PC/Mac users out of the box will be publically released sooner rather than later.  And, if Logitech wishes to get that 5th star, I would recommend they develop applications for Tablets and Phones that run Windows.  As long as you are aware with the product's requirements and limitations prior to purchasing and are okay with them - and you are technologically saavy - this device will make a fine addition to your gadget collection!***DETAILED HARMONY ULTIMATE HOME FEATURES/REQUIREMENTS USING LATEST SOFTWARE SORTED BY USER DEVICERemote-only control with Windows x86/Mac PC setup-CAN control up to 15 Standard Devices via remote-CAN control Nest Thermostat and Phillips Hue Lights via remote-CANNOT control other home automation devices currently, but a future patch will allow for this per Harmony.iOS Smartphone/Tablet (i.e. iPhone/iPad)-CAN setup and control up to 15 Standard Devices-CAN setup and control Nest Thermostat and Phillips Hue Lights via remote-CAN setup and control other home automation devicesAndroid Smartphone/Tablet (i.e. Samsung Galaxy)-CAN setup and control up to 15 Standard Devices-CAN setup and control Nest Thermostat and Phillips Hue Lights-CAN setup and control other home automation devicesWindows on x86 Tablet (i.e. Surface Pro) [keyboard and mouse required]-CAN setup up to 15 Standard Devices, but CANNOT control them-CAN setup Nest Thermostat and Phillips Hue Lights, but CANNOT control them-CANNOT setup other home automation devices currently, but a future patch will allow for this per Harmony.Windows on ARM Tablet (i.e. Surface)-Incompatible with product in all aspects due to Logitech/Harmony not developing an app for this class of device.Windows on Phone (i.e. Lumia)-Incompatible with product in all aspects due to Logitech/Harmony not developing an app for this class of device.

As a pro photographer, one thing that becomes clear very quickly is that costs can add up quickly.  Accessories such as camera bags, flashes, light modifiers, memory cars, batteries, ND filters and CPL filters can all be quite expensive!When I first handled the Case Logic DSH-103 Luminosity Large Pro DSLR Holster, the first thing I thought of was one of my go-to camera bags - the Think Tank Digital Holster 40 V2.0 - and that is a good thing, as the Think Tank is a high quality bag which is a similar style of holster carrying case.  The holster-type designs are compact and make more sense for daily use than carrying around one of the larger "gadget bags" or camera backpacks.  Like the specific Think Tank case mentioned, with the bottom fully expanded the Case Logic DSH-103 can hold a "pro" DSLR (i.e. full frame DSLR with integrated or user-attached battery grip) along with up to a 24-70mm f/2.8 lens with hood in shooting position or a 70-200mm f/2.8 lens with hood in reversed position.  A thicker lens like the Canon 70-300mm f/4-5.6L should also fit fine in this bag.Case logic takes a similar overall approach with a top handle and shoulder strap.  There are several outer compartments - front, side and rear - giving this case more storage space than the Think Tank Digital Holster 40.  The Case Logic DSH-103 also includes a rain cover like the Think Tank case, and inner compartments to hold smaller items such as batteries and memory cards.  In addition, a velcro divider is included in case you want to use a smaller lens than the ones mentioned or to simply reduce movement in the bag.  When held, the Case Logic case also feels a bit better balanced than the Think Tank case.One large difference between the Think Tank Digital Holster 40 v2.0 and the Case-Logic DSH-103 is price; at the time of this review, the Think Tank product is $25 more expensive!  The extra cost does seem to prove worthy in some areas; the Think Tank product has smoother zippers and the case feels more rigid & sturdy, and the think tank product also can attach to Think Tank's belt systems in addition to being a standalone product.It is clear Case Logic has a winning product here.  They have created an experience that is very similar to one that costs much more money.  Now, while Think Tank does offer some quality improvements for that extra money, one must ask themselves if it is worth $25 for smoother zippers and more sturdy build.  In some cases it definitely might be, but if you are not a fulltime professional shooter I believe the Case Logic DSH-103 will do the job just fine for a lot less money.  After all, all those costly accessory prices add up to the cost you could be spending on a new lens!  Highly recommended for photographers looking for a great design without breaking the bank.

OXO again has come through with a very well built product.  The grip on the handle feels very good in the hand, and overall it is of solid construction.  The Silicone on the spatula portion is thick and appears designed to hold up in the long run.  This is a great product even if you already have a wooden or plastic spatula, as the silicon is a bit more flexible which might work better in some applications. Recommended.

My beard grows at a rapid pace, and as a result I usually have to use a straight razor to take care of it.  That is, until I tried the Philips Norelco 9700 shaver.  While I have owned Norelco shavers in the past with tilting blades, this is the first one I have tried that works in getting the hard to reach spots under my neck - this is likely because the blades tilt two ways instead of one.  In fact, this razor cuts so closely and so effortlessly (no hair pulling, no razor burn) that I am now going to switch back to electric shaving after years of buying expensive straight razor refills.  In fact, I would say under my neck this actually does a better job that a straight razor, and I use expensive brand name straight razors.  The Norelco works well both on dry skin and wet skin, again different from electric razors of the past.The 9700 also comes with a cleaning system/charging station that is very convenient despite it being a bit bulky. This system allows you to place your razor in the holder after a shave and it will ensure it is cleaned to keep the blades in best condition.  While I would not say this is necessary, it is a nice feature to have; whether or not you would use it would be if you have the space on your bathroom counter for it - the cleaning station is about as thick as a 2-liter bottle of soda and a little more than half as tall.  You can also easily clean the shaver with water since it is waterproof, but the cleaning solution works a bit better; the solution lasts for 3 months and refills are about $5.50 a cartridge - but again note this is OPTIONAL, you can just use water to clean this waterproof razor if you'd like to.The display for battery is very useful as it gives you exact feedback on how much battery life is left.  Though, if you use the cleaning station it will keep the razor charged up for you so no worries about having a dead shaver.  There are also buttons on the shaver to set the shave speed in three settings - low, medium, fast.  Using medium I found the shaver gives an excellent shave without being too aggressive.The razor also comes with a detachable beard trimmer - pulling off the main heads and attaching the beard trimmer is very easy.  However, I think a future model could improve upon the design by including an area on the cleaning station that holds the beard trimmer.  As is, since it is a loose part it may get lost easily - so I put it in the included shaver case to ensure it does not get lost.In summary, the Norelco 9700 has finally caught up with and in my opinion surpassed straight razors in terms of closeness of shave, and it does so while offering a more comfortable shaving experience.  While this razor does include a ~$22 year maintenance cost in changing the optional cleaning fluid, this is not required and you can just use water if to clean the razor - moreso $22/year is a lot less than you would be spending on straight razor blades.Well done Norelco, with the combination of close shave, comfortable grip, and overall fantastic shaving experience you have converted me back to electric shavers with this product!UPDATE: It has been a month using the product, and it is still performing as good as it did out of the box.  This is likely due to the cleaning system which reduces the oil buildup on the blades.  I generally use it when my face is dry to get the closest shave and this razor has remained my daily driver!UPDATE #2: I am still using the product regularly after some months.  However, I am alternating usage with a traditional razor depending on whether my face is wet or not.  If my face is dry, the Norelco is used as it does the best job; if my face is wet, I use a traditional razor as the Norelco does not shave as closely when my face is wet.  Still the best electric razor I've ever owned.

I'm always in search of authentic and great novels for students to read.  Sparkers by Eleanor Glewwe certainly did not disappoint.  Glewwe did a wonderful job of creating a story that takes the reader on a mythical journey to another world.  I was engrossed from Sparkers from day one due to this and also the fact that it touches on some of the social issues people are facing today.  Sparkers has complex yet relatable characters that would appeal to readers of all ages.  If you have a young adult reader you were thinking of buying this for, it will certainly keep them engaged and enthralled to the very end of the book - it may also get them to think about how some of the issues the characters are facing in the book might apply to our society today.  Highly recommended.

In Catch Phrase Decades, two teams (2 players per team minimum) are pitted against one another to see who is best able to communicate with their team member in order to have them guess the word being described.  If your team member can guess the word you are trying to describe, you pass the unit to the other team and they have to start with a new word; this goes back and forth until the buzzer sounds on the unit, at which point the team who is not holding the unit gets a point, or two points if they can guess the word the losing team could not.  You are not allowed to say part of the word being guessed, a word that rhymes with the word being guessed, or the first letter of the word being guessed.In other words, it is a variation of The $20,000 Pyramid that alternates between teams.  This particular version of Catch Phrase is divided into decade categories from the 70s-10s.  I found the words to be unique and appropriate for each decade category, although there are a lot of names that range from political figures to TV shows - so it is more challenging than the original Catch Phrase.In terms of the unit, build quality is very good with strong plastics that look like it will hold up over time.  Buttons on the unit work well, and it requires 3 AAA batteries (not included) to power.  I really don't have any complaints with the functionality of the unit, other that if you make a mistake adding team scores you need to clear the scores and start over (holding both team score buttons) instead of just having plus/minus point buttons.Overall, a fun game to play with friends and family.

If you look on Amazon, you will find two versions of Twister.  Hasbro (who owns Twister) apparently decided that Twister needed a makeover, and released a new version with modern box art and a circular spinner; however, they licensed the classic box art and spinner design to the company Winning Moves, who manufactures this version of Twister with the classic art.  The Mat is also slightly different in its lettering style and placement.I have not tried the other "remixed" version of Twister so I cannot speak to how the two compare in terms of build and quality, but this version is everything I remember Twister being.  Personally, I like the this classic design better than the new design which just seems a bit generic.Bottom line, if you want the classic Twister box and spinner artwork, get this version.

This is a fantastic product to ensure your lenses are autofocusing product and apply AFMA if they are not.Yes, you can get a somewhat similar result by printing your own chart off the internet and using that as a reference, but the Datacolor SpyderLensCal is much superior as it offers a high quality plastic that will not bend like cardboard and is extremely easy to setup.In addition, this product offers both the ruler and directly next to it a high contrast target; this can help if the autofocus center point of your camera is not sensitive to horizontal lines, as is the case with many cameras (even some high end ones).With this, I was able to confirm my f/1.2 lenses were autofocusing properly, and I found testing with this product easy and repeatable.  It has a tripod mount as well.Overall, a great buy and the durable plastic is much nice than the flimsy cardboard competing systems in the same pricerange offer.

Crucial has done it again. After their widely successful m4, they have now released this drive.The M500 is even faster than the M4 and offers new encryption features for corporate usage.  It is the best speed/features/value ratio that exists on the market today.  I opted for the 480GB version, but one can easily buy a massive 960GB version for under $500.  That is an unheard of price point, and I applaud Crucial for getting us there.Can't wait for the inevitable 2TB SSDs to arrive, maybe in 2014-2015! :)

This lens can be the best of the best, or very troublesome, depending on the copy you get.Mine happens to be perfect from my testing so far, but I have read a slew of reports of some of these lenses have clicking sounds when zooming in and out.  Not acceptable QC for such an expensive lens.Also, it would have been nice to add IS to this lens for video use again given the cost.  However, for photos IS in this focal length is much less crucial than say in a 70-200.If you want the best of the best 24-70, though, this is the one to get.  Amazing edge to edge sharpness, speed, color and contrast!

While there are Canon wide lenses that offer superior corner performance such as the TS-E lenses, this lens is nice as it offers a flexible focal length range of 16-35mm.  This allows you to capture everything in the ultrawide-wide focal length.  Thus you are not risk at missing a more close-up opportunity when trying to get in an ultrawide shot.Sharpness wise, it is a compromise most definitely, but it is worth this compromise for the extremely useful zoom range of this lens.Recommended, unless you need edge-to-edge sharpness - where I'd recommend a TS-E lens instead.

I use mine with a Steroid Speed Belt.  It is a bit of a pain to get all the straps set right, but once they are set the first time it is very easy to take off and on with minimal adjustment needed.  Highly recommended for event photographers.

This lens is a massive, eye-opening improvement from the original EF 24mm F/2.8.  Sharpness is dramatically improved, flare reduced, improved color, and IS added.  At this focal length, IS is less useful for general shooting, but still can be used for certain types of specialty shots and video.Also, while it is not as sharp as the EF 24-70 f/2.8L II in the corners at f/2.8, it is MUCH smaller and lighter than that lens.  And, at f/4 and above (where you'd most likely use it) it basically matches the performance of the EF 24 f/2.8L II and EF 24 f/1.4L.  In fact, in some ways it exceeds them in terms of being much less prone to flare than either of the more expensive L lenses.Thus, I am quite impressed with this lens.  It is not the best quality 24mm that exists, but it certainly is the best under $1000 and it offers a level of portability that higher priced 24mm lenses do not.

This is a fantastic protective filter for the following reasons:* Easy to clean* Neutral color balance* Slim filter prevents vingetting* Threads allow for usage of lens cap or addt'l filter* Minimal flare* Works fantastic with the EF 16-35 II and EF 24-70 IIB+W quality really shines here.  The B+W 007M is the *only* protective filter I trust for my lenses.

This hood is just "okay" for the price.  It comes packed in with the 16-35mm f/2.8L II but is not quite a perfect fit and sometimes requires a bit of reseating to get it on the lens.  It seems perhaps it was manufactured a bit off spec from the actual threads on the lens and thus does not work as smoothly as any other Canon lens hood I've owned.  Once its on, it does its job, but one would think that for a professional lens the fit would be better than it is.
I ordered this product not knowing exactly how it would look in person, but it looks amazing!  Can't wait to give it to my SO for the holidays!!!

This is a perfect sized pouch for my EF 16-35 II and is great for events as the drawstring makes it very easy to pull the lens out and swap it.  My only complaint is that the rain protection cover appears small and insufficient.  It is very clear that some moisture will enter the lens changer as the flap designed to cover it does not have any velcro to hold it in place.Otherwise, another great product from Think Tank for event photographers.

I use this Holster along with the 30 for my 24-70 II and 70-200II respectively during events.  It performs admirably in allowing for quick swapping of cameras and is immensely useful for events.  I prefer this over other type of "holsters" like the spider belt as it actually protects the camera+lens instead of having it swing around loose & unprotected.  Highly recommended.

This case is perfect for the Canon EF 70-200 II on a full frame camera without a battery grip.  It is extremely easy to grab your camera and start shooting with the hood in place, increasing your chances of getting the perfect shot in time.  Works well with the Think Tank Steroid Speed Belt and other accessories like the Strobe Stuff pouch.  Highly recommended!

Like the rest of the Think Tank belt pouches, the Strobe Stuff pouch gets the job done.  It has plenty of room for a flash plus other accessories and is not much more bulky than the case that comes with the 600EX-RT.  Given its ease of use on a Think Tank belt, this product is really a no brainer if you have one of their belts.  Highly recommended.

This is a great companion hood for the EF 35mm F/2 IS USM.  It is constructed sturdily and has a nice felt lining.  It also has a lock switch to ensure easy connect and prevent accidental disconnect.However, for USD $60 it is a bit of a stretch to say that it is a good value.  Given the product, this should be priced no more than $39.99.  So it loses a star for price.Otherwise, nice hood!

Combined with the shoulder straps, this belt is great as it offers very sturdy support for expensive camera gear.  I have personally not seen a more rugged belt than this one in all of my research.Some complain that unlike the regular speed belt you cannot shift gear 360 degrees due to the back ring, and that is true.  However, this was not an issue for me, 180 degree rotation on each side was just fine.  I appreciate the sturdiness of this belt and will give up the 360 degree rotation for this easily.It is a bit of a pain to get adjusted at first, but once you set it up right it is extremely easy to use.  Highly recommended.

Cyberlink PowerDirector 12 Ultimate is the top of its class, currently competing against offerings such as Nero Video, Corel VideoStudio, and Adobe Premiere Elements.  Unlike those other offerings, Cyberlink here was able to offer both a wide featureset and a high level of polish.  Nero and Corel both have a good (though not as comprehensive) featureset, but are not quite as intuitive to use, while Adobe Premiere Elements seems a bit light in the feature department.  Cyberlink's offering appears to better balance features, polish, and stability.While it is at the top of its class, I did not give PowerDirector 12 five stars as it is missing numerous filters that would be of use to professional videographers.  Thus, this software is not a low cost substiture for professionals - but it does get the job done for enthusiasts, amateurs, and semi-pros.  Professionals would still want to go with something like Adobe Premiere Pro CC.  But in this price bracket, highly recommended!

TAPPLE is simple yet loads of fun.  It is similar to Scattergories, except without the need for pencils, paper, etc.  And, this game requires you to think more on your feet.Very simply, one must think of all the words that fit into a given category, and players go turn by turn naming a word eliminating a potential letter each time.  You have only 10 seconds to answer, so sometimes something really obvious might escape your mind due to the pressure.  The game makes a tick-tock sound for the 10 seconds which can rattle some players!The great part about this game is that it is fast paced and does not require any setup.  Just pull out the cards and go.  The bad part I would say is very easy for someone to make up an answer/cheat and you don't really have time to call them on it due to the 10 second timer.  Of course, you can always deal with cheaters as you wish! ;)Anyway, highly recommended for fun times without all the setup/cleanup hassle of many board games.  You don't even need to keep the box it comes in, the unit itself even has a compartment for the cards!

I am a pro photographer that primarily shoots photos of people, and I was really interested in learning advanced techniques in posing models.  Sure, you can look some stuff up online, but most of what you find is pretty dated and general in nature.This book is quite simply a fantastic resource!  In addition to verbose text explaining all types of different poses & do's and dont's, you get full color photos of example poses - as well as sketches that really drive home what the author is explaining.You never know what you are going to get when you buy a book, but I found this one tremendously helpful. If you are looking to get more into posing models, pick up a copy of this today!!NOTE: I reviewed the paperback edition, I have no experience with the Kindle edition.

UPDATE: Dell still has not yet fixed the Windows 8.1 driver bug as of 3/8/14.  The problem is quite obvious, sensor indicators show that the accelerometer only recognizes one X/Y axis in Windows 8.1, while both X/Y axis work with the Windows 8 drivers.  So, unless there is a firmware driver update or new release for the accelerometer, this laptop's rotational capabilities will continue to be hindered in Windows 8.1.NOTE BEFORE READING: This review will be updated potentially with a 5-star review if DELL is able to rectify the significant problem this tablet has with the new Windows 8.1 update; I am currently working with Dell support towards a solution. However, at this point in time, I cannot give it more than 3 stars due to the severe nature of the bug.***DELL has created quite an innovative product here, with a screen that can flip - allowing you to convert the laptop to a tablet or work on the backside of the screen. So if you were sitting behind a desk and had a coworker on the other side of the desk, you could theoretically just flip your screen and show the coworker your work with ease. This allows for positions similar to the Lenovo Yoga, except Dell's design has more engineering grace than Lenovo's - when in tablet mode, the Lenovo has its keys on your lap while the Dell simply has the bottom of the machine.  Also, to use the screen backwards, the Lenovo requires an awkward balancing act while the Dell just flips.  So all of this is good, EXCEPT that this machine has a massive bug with Windows 8.1 which has a 7+ page thread on Dell's support forum right now as it affects all users.  Unfortunately, this bug is with the innovative screen; with Windows 8.1 when the screen is flipped, 80% of the time one of two things happens - either it will flip the wrong way (into portrait mode instead of secondary landscape), or it will not flip at all becoming nonresponsive.  This is with all of the latest updates and even a hotfix Dell made available, none of which resolve this issue.  This puts a huge dent into the score as one might imagine, since the screen flipping is one of the primary draws of this device - if you are not going to use it, you might as well get a regular laptop.  I will update this review on this aspect if Dell remedies the problem, which will likely require new drivers or firmware for the accelerometer.That rather unfortunate issue aside, lets talk about some of the other aspects of this laptop.  The weight is good for a laptop, but feels MUCH heavier than the typical 10.6" tablet - of course this is a 12.5" laptop with a full Intel Core i5 processor and a real SSD, thus more weight is to be expected.  Overall, for a laptop the weight and size is good enough, as one would likely not be using this device as a portable tablet - it is more designed to be used as a primary PC workhorse.  The build is solid, even the flipping screen looks like it could withstand some abuse.  Screen quality is beautiful.The processor is one of the more power-efficient Intel Haswell processors, though not the most power efficient Y variation.  Still, battery life is great at 8 hours, approaching tablet offerings despite the dramatically horsepower improvement the Dell XPS 12 offers.  It comes with Intel HD4000 graphics, and overall this laptop is FAST!RAM is at 4GB, which is a bit on the skimpy side for the amount this costs.  I would have liked to see 8GB as standard given this tablet's cost and the fact that the RAM is not upgradable; another option could be making the RAM socketed so it is user upgradable, as more demanding applications such as video editing will be bogged down by 4GB.  However, most typical work software like Office and Photoshop will do just fine with 4GB.Storage is a bit rough on this laptop as well, but doable.  The SSD is an mSATA 128GB drive, with no SD slot in the laptop.  So, if you did need to increase your space you would have to open the lid and replace the SSD, which is not an easy effort for a novice. So again, make sure 128GB will be enough for you, if not get the 256GB model.  Or, you could upgrade the drive if you are an expert, but this may void the warranty.  128GB might be fine for a tablet, but this is likely going to be someone's primary machine given the weight and size, thus I think it is a bit on the small size for this market.One other note on lack of SD slot - I am a photographer thus I use SD cards all the time.  But, the SD standard is constantly changing, so it is very possible an SD reader this year will fail to read the fastest cards released 2 years from now.  So, though this lacks SD slot, in my opinion this is not a huge deal since it likely would be rendered outdated in time, requiring an external reader anyway.  The two USB 3.0 ports ensure your card reader has speedy transfer rates, I used a Lexar Pro SD/CF reader with this model.Keyboard is simply fantastic, I love using it.  The trackpad is good, and I had no issues using it at all.So the final question, should you buy it?  If Dell can fix the screen rotation drivers for Windows 8.1 and you are looking for a powerful laptop with flexible screen display options, the answer is a resounding YES!  This laptop just feels great all around.  On the other hand, if you are looking for a tablet to handhold, this device will be too heavy for you - I'd recommend instead the Dell Venue 11 Pro, which is available with a similar CPU and is a lot lighter but with smaller screen.In the end, though, until those screen rotation drivers are fixed it is difficult to recommend this laptop to anyone. It is frustrating when you spend a large sum of money on something and the main selling point fails to work anywhere near as well as advertised, and this is evident in the Dell support forums right now.  If Dell can fix this one problem, I would easily give this 5/5 stars.  Will keep everyone posted and update the review if/when there is a fix!

I cannot describe how wonderful the picture quality is for this camera.  Photos come out spectacular even with extreme low light circumstances, and the center point works great for focusing in low light; using a 70-200 f/2.8 paired with this camera I am able to take pictures in near total darkness and still get ability to autofocus w/ output images nearly free of noise.  It has a large enough buffer to take bursts of RAW+JPG without slowing down like cheaper cameras, and build quality is fantastic.  This camera feels great in the hand!In terms of weaknesses, the autofocus system on this camera is dated with 11 autofocus points only 1 of which is cross-type.  This means it has far less cross-type sensors than a Canon Rebel T5i which costs less than half the price.  That being said, the autofocus does work fine for weddings, regular people shots, and landscapes.  In a scenario with sports or one that requires constant tracking, you will likely be disappointed, though.  So if you want a sports camera, this is not it!  For other general events it is great.Another weakness is the lack of joystick or touchscreen.  This is an issue as previewing pictures is a bit of a chore using the directional arrows to zoom around images.  If the camera had a touchscreen or joystick, moving the zoomed area around would be much easier.  The lack of joystick also makes changing the autofocus point more of a hassle, though you probably want to be using center point only most of the time.Finally, contributing to the loss of a star was the EOS Remote Utility. The PC version was a bit of a hassle to install (you need to turn off your firewall to link it up) and there is no app for Lumia Windows Phone & Surface 2 which is disappointing.In summary, the output of this camera is incredible as is the build quality.  But a dated autofocus system and clunky interface means it is no replacement for the 5DIII.  Still, for the money it is an excellent deal, so I would give it 4/5 stars!

This lens hood is of low build quality and poor design.  Instead of screwing on like most lens hoods, this one awkwardly clips on, resulting in a wobbly affair.  The tabs that hold it on also look as if they would break with regular use.  Not recommended.

This lens is one of the finest in the Canon arsenal.  It is built like a tank and takes stunning pictures.Connected to a Canon 6D, I was able to zoom to 200mm in *near total darkness*, focus, and a take a picture with extremely low noise.  The light gathering abilities for this lens are unheard of.Picture quality is beautiful, with bright colors that pop off your photos and IS to assist with camera shake.The lens is heavy, though.  Plan to get a strap or holster for it as it will likely tire out your arm/neck with extended use.I would highly recommend this lens to professionals who need a telephoto zoom lens that shoots in low light.  Hobbyists,  enthusiasts, and hikers might want to consider the 70-200 f/4L IS or 70-300 f/4-5.6L IS instead.  I say this as the weight and size is probably not something that you'd want to put up with unless you really need those low light shots for a job.But, it does live up to the hype... quite amazing!

While one may be tempted to buy a third party battery due to the high price of a Canon battery, spending money on a real Canon battery is a VERY wise investment.Third party batteries may not hold as much of a charge, may require more frequent replacement, and can even cause fires and equipment damage.  After spending all that money on a DSLR, the battery is not a place you'd want to skimp even if tempting.One star knocked off for the price, as Canon tends to run high on accessories prices.

This camera bag is great - highly flexible, tons of removable/adjustable dividers for bodies/lenses, a slew of pockets inside and out!  It can easily hold 2 bodies with lenses attached plus another few lenses on top of that.  The only downside to this bag is that it is nowhere deep enough for a 70-200, thus one must lay a 70-200 on its side.  While that is no big deal, you do lose some of the usable space putting a lens on its side.  Still, this bag is just big enough that it is not cumbersome and one can arrange the organizers to their needs.  Highly recommended.

This flash is a winner.  I actually have three of them!  By using the radio transmission feature of this flash, one can link multiple 600EX-RTs together without needing any optical path between them.  That means I can put one on my camera, and the other two in softboxes and like a pocket wizard you can remotely trigger them.The flash itself is VERY bright and adjustable on the back of the unit, along with adjustable diffusion based on zoom ratio.  AF assist beam works perfectly.I can't really think of any criticism of this device, even the price is fair given the quality and featureset.  Highly recommended!

This is a fantastic keyboard for Windows 8.1, especially when paired with a traditional mouse such as the Logitech Touch Mouse T400.  Using the trackpad on this device for gestures/scrolling/pinch to zoom and then a traditional mouse for work that requires more precision, you will have a wonderful Windows 8 experience.  While most keyboards are too large for this type of setup, by eliminating the numpad, a trackpad was able to be fit.  Thus, you can get the gesture control of a trackpad and buy an additional mouse for pointer precision.  Give it a shot!

The VisibleDust Sensor Loupe does a great job at making dust easy to see on your sensor... Wow is it bright!  In fact, maybe a bit too bright - you can get a headache using this with the bright LED lights.  That aside, it does exactly what it is supposed to perfectly - illuminate dust.  My only criticism is the build quality is a bit iffy.

This monopod is light, sturdy, and easily attached to the tripod screw of your camera/lens.  It can extend or retract to give quite a range of height options.  Otherwise, not much to say other than it gets the job done!  Only thing that would have been nicer is if it came with a carrying case.

While this device may not aerate as well as a more expensive battery powered aerator, it does a fine job at passive wine aeration.  I did a blind taste test and was easily able to identify the wine that was aerated with this device.  In addition to aerating wine, it also acts as a pouring device which has less chance to spill than just pouring wine regularly.  Finally, the device functionally works quite well, inserts/removes easily yet snugly, and is easy to clean - just run under hot water.If you are in the market for an aerator and want to try something a bit different, give this a shot - it does the job and makes pouring easier!

This Mead organizer is for the most part high quality and very functional.  There was some stray ends in the stitching, but nothing that effected the product.  One can use this for various functions, such as having a pouch for each individual student or perhaps different subjects.  Overall I really liked this product, but I deducted one star because it failed to include labels that would properly fit the pouches.  Thus, one must cut out their own labels - which is not a huge deal, but it would look more professional if it came with pre-cut labels that fit the product like the other Mead product I reviewed did.  Still, a great help for the classroom!

This is perfect to carry around all day in your purse as its so light yet so easy to use.I opened it and was using it within 2 minutes as it synched with my Ipad in seconds.Another nice feature of this keyboard is that it has a nice slant on it and great value for money
Total waste of time and money this thing does not hold a charge and connecting to anything takes forever.Daughter was so upset with it I had to go and purchase a kindle instead

This is our 2nd RO system. The first one was OK and reduced the chemicals from water and a bit better taste than cities Tap Water. But there's pain of installation, the confusing instructions, and the unhelpful customer support. After one year we decided to search and give other products a try. iSpring RCC7 was easy to install, clear instructions, their customer service are very helpful and attentive.  With this RO system we confirmed that almost all the chemicals from cities Tap Water was eliminated. The water taste so much better. Big thanks to iSpring. This RO system is SUPERB.

The touch screen performs incredibly well, and to this point, I have experienced immediate response. To the point where I have to say touch response so far is indistinguishable from my IPad. My books loaded immediately and easily from the cloud and I really like the functionality of the reader. However, if you want an amazing tablet but don't want to spend as much, then these new HD 6 & 7 series are great! For me and my uses, the HD 6 is the perfect fit.

The recipes look quick and easy to prepare: most have 4-5 steps tops and the ingredient lists aren't too long. The authors offer simple advice and knowledge on how things work, what the low-and-slow method can and can’t do for your food (it won’t brown the meat, for instance) and how to get started so it is as easy as possible. You will learn what things you should avoid and more importantly what foods should be added to your diet. I found this cookbook to be greatly informative and I’m looking forward to all the new possibilities for more satisfying gluten free meals.

This book provides many helpful techniques, tips, and exercises to help a person enhance their memories. The content of this book is not focused on memorizing vocabulary for school (although, I’m sure it would help), but presents a more comprehensive approach to memory improvement in general. I especially liked that this book explains memory with enough detail to drive home the crucial information without overdoing it ad nauseum. It also included information about how things such as nutrition, smoking, and exercise can affect your memory in addition to the very useful and detailed methods for increasing memory.

I'm already into my second week and I feel great from within. The best part is that I don't have to give up on any of my favorite foods, specially dessert. The easy to follow week by week eating plans are extremely helpful. They help me keep moving. I love the smoothies and grilled aspragus! This book was definitely a 'waist saver'. I cannot recommend this book enough tot hose of you who also struggle with weight gain and loss. It works fantastic! I am on my way to a slimmer, fitter, sexier me!

For a quick guide, The author does a great job at going into very important details. It is clear and concise and gives any slow cooker novice the information needed to get started cooking!Once you're feeling confident enough to try I recommend the honey mustard chicken and veggies for a healthy dinner treat . Larson explains that slow cooking relies on a sealed closed environment to cook food unlike microwave cooking which relies on dry heat it is moist and fresher to prepare food this way . Great find!

The book begins with a very nice explanation about herbal medicine and all the different herbs used and their medicinal properties. This is very helpful for someone like me who does know herbal therapy in so much detail. I have used numerous recipes from the book, and they are wonderful. Homemade remedies for acne, dry skin, coughs, sniffles, etc. I am very enthusiastic when it comes to such types of medicines, as I do not trust what the hospitals and doctors give us now a days. This book also helps you learn how to grow your own herbs, and make them flourish. A very handy book indeed!

This is a very cool and unique bracelet. You don't see many bracelets with knots in them, much less this type of knot. This is a really cool design and easily my favorite. Oddly enough, while you would think that the rope would chafe after a while, I have had no negative experiences with this bracelet. I am greatly impressed!

I have never been the kind of person who people would describe as a "motivated self-starter." I'm more the type of person who puts off doing exercise or who would rather let someone else at work lead a project. But, I realized that my lack of motivation was leading me down a path of mediocrity. I needed a "jolt" and Shawn Doyle's Jumpstart Your Motivation gave me 10 of them. After reading this book and applying the principles outlined, I have been able to lead a much happier and more successful life. I have taken on more duties at my job (an advertising firm) and I have been promoted once and am up for another promotion in the near future. I exercise more and am generally brighter and cheerier. Waking up is no longer a chore for me.In my search for motivation, I also found a book by the name of 21 Things You Should Give Up To Be Happy. Most people don't like to give things up, but if you read this book, you'll understand why letting some things go is a valuable component of a healthy, happy lifestyle. No, this book isn't about giving up your TV. Its advice is much more practical. One of the chapters in the book is entitled "Give Up Complaining." It's easy to get into a spiral of whining and moaning and groaning, but complaining will get you nowhere. Making an actionable change to your situation is the best way to avoid complaints of any kind. For instance, if there was a 1-ton boulder headed straight toward you, you wouldn't just complain it away. You would move and let it pass by. Sometimes, finding that motivation to get out of the way isn't easy, though.That's why having both of these books is an important step to finding motivation and finding happiness. I know that I am a considerably happier person because I've found these books. Don't be like me and sit around and wait for life to happen to you. There are plenty of things you can do to jumpstart your personal and professional lives, and the answer may be in these books. I know the answers were there for me.

Favorite Quotes:“There was a visceral connection between them, forged in betrayal and hate, and – despicable though it was – it belonged only to them.  There was a heat to hate, and intimacy to it that made her heart race, a passion to it that attracted her like a doe to a salt lick.”“I can’t think about anything but you.  I dream about you.  I have imaginary conversations with you.  I go to YouTube and replay that press conference kiss over and over again to torture myself because I can’t get enough of seeing you in my arms, melting into me.”“She didn’t realize it took only a few perfect words for a heart to grow wings and soar, but hers did… In three short sentences he’d given her the greatest compliment of her life, and she took a moment to bask in his words and feel them from the top of her head to the tips of her toes… before reality set in.”“She’d been raised in a place of want.  Of just enough and no more.  She’d never known what it felt like to wildly fantasize about something you really wanted and then to actually receive it.  But if this was it, it felt like being launched up into the night sky and floating, soaring, free-falling back to earth, all the while knowing you’d land somewhere soft.”“I knew I loved you because I was willing to get hurt… And I knew because the minutes I spent with you made all the other minutes feel empty.”My Review:Katy Regnery is my Go-To author when I am in need a pick me up or something sweet.  She has never failed to give me that highly desired HEA.  Her writing is so smooth and has such a nice flow that it is essentially effortless to read.  Not that her stories are all sunshine and rainbows for the characters, but the observations are always insightful and the endings are always satisfying.

Favorite Quotes:“He had a pirate smile, the kind that you’d mortgage your house for; just to be able to afford the gold teeth in his mouth.”“I waved my arms like helicopter propellers.  My hips began to do the hula hoop… The crowd was now staring at me as I dominated the dance floor.
